review.des:
So, I think that there is no much left to say about this place; I mean it has more than 7k reviews and basically 5 starts... I just can say the food was delicious and the service was excellent. I have to say (if it is not obvious for you right now) you need a reservation, and I am not talking about 3 days in advance, plan ahead.

The food was so good, first the calamari bruschetta, and crisp braised pork shank were just AMAZING, being my favorite without any doubt, the calamari, I could eat that over and over, it was just fantastic! (the pork was also really really good but just not my favorite), the sourdough was also pretty good; although I do have to say that roasted beets were just a disappointment.

But you have to go here and give it a try, it's one of the best restaurants in
Chicago

It's good.

Interior is well designed, and the food is interesting.

It's one of those nice, posh, yuppie, tapas places where you go to feel fancy. Don't get me wrong, I am a yuppie myself and I fully enjoyed my meal, but it's more of a novelty for me.

Go here for a date or something, not if you're ravenously hungry.

This place is legit! It was pretty busy when we went, but we were able to get a seat by the entrance right away since it was just the two of us.

Zack was our server. He was very pleasant and knowledgeable about the menu.

We ordered the Brioche bread that was warm fluffy and came with some delicious whipped salmon cream and some spicy pickled peppers. Delicious! I could have eaten two of these on my own.

We also ordered the Crispy short ribs. It was served with avocado, radishes, red onion, and some tangy dressing. My favorite dish of the night!

The Goat empanada  sounded interested and since we were at the girl and the goat, we figured we had to order at least one goat dish. It came with miso dressing and some pickled mushrooms. It was pretty good, but on the smaller portion size.

Our veggie dish was the Roasted cauliflower. It is served with Mint, pine nuts, and pickled peppers (same as the ones that came with the brioche bread). This was a pretty solid dish, we ate the whole thing!

The last thing we ordered was the Bucatini. It was udon style (thick flour) noodles with milk braised pork. Unfortunately this was my least favorite dish. The pork was a little dry and the flavors were a little too much (it was like they were competing with each other, not melding together).

Solid 4 start meal, service, and ambiance. I'd definitely recommend it to people and I'd definitely want to come back when I'm in town next! Yum!

Four of us went for dinner -  one a vegetarian, one who can't eat fish and two that will eat almost anything. We started with drinks. Excellent selection and production. We shared eight plates. Everything from the Sweet Corn Pierogies to the Wood Oven Roasted Pig Face. All excellent. If I had to pick two favorites - the Goat Ribs and the Shishito Peppers (covered with Parmesan cheese!). Oh, eight dishes were too much - especially with a bottle of wine. Six would probably cover a group of four.

Great atmosphere and wonderful, friendly and helpful service. Definitely, a place to go many times.

Absolutely delicious restaurant worth coming to! The only downside is the wait if you don't have a reservation. We waited around 2 hours to be seated, however once we got our food it was all worth it.

We had ordered the goat empanadas, crispy duck tongues, the sea bass, and pig which were all amazing. My favorite was definitely the duck tongues cause it was so crunchy and mixed so well with the poke.

This is a restaurant that's a must try!

The food is fabulous but the "energy level" is way over the top to be able to enjoy a conversation. My husband and  I are  foodies and go out three to four times a week. I feel that going out to dinner should be to enjoy delicious food, a great bottle of wine and a stimulating conversation. Even though we totally enjoyed the food we'll never return due to the noise level.
Kathi

Went for a girls night out and all the great reviews are on point. We started indoors on the couches near the bar where service was sluggish but cocktails (The Jam) were superb. Moved outdoors to a table and Kalee was an excellent server. Squash blossoms and lamb ribs a huge hit. Lovely dry rosé by the glass at a reasonable $12.

Highly recommend and would absolutely go back next time I'm in town.

Pretty hard to get a reservation here, and I'm not entirely sure why. The food is good, but not great and there really weren't any standout dishes that make me need to come back asap.

We came in at 5:30 on a weekday, and the wait was already 1.5 hours for 2 people. Luckily we were able to grab the last open seats at the bar and start our meal. After hearing out the recommendations from the server, we ended up with the following order: chickpea fritters, seared diver scallops, crispy beef short ribs, crispy braised pork shank, goat empanadas, goat neck.

Let's go in order here. The fritters themselves were very good, amazing texture with a good crisp on the outside and a smooth luxurious filling. The flavor profile was a bit odd here with quinoa, feta, and tahini. Lots of different flavors in there that sort of worked but wasn't convincing. The seared diver scallops were cooked perfectly, but as with the fritters, there was a lot going on here. There were beets, beet soaked blood orange, pistachios, and other good stuff. Good dish but not in love with the flavors. The crispy beef short ribs were probably my favorite dish of the night. On the outside they look well done and overcooked, but once you cut into them they are juicy and delicious. The sauce worked and this dish went quickly. The crispy pork shank was my second favorite dish - no frills here, just a great (and huge) fall off the bone shank, with awesome crispy skin and juicy meat. Served with naan and some other stuff, I made naan wraps out of it with the red sauce (it was also served with buttermilk dressing and kimchi, neither of which I was excited about). The goat dishes were some of the weakest - the empanadas were decent and I loved the mushrooms there, but nothing exciting, and the goat neck fell flat. It was dry, lacking flavor, and a huge portion which we didn't get close to finishing.

Overall a good meal, but not something worth waiting 1+ hour for (to me). The service is great though, very attentive and my water was always refilled timely.

Holy crap!  Why have we not gone here earlier?!?!  This was an amazing amazing dinner. We had the chickpea fritters, deep fried oysters with deviled egg, the pig face, escargot ravioli (MY ABSOLUTE FAVORITE), Duck tongues (spectacular), and a special (which honestly, I can't remember because it was subpar). The service was impeccable and the Old Old Fashioned was a great drink!  I literally was an amazing dinner that won't be forgotten.

Now the bad.... the bathroom is in the basement, down dark stairs (I have crappy sight)- not cool. Even with the railing, you have to be careful. And then when you get there....there are a bunch of doors that are lit up... which one is the bathroom? Why knows. And which one is the men's and woman's?  That took me to ask yet another person.  Small potatoes compared to the amazing dinner.

Food was amazing!

*Reservation HIGHLY recommended. If not, come early!

We arrived prime dinner time on our first night and was told our wait would be 2+ hours. We opted to come back another night at an earlier time since we saw a lot of people waiting around the bar for a table as well. The next evening, we arrived shortly after they opened and were seated right away as long as we were able to be finished by 7pm for their reservation. We had 1.5hrs, so we were totally ok with that. It was nice as it wasn't crowded yet. Our waitress was very nice and gave us recommendations and suggestions on what is most popular and approx. how many dishes to order.

Drinks:
All Becomes One $13- looks like all their cocktails are quite a delight. This one has absinthe, aloe vera, earl grey crema, etc.
Metroprolitan Flywheel $7 (Pilsner on draft)

Vegetarian/Fish/Meat dishes: Let me just say, you can't go wrong with anything! Everything was so good!!
Sauteed green beans $12- The sauce made the whole appetizer so yummy!
Pan Roasted Halibut $19- It was good, but not the most memorable.
Wood Oven Roasted Pig Face$19- I would definitely order this! So tasty. Pretty presentation; they cover this with a sunny side up egg, don't worry ;] It taste like pull pork to me. It was fantastic.
Goat Ribs $29- Meat just fell off the bones. It was good and we wanted to try goat..ribs. For the price, I probably would've opt for a different animal.

Dessert:
Blueberry Bourbon Baba $9- blueberries on top of bourbon gelato from Black Dog Gelato and whipped cream, all inside a donut! It was really good. I usually don't order from the dessert menu from dinners and tend to find a dessert location after. But I really wanted to try Black Dog Gelato and the description was too hard to resist. I'm glad I got to eat this. Amazing!

We even needed a box for left over. It wasn't much, just some ribs and 2 bites of the pig face, which made for a great breakfast.

Amazing food! It was definitely a pricier dinner. Great for small and middle size parties, family, special occasions, birthdays, dates, drinks, etc. Casual to nice attire. No suit necessary. Make reservations in advance!!
Noting my other reviews I have had to upgrade this one, excellent food and dining experience.

An excellent meal, all around. Excellent cocktails too.  

The space is warm and inviting.

The food was fantastic, and there were plenty of choices for both the timid and adventurous eaters in our party of 6.  ALL OF IT was really interesting, and really delicious.  

What struck me most was the staff's willingness to make sure everything was perfect, from seating, to food to service.  There aren't many "Hottest Places in Town" where the staff feels the need (much less the obligation) to act that way. From the bartenders to our server and the bus staff, everyone seemed to.  

If I can, I'll definitely be back!

Seriously one of the top meals I've had! Not only was the food fantastic and uber creative the atmosphere and hip hop music made it an unforgettable meal. We started off with Goat Liver Mousse that came with piping hot crumpets (to die for..I may have tried to lick the bowl clean) then went on to the Roasted Beet Salad, followed by Duck Tongues with poke (a MUST try-it changed my life) and last but not least Confit Goat Belly with lobster, crab & bourbon butter. My only complaint was my stomach was not big enough to try everything on the menu.

This may have been the best meal I've ever had! I am SO glad I got the opportunity to eat here! Every single thing I ate and drank was delicious! I highly recommend the crisp braised pork shank (that creamy dressing was the best), green garlic pie perogies, and the sautéed green beans! Dessert = pavlova = amazing. The ring of fire drink is also amazing! Enjoyed the pan roasted halibut as well. Service was excellent! I'm so looking forward to it opening in LA!

Sweet Jesus. Everything is amazing. Their flavor combinations are next level good. Perfect balance of acid and sweet and savory. We started with the chickpea fritter. Such an explosion of flavors. The yogurt and chutney and pomegranate gave a splashy counterpoint to the smooth, creamy chickpea. We could have had that a few times over, but we wanted to explore the menu. Next was the smoked apple pierogi. Much more subtle. The smoky, cheesy pierogi balanced by the fruit relish. The goat empanadas are a must. Sweet meat with the perfect cheese and a little acid from the sauce. Next was the bucatini. Our server (Lauren - so friendly and helpful) advertised it as comfort food and it did not disappoint. Hearty, rich and filled with flavor. Last entree was the wood oven roasted pig face. Set aside the image that conjures and order it. It's designed to evoke a breakfast hash and it's the best you've had. Just a perfect combination of flavor and texture, and the egg ties it all together. For dessert, the aw honey honey was ethereal, airy and crunchy and not-too-sweet. We also tried the sticky tasty yummy toffee thing ... So good. Richer than the honey honey, but not too sweet or overwhelming. You'll see in the pictures that we usually dug in before I remembered to take a picture. The visual appeal Lisa consistently strong. So, go. Trust your server and order anything that has a single ingredient you like. You'll love it.

We had a fantastic meal. From our server, Kristen, to our very last bite - it was perfection. It might be easier to list what we didn't try! But this is what we tasted: sautéed green beans (don't be fooled these were the bomb), roasted beets, wood grilled broccoli (OMG), green garlic pierogies (OMG*100), sockeye salmon, grilled pork belly, fried oysters, goat empanadas, ramp marinated grilled chicken, crisp braised pork shank, lemon make you happy (and oh yes it did), rhubarb shortcake, and caramel corn and malt balls (magic shell people!!!). Just outstanding!!!!

Hyped? Absolutely. Worth the visit? YES. The food portion size wasn't very much, but the flavors that emerged from each bite was worth the wait and overall cost. Our reservation was at 10pm, and they weren't kidding when they quoted the time would be approximately our reservation time. We were finally seated, ravenous for food, and licked nearly every plate up. Some of the food was overdressed (I'm looking at your green beans!) but I looked past that and went straight for the pork shank. GAH. Meat falling off the bone and succulent and simply divine. Also had the scallops, and after eating the scallops wished there was more....

For the drinks, I ordered the jalapeño margarita something? Well it had jalapeños in it and it was a margarita and it was aiiiiight. I'll probably pass on drinks next time and go straight for the food.

Reservations strongly encouraged and be sure to make reservations at a reasonable time or else you will wolf everything up at too fast a pace to truly enjoy the meal.

My wife and I took a long weekend trip to Chicago for some dining and sight seeing.  Monteverde & Alinea were the first two places to visit, and we couldn't see how things could get better.  Along comes Girl and the Goat, and things got even better.  Most enjoyable meal of the trip, even though the only reservation we could get was 4:30 PM (kind of an early dinner I guess).

Space was comfortable, service very friendly and knowledgeable, but the food was the bomb!!

Started with the Oyster combo of wood fired and fried oysters.  Best Fried oysters ever.  Crispy coating, flavorful oysters and great dipping sauce.

Server delivered a complimentary order of the chickpea fritters.  Thoughtful and tasty.  

The entrees we chose were the Halibut with Blueberry Nuoc Cham as well as the Crisp Braised Pork shank.  Both were 5 star entrees.  The Halibut perfectly cooked with an asian flare.  The pork was very flavorful and served with an excellent Naan bread.  

We had to get something from the "Goat" portion of the menu, and chose the empanadas.  I loved them, but my wife felt they were a little "gamey" for her taste.  We had the Caramel Corn and Malt balls for dessert.   Addicting!!

Highly recommend Girl and the Goat!!  Work on your reservation well in advance however.

You just can't go wrong on the food there. No matter what you order it's delicious. Never ever had I had a tongue before but the duck tongue was surprisingly not chewy as I expected. It sorta melted in your mouth. You have to eat it to get the experience!
The liver mousse was so tasty we practically licked it out of the jar!
Beans and cashew? Probably one of the best appetizers I have ever had.
Was really nice of them to get us desert with a candle for my birthday.
Taking a star out as I've always wanted to go here and booking in advance is a nightmare in addition to that we had a booking (which already is a nightmare to get) but when we got there they asked us to wait at the bar until our table was ready and the bar was packed with barely any room to move!
All in all great food but honestly not dieing to go back anytime soon.
