It was placed on a bed of cream/cheese and I found it a little rich and over-the-top. On the other hand, the cauliflower was delicious!! Light and perfectly cooked, this is my favorite roasted cauliflower I've ever had.

pics.caption: Goat leg with different sauces, fried onions, and naan, to be eaten like a taco

review.des: Amazing cocktails! Best in the city so far (and I've had QUITE a few cocktails). Love the atmosphere and the food was amazing. Highly recommend the green beans!!

this goes back a few years but my wife and I tried to make reservations about 2 weeks in advance.  they said none were avaible but we could come in at about 9 and they were rather certain that they could sit us at a common table. It was the best meal that I've ever had.
Chris was absolutely amazing, he made everything super easy and helped us pick exactly what we wanted. We will definitely be back to see him. A very different concept and great vibes.

Atmosphere, service, and drinks are all five stars! Deducted one star for a couple of "misses" in plates.

Girl and the Goat is an experiential treat. Go with a couple of friends and enjoy a huge variety of small bites. Our group raved about the Braised Pork, Duck Tongue, Green Beans, and Cauliflower. I ordered the caramel popcorn malted ice cream dessert which was probably my favorite part of the whole evening.

The biggest "miss" for us was the goat liver which was too liver-y for even the liver connoisseurs at the table. Another miss was a dish that was served with sliced apples--the apples were very sour. Almost bitter.

Very non traditional. Very beautiful food and decor. Servers and food runners are more than willing to explain the dishes to you when they hit the table. A neat place if you like to try a lot of dishes and flavors.

My sister & I visited Chicago and this place was highly recommended to us. We were meeting up with my high school friend and his fiancé, so we decided to make a reservation here. I believe I called in a week ahead?

When we got there, we only had to wait a few minutes. The ambiance is really nice and intimate. Great for making conversations while scarfing down on food.

We didn't know where to start or what to order. The server was friendly and offered popular dishes as suggestions.

We ended up getting the pork shank, oven roasted pig face, ham frites, calamari bruschetta, kalbi beef ribs, and these delicious corn bread. Honestly, my fave was the corn bread. It was amazing. My next favorite dish (surprisingly) was the calamari bruschetta. I don't normally like ricotta but this was good w/ the calamari.

Overall, the meal was good, but didn't exactly blow us away like we expected. Definitely should try if it's your first time though!

This place is super popular and I had to make a reservation 3 weeks in advance for Friday night dinner. Came here with 3 friends and we all liked our food and drinks, my favorite vegetable was the green beans and fav meat was the lamb ribs. Only one friend wanted crab rangoon and they made a mini version which was one piece.  One incident was that my other friend found a tiny hair in the shishito peppers, someone( I assume that was the manager) came to apologize and offered to give us a new one, which we said no big deal so they took it off the bill.  We ordered one desert but they also gave us a free one for the incident.  I will recommend this place and will come back.
Amazing food! I had the goat empanadas, calamari and lamb ribs. They were all delicious. I highly recommend this place. Every time I come to Chicago, it's a must go!

My girlfriend told me to check out this place when I go visit my friends in Chicago.  I tried to make a reservation for a busy Friday night at 7 but it was all booked up so I gave up on it. Little did I know, my friend from Chicago was already on top of it.  He reserved a spot for 5 people! This place is a must see if you're visiting Chicago.  The owner also has another location across the street called the Goat Diner that is less upscale but more of the same food.  

Not only is the atmosphere, food, and service on point, their cocktails are one of the best in town.  We ordered a variety of items but what stood out was the wood roasted pig face, braised pork shank and escargot ravioli.
It's a lovely place to spend time and the service was great. My server was kind and helpful

Amazing. 2nd visit did not disappoint. The chicken kebab dish was so flavorful and good, but the highlight of our meal was the chai ice cream honeycomb dessert. WOW. Both sandwiches we tried were great, huge portions and so much flavor. Can't wait to go back!

This trendy hot spot in West Loop has definitely earned its stars! We were SO lucky to get a last minute reservation during the Super Bowl. Came here with my sister and brother-in-law for a very delicious dinner.

We started the meal off with some warm marinated olives, they were amazing! There was at least five different types of olives and pickled onions. They were so flavorful! Bright and briny, everything I love about olives.

We then ordered our dinner. They serve small plates and recommend 2 plates per person. The veggie plates are actually very large. We ordered the Cauliflower (most amazing dish I've ever had!!!), Beet Salad, Shishito Peppers, Broccoli, Skirt Steak and Goat Empanadas. The cauliflower was my favorite with the goat empanadas coming in close second. That said, all the dishes were absolutely amazing. The flavor combinations are bright, bold and delicious! Highly recommended!!

Top Chef Stephanie Izard's restaurant!  & the sister restaurant Little Goat Diner is across the street.  Very popular, I mean look at the reviews, so make sure to make a reservation well in advance!

They recommend 4 dishes to be split among 2 because the dishes are tapas style.

Mahalo Cocktail:  Very strong for this tiny drink!  Sweet & refreshing.
Pan Roasted Halibut:  This dish is amazing!  The halibut cuts like butter & just melts in your mouth!  The marcona almond butter is a superb addition to this already scrumptious dish.
Wood Oven Roasted Pig Face:  Delicious!  I thought this would be a thick slab of gelatinous fat but it was crispy & super tasty.  Fork some pig face & runny egg & get ready for a tasty treat.
Crispy Braised Pork Shank:  Served with Naan.  This  alone could fill 2 people.  A hearty, tender, juicy pork shank.  The buttermilk dressing was a nice choice, not too heavy.

Everything here is consistently good.  I've had the green beans, pig face, pork shank, beet salad, and drinks.  Well seasoned, cool atmosphere, and I love to watch them do their thing in the kitchen.

Its popular so if you can't get a reservation, go right when they open, or bar seating is first come first serve.  Last time i was there, one of the bartenders was very friendly, made great drinks, and gave us an item to try on the house!

Had a solid meal here with some issues that prevented it from being a 5-Star review.  No doubt, this restaurant is creative and the plates of food that are sent out are mostly delicious but a few things would have sent it over the top.  
We ordered the raw oysters, mussels, goat empanadas, grilled butter chicken, the roasted pig face, and they served us the lemon pound cake dessert on the house for our two year anniversary (which was very sweet of them).  The first thing that bugged me was that the cold raw oysters didn't come out first.  The steamed mussels came out first and I think that progression kind of detracted from our experience of both of those dishes.  

Secondly, the delicious--I mean really incredible mussels come with 4-1 in cubes of croutons.  The broth is plentiful and so delicious but there's literally nothing to sop it up with.  We had to order a 5 buck bread course just to have something to lap up the liquid.  
Finally, the roasted pig face which was delicious was absolutely dieing for some sort of acid.  Maybe that component didn't make it on our dish but some hot pepper vinegar or literally just malt vinegar would have elevated that dish to incredible.  

The lemon dessert might have been the single best dessert dish I have ever had.  It was warm and cold, crunchy but unctuous and rich, light but obscenely indulgent.  It was really an awesome way to finish our meal.  Value wise--the restaurant was pretty pricy ~150 for two people tax and tip included.  But of all the places I've been in the city that I have been to and found overhyped--G&G really was worth it.   Despite the small issues it was a meal I would return for.  Thanks to the goats for making our Anniversary a memorable one!!

A memorable and delicious meal through and through. Welcoming and warm, the space, the staff, and atmosphere make for a classy but not pretentious experience.

Take your pick and enjoy pretty much any and everything on the menu because all the dishes seem to be made to please. Goat is far too uncommon and underappreciated in contemporary American cuisine, but I was glad to enjoy such delicious options such as the carpaccio with smoked trout roe and olive-maple vinaigrette, goat ribs, and the confit goat belly. I also managed to try the crispy beef short ribs, braised beef tongue, and wood oven roasted pig face...all of which were superb. The pig face was best dish of the six my friend and I sampled: tender and flavorful meat melded perfectly with the sunny side egg, tamarind, cilantro, and red wine-maple makes for a delectable dish that delivers on all fronts.

A wonderful time through and through, and an absolute star in a city full of great options.

I'm surprised I have reviewed this place yet. I have been here 4 times and each meal has been on point. Service is excellent, food is delicious and fun (pig face!), and the environment is energetic. I am a huge fan of this restaurant and always try and eat here when I am in Chicago. Get the Pig Face and the goat liver mousse.

pics.caption: Goat Liver Mousse. Those puffy bread things are warm and fluffy and delicious!

review.des:
What more is there to say about a restaurant that has over six thousand reviews on Yelp with a near perfect rating? Well, I'm going to add to the notion that Girl & the Goat is simply perfection.

Okay, before I begin. You must, must, must make a reservation. You must make it months before you plan on going here. It's that big of a deal. I've been twice and we made our reserverations about two to three months in advance. It's crazy, but needed.

The inside is beautiful. Somewhat dimly light. The back wall is the kitchen. Wooden accents. It feels swank without all the gloss and frills. You know you're someplace special when you're inside.

Now the most important thing- the food. The food comes tapas style so it's always a good idea to order and share at the table. Or be like me and order three things for yourself.

Some of my favorite food items are:

Roasted Cauliflower- it's got peppers (picked peppers), pine nuts and mint. I didn't think I'd like the mint, which you can definitely test, but it gives the cauliflower a nice textured flavor.

Wood Grilled Broccoli- bleu cheese and these amazing little cripsy things- delicious. You'll never look at broccoli the same way again.

ALL OF THEIR FEATURED BREADS ARE DELICIOUS. ALL OF THEIR BREADS ARE DELICIOUS. You will not be upset with any of the bread choices, but I will say I'm the biggest fan of the bread with jam; I'm a simple man, what can I say?

Oysters- A+

I had my first ever pork cheek here which was amazing. Soft and chewy and tasty and I devoured it.

Listen, everything here is good from their speciality cocktails to their meals. The servers are amazing. They will walk you through the entire menu, giving you pointers along the way. Anything I've gotten from a waiter suggestion, like the pork cheek, was a great choice, so listen to them.

So make your reservation now and in a few months when you're able to go you'll thank me!

As a vegetarian, and lover of well prepared vegetables, I am a huge fan of any restaurant that treats vegetables as an ingredient requiring the same due care and careful preparation as meat dishes. That is certainly the case, here.

I ordered the chickpea fritters (excellent), green garlic pierogies (good but not spectacular), & Cauliflower (again, good but not spectacular).

I must say that the maltball dessert stole the show. I don't even know what all the components consisted of-- but it was truly delightful.

The wine list featured some interesting finds. The cocktails were fun-- but skew very sweet-- you won't find a spirit-forward option here.

I was excited to try their daily focaccia. That's a dish to skip. Not worth the carbs.

Sometimes things just work out and your group finds a table for eight at Girl & the Goat with only a couple weeks notice. We were so lucky and enjoyed a wonderful night kitchen-side enjoying amazing plate after amazing plate.

The interior itself is beautiful and is really relaxed. Classy for sure, but I was envisioning more of a white-linens kind of jam. So glad it was warm and cozy and way more my speed. The kitchen is semi-open and I was sure to snag a seat facing the action. Our server was lovely and a gem in guiding us through the menu, giving us suggestions on how many plates to order and assuring us it wasn't a big deal if we wanted to add on more plates as we went. Food came out at lightning speed but was also  spaced perfectly so we could enjoy things as they came instead of ending up with a buffet on the table.

Here's what we tried (I think - it was kind of a food coma blur/there were a couple dishes I personally didn't try):
+ warm marinated olives
+ pan-fried shishito peppers (parmesan and spice make everything nice)
+ roasted cauliflower (simple but delish)
+ chickpea fritter (maybe my fave of the night? get 'em)
+ potato-bleu cheese pierogies (I don't like bleu cheese or mushrooms yet I inhaled these)
+ bar harbor steamed mussels [or maybe it was the oysters, not my thing]
+ wood-fired skirt steak (caramel and beef? it works)
+ bucatini (yum, and perfect for an entree to yourself)
+ grilled butter chicken (very tasty and plenty to share)
+ crisp braised pork shank (probably tied for fave with the fritters)
+ goat empanadas
+ yay for gjetost (good but not mind-blowing)
+ caramel corn & malt balls (oddly my favorite of the four we tried despite being so simple)
+ sticky tasty crunchy toffee yummy cake (quite good)
+ a chocolate & chorizo dessert that's off the menu now, can't remember the name (I personally couldn't deal with the flavor combo)

Very long story short, the best thing I can say is that I was fighting a migraine the whole time, an affliction that usually makes me super nauseated, but the food was so incredible I was able to make it through to the end until the chocolate/chorizo combo did me in. The Girl & the Goat gave me life.

We had dinner & drinks for my Sisters 50th Birthday. Very eclectic menu. I had never had goat, it was good. We ordered a ton of different dishes to try & they were all good. The focaccia w/olives is AWESOME, totally recommend it. Well Drinks were on par w/any other decent 4 Star+ establishment.

My sister ordered the Goat Shoulder, which was good, but not my cup o tea. I had the lamb shank ribs & it was Wonderful.

The roasted broccoli was decent; however I prefer my broccoli steamed w/a lil lemon & butter, guess I'm not used to the roasted/seared version 8^p

Prices are on the high side if yr ok with spending over $60 per person for dinner & drinks.

It was definitely an experience & glad we went  there while in Chicago. Thx Chef :)
This is my favorite restaurant here for no reason cause it is so flavored and price is ok especially the grills you must have a try

One of our favorites in Chicago -- it's really hard to go wrong with this place, and there's always new stuff on the menu. On our most recent visit, we went with a group of five and ordered a lot (in very rough order of how much we liked them):

- Squash blossom "crab rangoon"
- Veal tartare
- Lamb ribs
- Breads
- Pierogies
- Chickpea fritters
- Pork shank
- Shoshito peppers
- Oysters
- Bombe (dessert)
-------
- Cauliflower
- Chicken
- Broccoli

There was some disagreement on these rankings -- for example, my wife absolutely loved the pork shank and would have it ranked higher, and the pierogies were particularly controversial, as the pierogies themselves were kind of plain, but the stuff under it (bok choy creme and smoked tomato rhubarb chimi) was incredible.

Overall, an outstanding spot that's hard not to love.

Wife and I walked by the place at 4pm and saw a line...we decided to wait and was able to get a seat at the bar. Food was great and even though we sat at the var... service was still great!

If you do not have a reservation...come early get a seat at the bar!

Simply outstanding! What better way to kick off your visit to Chicago than with a ton of delicious food? Even more special if you can have a girl AND a goat for dinner.

PARKING:
----------
You probably won't find any in downtown Chicago. The signs are super confusing anyway with arrows pointing in both directions, guaranteeing some sort of major mess-up for you and a nice ticket from the government. I suggest you take public transportation, Uber, or take advantage of the curbside valet parking.

AMBIANCE/SERVICE:
----------------------
The decor is simple and cozy. The girl and goat painting near the front is super cool, deviant art-like. All the staff are wearing shirts that display goats doing cute/funny things. Clever!

Service is absolutely on point. I had to bring this up before the food section, because flawless service is key to the dining experience here and we were not disappointed. There are so many items it can be intimidating to navigate the menu, especially since two of us have food allergies, but our server easily guided us along with recommendations and items that could not be eaten. He even organized our dishes to be sent out in optimal succession. Also as each dish was placed before us, it was announced as safe/not safe for my friend who has an allergy to certain forms of fish. Super critical and effortlessly delivered. Thank you!

FOOD/DRINK:
--------------
And the best way to kick off said dinner? How about *The Very Old Fashioned* featuring J. Henry "Blind Goat" bourbon (crafted specifically for this restaurant)? Yes, we'll take a round. Very smooth and complemented the dishes very nicely.

Now let's get to the food.

*Duck Tartare* with gooseberries, pickled mushrooms, gochujang mayo, cracklins, duck dad lavish - Great start to the meal. Not overwhelming in flavor, good texture.

* Hamachi Crudo* with crisp Pork belly, chili aioli, caperberries - Sliced perfectly thin and I enjoyed the contrast in texture of the other elements in the dish.

*Duck Tongues* with tuna and black bean poke and piri piri chili powder - Crispy and flavorful, but not my favorite dish. The tongues were a bit chewier than I would have liked.

*Roasted Beets* with green beans, white anchovy (on the side for us), avocado creme fraiche, bread crumbs - LOVE! I'm a huge fan of beets, and these were prepared perfectly.

*Goat Liver Mousse* with pickled rhubarb, giardiniera, bread & butter, pickles - Super buttery, creamy, and everything you're missing in your life if you like liver. That mousse is bomb! And don't forget the super buttery popovers too. Nommm.

*Wood Grilled Broccoli* with rogue smokey bleu, spiced crispies - Why are all the veggies here so darn good? Another great dish that goes well with everything. Spiced crispies on point.

*Calamari Bruschetta* with clam baguette, goat milk ricotta, goat bacon, green tomatoes - This dish is heavier in flavor than the others, or maybe this is because I'm starting to feel STUFFED around this point in the meal.

*Pan Roasted Halibut* with marcona almond butter, white asparagus, blueberry nuoc clam - Bursting with flavor! Although I'm super full already by now, I'm still going because this dish is so tasty. If you like Halibut, get this.

*Roasted Cauliflower* with pickled peppers, pine nuts, mint - I said it before and I'll say it again. They nailed all the veggies!

*Wood Oven Roasted Pig Face* with sunny side egg, tamarind, cilantro, red wine-maple, potato stix - Pig Face is life. Even though I feel like I have no room left in my tummy, somehow I'm able to keep eating this. Super delicious and savory in all the right ways!

*Crisp Braised Pork Shank* with buttermilk dressing, grilled spring onion and radish kimchi, naan - Extremely crispy skin and quite the chunk of meat. We could barely finish this dish, it pretty much owned us. I think I prefer the Pig Face to this dish, but many of the others liked this one more.

SUMMARY: 11 dishes, 6 people, $57 each including tax and tip. Not bad at all.

TIP: Make them reservations ASAP so you won't have to wait in a super long line.

DATE TIP: How often is it that you can say, "hey baby, let's get some Pig Face!" ?

pics.caption: Calamari Bruschetta with clam baguette, goat milk ricotta, goat bacon, green tomatoes.
Wood Grilled Broccoli with rogue smiley bleu cheese and spiced crispies.

review.des:
Wow! I am impressed! All the food and cocktails were SO good! There weren't one dish we didn't like. The goat liver mousse, rock shrimp, and the pig face are fantastic! Our server was really nice and had great recommendations.

Will definitely be back!

I came with a friend who was visiting from DC. We're both major foodies and she knew she had to come to Girl and the Goat. I'd been once before and was excited to come back. I started off with a cocktail the server recommended to me, kind of coffeeish, just what I needed. Then we had the olive yuzu focaccia. So good! I'm not usually an olive eater but they gave a great briny salt bite to the bread with the sweet, citrusy butter and olive oil dip.

The chickpea fritters are divine. Like amazing bars of fried hummus. Get them. The broccoli was fine, but I think the cauliflower (which I had the first time) is better. I'd get the cauliflower if I were you.

The goat empanadas are yummy and fun to eat. I'm of the opinion that you have to get some goat. It's in the name!

The sablefish with coconut rice, starfruit and pork belly was odd in a really yummy way. Great textures. Delicious fish dish.

But honestly you have to get the pig face. It sounds scary but it's so approachable. It's like breakfast. One of the best dishes in Chicago, honestly.

Lastly I just want to call out how great the service is. They course everything out for you, they never crowd your table with dishes. It's so smooth. Impeccable.

We were walking around the neighborhood and passed by a group having dessert outside, it looked so good we had to stop in. We had the chocolate pavlova and blueberry bourbon baba, both were PHENOMENAL. I'm not a huge chocolate fan but the pavlova was still tasty; the baba had a perfect balance of sweet and savory. It was a Tuesday and the place was packed. We only went for dessert but I'm sure the dinner is great too

It is a very nice restaurant and I am happy to support the owner who has several restaurants in Chicago however the food choices are weird and have way too many ingredients. Please add some simple things to your menu so those of us who are not foodies can enjoy your restaurant more! Thanks!

If you're coming to Chicago, you need to come to Girl & the Goat! I could recommend the halibut because it was an astronomically mind-blowing flavor explosion but so was every dish that I ordered. I didn't get to try everything but I'm willing to bet my left pinky toe that you just can't go wrong with anything in this menu. Come for a nice date or if you just want some delicious food!

Pro-tip: They even have a dairy free menu for all my lactose intolerant brethren out there! Sometimes it's hard to get a reservation but you can see reservation come available randomly if you keep checking the website.

pics.caption: Braised Beef Tongue - yummy but the onion and sauce actually steal the show

review.des: My husband and I went to Girl & the Goat a year ago yesterday, the night we got engaged. It became a special place for us that evening. A couple weeks ago, we went again to celebrate our 1 year of being engaged and  enjoy a date night before our wedding. The food was amazing per usual, you can't go wrong with anything you select. More importantly, our server was fantastic and attentive. She even gave us a free dessert to celebrate! We love this place and will keep coming back for our celebrations and "just because". Thank you for the great memories!

It was everything I expected it to be! I hated the wait--got there at 8:40 and I was told we would have a seat until after 10pm or 11pm. However, my friend and I were lucky to grab seats at the bar. My advice to you is to try to do the same if you wind up in the same situation. The bartender was wonderful! He thoroughly explained the menu and helped us to select the perfect pairings. Chickpea fritter chaat=delicious Halibut=delicious Gluten free bread=the absolute best!!!

My friend had the pig face and kohlrabi salad and loved it. (She was surprised she like the pig face so much...said it tasted like breakfast. Ha! ) We have no complaints on food. And will definitely visit again when we take a trip to Chicago.

Seating was uncomfortable tables were so close to each other. Service very good and attentive.
Green beans was delicious.

I AM IN LOVE with the restaurant. The food was amazing each time I've visited with different seasonal menus. Their bread is a MUST to order, I would not want to miss out their bread. The pork face is certainly worth a try!
An outstanding restaurant. Need 4 months plus for a reservation. The locale is excellent. The food is amazing. The service top notch. No negatives.
Not that they need a review. But delicious... Get there early if you dont want to wait.
Pretty expensive but excellent service with excellent food. Usually have to book a reservation in advance but we got lucky with a walk in.

It's hard to get a seat but if you arrive at early it's quite easy to sit at the bar and get the same menu as at the tables. Service was good. Explanation of everything on the menu and on any of our questions. They offer up daily specials as well. The price is a little higher side but it's ok. So had a good time.

Over rated!
Made. Reservations 1 month from advanced.
Had to wait over 30 minute be seated , the food arrived after one hour ( manager claimed they'd de a mistake with our order ...) . The bill arrived and it was all In , even that we had to wait that long . Used to be a regular there but so disappointed!

My friends and I came here for dinner last week, and most everything was delicious. Our server told us to order two dishes for each person. Everything is served family style, and they stagger when the dishes are brought out. We never had more than two dishes on our table at a time.

We ordered a bunch:

(*)  steamed bar harbor mussels (one of my favorites, and possibly the fattest mussels I've ever eaten)
(*)  seared diver scallops (my other favorite...SO GOOD)
(*)  duck tongues (my other, other favorite...surprisingly great)
(*)  potato-goat sausage pizza (really tasty)
(*)  wood-grilled broccoli (too rich with the bleu cheese)
(*)  potato-blue cheese pierogies (again, too rich for me, but these were one of my friend's favorites)
(*)  escargot ravioli (solid)

The restaurant has a homey but "cool" atmosphere to it. Service was great. They accidentally brought us the wrong food twice, but then just let us have one of the plates for free, which I thought was nice.

My only minor complaint is that the bathrooms are down two flights of stairs in the dungeon. Full belly + wine + heels + stairs = nah. Otherwise, though, I loved this place and will definitely be back.
Just plain amazing. Great food and with reservations it is great. Don't go without thwm
From the service to our courses, everything was amazing.

I came here with some friends for a late night dinner (8:30PM) and it was still insanely packed.

We ordered a million dishes for the table to share. We had a party of nine so we must have ordered close to like 20 dishes or so for the entire table to try. The portion sizes, in general, are incredibly small. Like, one plate will feed like 3 people max. So I definitely recommend doubling or tripling some orders if you want everyone to try a piece.

I don't remember exactly what all I had but I do remember that some dishes were better than others. The meat dishes were generally very tender and juicy. If they had some sort of sauce, usually the sauce was on point.

The fried chickpea dish was really good. It was crispy and flavorful. My friends really liked the butter chicken, especially the creamy sauce!

I think Duck Duck Goat is better though, for the value that you get. This place we paid about $40/person, and some people still weren't full.

I remember watching Chef Stephanie Izard back in her Top Chef days. Now that she is an Iron Chef as well, I had even more reason to try Girl & the Goat. Good thing, because this turned out to be my favorite restaurant during my Chicago trip. Make reservations in advance. Even though the space is huge, it was packed the entire evening. Plates are meant to be shared, but some are smaller than others. Between the 2 of us, we got...

Escargot Ravioli: Interesting concept. Not sure it worked as well as it sounded. In any other restaurant, this would probably rank higher on my list, but because the rest of the food is so good here, this became my least favorite of the night.

Oven Roasted Pig Face: Served with runny sunny side egg and fried potato stix. Think brunch on crack. The meat melts in your mouth. Best way to eat it is to mix it all together.

Glazed Lamb Ribs: Comes with 4. Sticky, flavorful, and falls off the bone.

Confit Goat Belly: Favorite of the night, maybe because it's belly, lobster, AND crab. Everything was cooked to perfection and worked well together.

Goat Empanadas: Not your average empanadas. Avocado smash added freshness, and the pineapple-blueberry salsa added sweetness. Generous portion of meat inside.

Duck Tartare: Loved this! It's like you're foraging through a forest and you get something different with each bite.

Chocolatey-Chocolate Cake: Served with shiitake gelato wahhh. Don't know how Chef Izard made that work with chocolate, but it was one of the most delicious unique gelato flavors I've ever had. Best way to end a meal!

We had a meal at the much-lauded Girl & the Goat restaurant in the West Loop neighborhood of Chicago. Our experience as mostly vegetarians didn't blow us away, though we certainly can see if we were omnivores that this place would probably have rated higher with us.

First of all Kudos for having a separate vegetarian section on the menu. Though it's important to note that 2 items on the "V" menu were not actually vegetarian. One had fish sauce in it and I don't remember what the other was.) My wife had the Kohlrabi Salad (fennal, evasion, toasted almonds and blueberries) menu and thought it was amazing.

I ordered sweet'n spicy brioche from the Bread menu, without the "spring lamby jam". The bread itself is house-made and pretty good. The honey samba butter it came with didn't have any honey flavor though. I like bread and better as much as the next gluten-full guy, but was disappointed about the absent honey flavor, especially since I was paying for bread.

We also shared the Roasted Cauliflower from the V menu. It had a pretty good and very present pickle flavor.

I also enjoyed the Green Garlic Potato Pierogies though it was a bit of a sparse plate relative to being most expensive item on the vegetarian menu. It had a bit of a pickled flavor on it like the cauliflower so we started to get a little "pickled-out." They were also a little bit greasy.

Overall the food was good but rich.

They did offer gluten-free bread which was thoughtful except it was made with Parmesan is so not suitable if you're also dairy free. (Which my wife is.)

They did however offer separate gluten-free and dairy free menus. If we ate meat I'm sure this place would've been amazing (especially goat). My wife and go back for the salad.

We didn't make any reservations but called ahead if we can do a walk in. We got seats in the bar. This is one of the best restaurant we tried while we're in Chicago. Unique menu. Delicious food and cocktails. Staff is amazingly friendly.

Duck tongue is a must try. Order pig shank with their famous green beans. Love love everything. will definitely come back.

One of the thousands of reviews at this place. I was a huge fan of Stephanie Izard on Top Chef and knew I had to come try it when I eventually made it to Chicago. It in the sprawling West Loop with a bunch of other hipster-like restaurants. I didn't have a reservation and was super concerned that I would have to wait YEARS to get a table when I got there but luckily, the bar was first-come-first-serve and there happen to be openings. The bartenders weren't just bartenders and they knew the menu and dishes very well. After ordering a drink, I took a look at the extensive menu and was lost... So much to choose from and didn't want to not miss out on the best things. I eventually chose:

Goat Carpaccio with Trout Roe: A bit too citrus-y for my like but the goat was tender and didn't taste game-y. The roe popping in your mouth added the brine that broke through the sour sauce. Pretty decent but not something you need to order.

Shishito Peppers: Tons of shishito peppers even for a half order with some bread crumbs and sauce. The shishito peppers were tender and a great side dish for any dish. The sauce had some depth to it that matched the bread crumbs heaviness, which I felt made the dish so great.

Roasted Beets: Beets are so appealing to me now and I loved the avocado sauce in it. The beets and the green beans just worked with the avocado sauce.

Lamb Ribs: Didn't feel lamb-y at all. It tasted like any fall-off-the-bone ribs with a sweet sauce with some sliced green onions. The 4 ribs were a bit fatty but nothing I didn't expect. I thought the sauce was a bit too sweet but it was still good nonetheless.

The service was great all around and although some dishes weren't spectacular, the dishes were definitely great and above the bar. Try to get a reservation but if you have a small party of 1 or 2, try the bar. You can also sit in the waiting area over a drink. Never anything wrong with that.

Our favorite place for a fun, delicious night out.
Hard to get a reservation and once you go you'll understand why...
everything from the drinks to the sides are so detailed in their flavors and display.
Love this place

First time in Chicago of course I'm going to try Girl and the Goat. Unfortunately it did not live up to my expectations. Lets start with the food and drinks. I had the hamachi crudo, grilled short ribs and green beans. Hamachi was excellent. Delicious and refreshing. The grilled short ribs came out a bit lukewarm and quickly cooled due to the cut of the beef. Perhaps they should consider serving this on a cast iron plate to retain the heat. Or have the servers step up their game. I was disappointed that there was not more complexity and heat from the sichan flavors. Green beans were hot and tasty. Nice use of fish sauce. Aperol spritz was excellent. Service was a mixed bag. Great while you had there attention. Glad I got to try it but there is better food and service in your fine town.

Food
pan fried shishito peppers: parmesan. sesame. miso -- solid
wood grilled broccoli: rogue smokey bleu. spiced crispies -- best brocolli of my life!
escargot ravioli: bacon tamarind sauce. escarole and celery. crispy onions -- I didn't like the celery, it overpowered the dish
goat empanadas: avocado smash . grilled pineapple-blueberry salsa. queso fresco -- a-okay
chocolatey - chocolate cake: shiitake gelato -- amazing, the toffee creme fraise perfectly topped it and i loved the savoriness of the shiitake; the two worked well together
rhubarb & goat cheese bavarian: hazelnut crunchy. herbs -- delicious: savory, herby, sour, and tart. all things I normally don't like, but worked well together here.

Cocktails -- both were good!
mahalo: don q silver . plantation pineapple rum . guava . pink peppercorn . lime . mezcal
salt & ash: benhez mezcal . ancho reyes verde . kings ginger . grapefruit shrub . lime

We have dined here four or five times and of course the food was always superb and the service was so helpful and knowledgeable. Very consistent! Some of our favorite dishes are pig face, broccoli, and the goat belly. The drinks are delish, too! If for some reason you haven't tried this place, you definitely need to!

I may have been somewhat reluctant to try Girl & The Goat after viewing the menu items online but I'm forever grateful that I did. The food excites you as you make your way down the menu, selecting two or three items per person at the recommendation of the server. Just the names of the menu items will leave you curious and eager to see the waiter walk toward you with a plate.

Dinner included a sample of the Seared Diver Scallops on the house which were absolutely amazing. The English Pea-Quinoa "tabboulleh," Tahini Vinaigrette, and Chinese Sausage have to be eaten with closed eyes and a smile in pure satisfaction. It's the only way.

Next, the Goat Empanadas followed closely by the Crisp Braised Pork Shank, Confit Goat Belly, and Wood Oven Roasted Pig Face all combined to created the perfect amount of delicious food. The Pig Face was my favorite as I can imagine it does well during brunch. It has a Sunny Side Egg and a Red Wine-Maple sauce with Potato Stix that just feels like a breakfast that can be eaten any time, any place. I already can't wait for my next trip. Remarkable stuff.

The style of serving food is unique. They bring the dish one at a time to give you the moment to know the food and keep your mouth busy.

I would personally recommend their elotes and halibut. My goat empanadas were cold on the inside. The pig's face was copied from Filipino dish called sisig. Honestly, it was just ok. It needs some acid to cut the fat and oil. Same goes to the pork shank. It was tender and falls off the bone but needs something to balance the fat and sliminess of the meat.
Legit one of the best dishes in all of Chicago. Pig Face = the thickest bacon you'll ever have. This is the fanciest, tastiest breakfast dish you could possibly have!

pics.caption: Wood Oven Roasted Pig Face // sunny side egg, tamarind, cilantro, red wine-maple, potato stix

review.des: This place is awesome! It's so chill, and their service is on point! Our server was great, and I'm surprised by how fast the food came out. The ambiance and environment are pretty casual. However, make sure you make a reservation it can get pretty crowded.

Was near impossible to get a reservation here. I showed up at 8pm with a coworker and found space at the bar. I could tell the restaurant was packed and I saw no vacant tables for the entire time I was there.

Tried 4 dishes, but the Pork Shank deserves a review of its own... it was incredible! Highly recommend that along with a glass of Malbec. Worth checking out!

Amazing.  Simply amazing. I would recommend a reservation.  Ordered several things, but I wish I could I have tried the entire mention.  Came in with extremely high expectations.  Every dish did not disappoint. I do plan to come back and try other things on the menu.  Highly recommend!

What can I say that hasn't been mentioned before?  This place is AWESOME!
Reservations were placed on OpenTable about 6 weeks before and was challenging - I managed to get a 945pm seating for 2 on a Tuesday night.  Luckily we drove into the city very much ahead of schedule and decided to check in early - to my surprise we were seated 1 hour before our reservation.
The place serves small plates enough for two to share.  Figure 5-6 plates for dinner.  Everything was done wonderfully and tasted great.  The dishes have been mentioned in other reviews.  Plenty of selections for vegetarians.  
I would definitely go back in an instant - but I spend so little time in Chicago nowadays and there are a lot of wonderful restaurants to try.  A sure winner.

I know girl and the goat doesn't need my review, nor did I care to write about it, b/c I didn't think my review would make any impact. I mean, it's the most reviewed restaurant in Chicago. When a place is THAT popular, I tend to like it less. It's like with the super popular kids in high school. When they already have so many fans, how does my fandom make a difference? I'm merely just another number on the growing list.

I'm from LA. I had heard about girl and the goat before moving to Chicago. It was at the top of my list of restaurants to try like everyone else. My very first time dining here was in 2013. My fiancé's cousin made a reservation for us. That dinner was exquisite. We loved it. Since then, the number of times I've been here is in the double digits. When you have a homogenous group of friends back in LA, everybody who visits Chicago wants to try the place. At one point, I was scared to come back and would tell my friends I'd meet up for drinks after their dinner . After all, it's not a cheap place either. My feelings for girl and the goat have not been consistent over the years. There have been times when I didn't care for the dishes. Don't get me wrong, nothing was bad, I just wasn't impressed. Sure, my standards are higher for a restaurant that's as hyped as this. However, service was always top notch even though the place was non-stop bustling.

I often review restaurants after trying it once. That one time could've been really good, or it might've been an off night, and it was terrible. Maybe they're consistently good. Or consistently bad. But for most of the time, I don't have that information to fully assess the place b/c I don't dine there enough. However across the many dining experiences I've had here, I can confidently say that girl and the goat truly lives up to its hype! My favorites are their desserts and cocktails. That butterscotch crumble is phenomenal. Every cocktail I've tried is tasty. And I've tried a lot of drinks here. I've also sampled different dishes since their menu rotates. I'd say the standouts are probably what everyone else loves - wood oven roasted pig face, grilled octopus, roasted beets, roasted cauliflower with pickled peppers. I'm not a fan of lamb but my fiancé is crazy about it. He's tried everything from the goat carpaccio to liver mousse, confit goat belly and empanadas and has nothing but great things to say.

Needless to say, I'm a huge fan. Make your reservation months in advance so you don't miss out on the most reviewed restaurant in Chicago. It's most reviewed for a very good reason.

Okay, so where do I start? I came here with my bf to celebrate his graduation. I've heard so many thing about this place like everyone else, but man.... let me say this place is the definition of hype.

Our server was nice and knowledgeable about the dishes and was kind enough to take of the plate that we did not like so kudos to him.

Between us two ; we had a bottle of champagne, chickpeas entree, green beans, crab, scallops, bread, and halibut. ( sorry for not remembering the names )

I was expecting to be blown away,but I was not. The best dishes were the scallops and halibut. The crab was fried with too much oil and the chickpeas( the dish that was returned) was tasteless. I did however with that dish appreciate the creatively and consistency, but it lacked flavor. The green beans were just okay,  and the bread was pretty good.

Maybe I will try the diner? Or maybe I feel the way I do because I don't eat pork, and everyone raves about the pork dishes. Who knows?

Giving it a 3.5/4 because out of the six dishes I tried I only really liked 3, and this is a pretty pricey resturant.

Very hard to get a reservation! We finally got a reservation for a friend's birthday and she loved it! My only complaint was that the tables were super close together. So close, that they had to move it to the side for one person to get through to sit down. See pictures to see what we ordered!

Get the green beans and thank me later : )
This is my favorite restaurant in Chicago! Cool place, nice service, best food! Don't skip the desserts! Good wines menu! Congrats Girl you're Goat is gorgeous!

Seriously, what is not to love about this place?! Was in Chicago over the summer and couldn't get in because I didn't plan ahead and get a reservation at least a month early. Made the same mistake when I was back in October but heard that you can sit and eat in the bar without reservations so we just popped in. No seats at the bar so we stood and had a drink until a coffee table spot opened up in the bar area.  We ordered some amazing items, had terrific service, sat next to some super friendly folks and compared notes on all that we were eating, was a really good time.  Next time I promise I will be more forward thinking and reserve an actual table, but was just like eating at home on the sofa, food was just better.

pics.caption: Baby octopus w/ potatoes, pistachios, mint

review.des: The best meal I had in Chicago...no competition! If you're visiting, or even if you're from the area..go here! Make sure you reserve a table. The only time available was 10:30 pm when I went, but oh so worth it. I believe the waiter also brings out your dishes in a particular manner so that the flow of the taste has this harmonious collaboration. Ordered 3 different dishes and each dish got better and better. And the last dish heavenly perfected the end of the meal. Don't be dissuaded by the goat. I'm not a big goat fan due to the gamy taste, but it was amazing!

Friend from NYC was in town. She really wanted to check out this place. Miraculously a reservation came up for 9:45 on the day of and it would be perfect timing based on her flight. With all my good luck of being able to score a reservation literally hours before I should've gone to the casino.

Anyways, first comment is going to be about the ambiance. The atmosphere is GREAT. I loved it here. It was lively. Although we didn't have the best seat in the house, I still felt like there was never a dull moment of silence due to the great ambiance.

Service was phenomenal too. Waiter was very attentive even to the tiniest of details with much wit as well. Water was constantly poured. Although service could've been a bit quicker, I am not going to complain due to the restaurants business.

For drinks I got my go to drink, the Old Fashion. I really enjoyed. Just wish there weren't so many ice cubes in my drink....drives me insane when that happens...especially at a nice place like Girl and the Goat.

Now on to what matters, the food!

First we got the Chickpea Fritters. When I think of Chickpeas I think of those circle things in middle eastern food. But this dish came out in tofu like squares. And it was extremely delicious! With the fruit it had the perfect balance! 5 out of 5 stars!

Second we got the Hamachi Crudo. This was a dish out of left field. The waiter recommended it to us. After we had it I questioned to my friend if waiters/waitresses get commission based on what doesn't sell well. Lol. This dish just didn't mesh at all with the rest of the dishes that were on the menu. It was like eating sashimi at a steak place. It was just weird. Wasn't a fan. 3 out of 5 stars.

Third we got the Goat Empanadas. I have no idea what goat tastes like but this dish was great. Extremely tasty balance of everything on it was GREAT. 5 out of 5 stars.

4th Dish. Wood roasted pig face. Did I tell you I love pork? I love pork. This dish was great. Crispy melt in your mouth pork. Sooooo good. I don't even know what pig face would taste like but after having pig face here, I'm getting pig face everywhere. 5 out of 5 stars.

5th Dish. Crisp Braised Pork Shank. This was a really good dish. The naan was surprisingly incredible that came with it. I really liked the buttermilk dressing with the Naan but the buffalo kimchi sauce...did not taste anything like kimchi. It was weird. 4.5 out of 5 stars. I think the execution could be better but I ain't no master chef so don't take this too seriously.

Dessert we got Blueberry Bourbon baba again recommended by our waiter. Again, I think he takes a commission for what doesn't sell. This dish was not good. It tasted weird. The bourbon made the dish extremely sour. It just didn't mesh in my mouth. Blah. 2.5 out of 5 stars.

All in all I had a great experience. I wish we ordered more variety because the 2 pork dishes we ordered at the end seemed a bit too much. Something was missing from the 5 dishes we ordered. Maybe take out the Hamachi and go with a veggie dish or a seafood/pasta dish. All in all a solid experience. I'll definitely come back.

pics.caption: Old fashion. Very good but too many ice cubes...

review.des: Amazing food and great atmosphere! Oh, and the day I was there so was Kim and Kanye. No one even made a fuss about it. Super professional staff with such attentiveness. I highly recommend.

This has got to be one of the most famous restaurants of all Chicago. One of the most highly popular ones as well. I was lucky enough to book 3 seats but took me a month in advance.

This restaurant is great in all aspects. Their service is on point with everything. They bring out their dishes one after another and present each one along with it's ingredients. This restaurant is family-style so most dishes are shared and are at a small portion. Me and my friends decided to order two each from their unique menu.

We started with goat empanadas which the meat was tender and full of flavor. It had the texture of pulled pork. Next, came the thick scallop cubes which were meaty and sautéed to perfection. Third, came the escargot ravioli which had this nice garlic sauce and along came pig hearts which were tiny and slightly meaty. The hearts were grilled but wasn't worth it to me (Too pricey for something tiny..literally). The pig face came next which was one of my favorites. The egg yolk on top breaks within the meat and provides this nice texture. The meat is full of flavor and has this fatty taste which is delicious. Finally the last part but my favorite, the pork shank which is a deep fried whole pork shank similar to Filipino style crispy pata. The meat is tender inside but crispy from the outside. The naan could be a lot better; it was a bit bland and too soft which to me, didn't pair well.

Overall, this place is definitely worth it and a must eat in Chi-town. Don't leave this city without eating here. The menu is unique and their bartenders do an excellent job with cocktails. I suggest ordering some drinks and sipping it at the bar before getting seated. I love this place and I'd totally come back.

I love love love this place. I have been here few times for dinner. However, last night we stopped by real quick for some dessert. That is one thing I love about this place is that you can walk in for some desserts and drinks and you will not be disappointed. Our bartender recommended a popcorn chocolate dessert, and I have to say it was AMAZING! I had to write a review just for this dessert. Girl and Goat has the most unique desserts, but they will have you coming back for more!

One of my favorite restaurants in Chicago. The pork shank is amazing. I had the halibut tonight also, which was also increasingly delicious. The staff is on point. Excellent food and great environment! Very enjoyable meal!

We loved the ambiance and while we didn't make it for dinner. The berry gelee was surprisingly tasty! Refreshing and not too sweet. Buttttt the unicorn blood had me up until 5am! I'd try and have it before 5pm if you wanna have a good night sleep. Hehe we will absolutely come back for dinner.

Every single dish at Girl & the Goat is top notch. We tried multiple dishes (view photos for details) and every single one was a unique combo of flavors. This place definitely lives up to all the hype. It's worth the wait or if you want to avoid the wait, find a seat at the bar.
My favorite was definitely the halibut and the chickpea fritters. Each dish is pretty small so you'll have to order 2-3 dishes a person depending on how hungry you are.
The restaurant space itself is also very charming. The owner/chef definitely knows what he's doing. Awesome spot with good food, music, & cocktails!

I came here back in late April for an anniversary dinner for 2 people. The only reservations that were available were 5:45pm or 10pm so we took the early bird special time. When we arrived it was half full at 5:30pm! We got to our table right away and was anxious to try some great dishes. We were probably the only ones out of our friends who have not tried girl & the goat so we had a lot of friends who made recommendations prior to our visit.

Unfortunately, when we sat down we were waiting for our waiter for about 15 minutes. Thankfully the individuals who filled our water saw us getting anxious and started to walk around looking for our waiter which he arrived shortly after. He was very lack luster when he arrived at our table but was nice enough to give us his recommendations and popular dishes.

We ordered: wood grilled broccoli, seared diver scallops, what's the deal yo (bread), pigs face

To be honest my favorite thing was the wood grilled broccoli and the scallops. My bf thought the pigs face was the best and it was one of the most recommended item on the menu from friends. The pigs face looked great but something was missing like spice that would be more of my palate.

I wish it was easier to get a reservation here but I plan on coming back another time and try different items on the menu. I don't think it was the most amazing experience but I think it would  be worth a try if you are curious.

pics.caption: Sea diver scallops, I really liked the crunch of the quinoa and how perfectly cooked the scallops were
What's the deal yo (bread) the dill spread is delicious and the bread!

review.des:
Food absolutely amazing!  as is the service.
Go with friends so that you can share a variety of items.  We arrived early for our reservation and grabbed a comfy seat in the bar area for cocktails. Server very knowledgeable of menu and listened to our likes and made recommendations.   Nothing was disappointing.  Can't wait to go back.

Truly one of the greatest culinary experiences of my life. Stephanie Izard is a goddess!! Watching her expedite throughout the evening just goes to show the dedication she has for her work. Service was great (our server was Owen) -- food, flawless. We had the raw oysters, duck tongues, chickpea fritters, tempura walleye, green beans, octopus, pig face, chocolate pavlova and toffee cake. Raw oysters were the perfect start to the meal. Duck tongues were super fun, fresh and bright w/ the poke, the tongues reminded me of fried chicken skin. The carrot hummus with the chickpea fritter was my boyfriend's favorite part of the evening. Tempura walleye's sauce underneath the crispy fish was lick-the-bowl-worthy. Green beans were lit. First time ever having octopus -- a party to the face. The flavors were loud and I was living. The pig face meat itself reminded me of scrapple (but, like, way better than scrapple lol) and the sauces were bright and colorful and the egg was perfect. Dessert was unreal. We should've ordered all 4. We had the cocktails It's Always Sunny in Oaxaca, Ring of Fire, Chai-Town and Fireside. All great, but Fireside was definitely the best of the 4. Thank u Stephanie and co for helping me give my bf the best birthday dinner I could've ever asked for. Will be back again.

pics.caption: Sticky Tasty Crunchy Toffee Yummy Cake

review.des:
WHATA DISSAPPOINTMENT‼
The Lamb RibS
4 tiny Ribs & nothing but FAT. I would have let the waitress know but she never came over asked me how my meal was Maybe she would have noticed I barley ate them - BUT NOPE.. Also got the Escargot ravioli, was tasty- but having the inedible ribs follow I had to go get a couple slices of pizza after. $45 bucks down the drain

My 1st experience there last week I got the scallop dish & it was great, THE SERVICE SUCKED‼ They brought my 1st course then after 1 bite - they tried to drop the 2nd course - had to scream to get the server back to take it & he told me I had to talk to someone else about that. Gave them another shot tonight & the food sucked & service was fine.

ITS NOT WORTH THE WAIT
IF IT IS A WAIT JUS GO ELSE WHERE‼
ITS A COMPLETE ROLL OF THE DICE ‼

While visiting a friend in Chicago, my friends and I made reservations to attend this popular establishment. When we arrived it was the typical dinnertime crowd and it was packed, with more people waiting for tables. I must note that it has a similar name as other restaurants across the street which include "goat" in their names; please do not confuse these places. I found my experience to be very memorable, I am writing my review months after having been there.

The restaurant was dimly lit and the table was wooden. It had a very rustic charm about it. Our server Kristen helped us pick our dishes and she did an excellent job serving them as well. One of us was vegetarian and I am lactose intolerant. She handled our concerns with professionalism and made sure to remind us as each dish came out if it contained meat or cheese.

Here is the list of dishes we feasted on that evening:
-Sweet Potato Bread
-Kohlrabi Salad: fennel, evalon, toasted almonds, roasted shiitake, apples
-Goat Empanadas: Miso-blue aioli, grilled mushroom & apple giardiniera
-Redfish - this was a fish stew soup
-Chickpea fritters- Crispy quinoa tabbouleh, feta, tahini vinaigrette
-Shrimp -
-Potato Blue Cheese Pierogies -Mushroom crema, pickled persimmon, apple relish, maitake mushroom
-Wood Oven Roasted Pig Face - Sunny side egg, tamarind, cilantro, red wine-maple, potato stix

Everything tasted good, but to me what stood out was the redfish stew. I think they have rotated their menu; I could not locate it on the restaurant's website. It was a cold night when we had dinner and the fish stew was so wonderfully done I could live off of it! Every dish that came out was absolutely delicious. The bread was baked hot and fresh, served on a wooden paddle with delicious butter. The chickpea fritters were on top and presented on a bed of quinoa with feta and vinaigrette... the roasted pig face (whose name is very daunting, I know!) was amazing. I would say my least favorite dish was the blue cheese pierogies as I am not a fan of strong cheeses. All the dishes were prepared well, all great flavors with great presentation. This seems to be a very popular place, it was still very busy when we left about an hour and a half later. I definitely recommend coming back for a meal. Yes it is a bit on the expensive side; but you should treat yourself to fine dining once in a while as well. It is well worth the experience!

This place definitely lives up to the hype. We got the goat belly, duck tongue, and the oven roasted pig face. All of the dishes amazed me with new flavors I have not tried before.

The standout for the night for me was the oven roasted pig face. You could immediately smell the aromatic flavors of the oven roasted pig when the dish was brought out to us. To top that off, the pig melts right in your mouth when you bite into it. YUM. Would definitely could back. Just be sure to make a reservation weeks in advance

I have been waiting for a long time to come here, and I wished I came sooner!  This was a meal well spent with loved ones.  

We were able to snag a 5:30 reso for 5 on a Tuesday (I would definitely recommend making a reservation).

For food, we had:
Mr. potato head
Oysters
Sautéed green beans
Wood grilled broccoli
Hamachi crudo
Calamari bruschetta
Wood oven roasted pig face
Bucatini
Goat shank
Sticky toffee yummy cake
Sorbet

Everything was delicious, but my favorites were the oyster (plump and juicy), the sautéed green beans, the wood oven roasted pig face, and the bucatini.  

The service was on point.  Two of us were dairy-free so they were able to accommodate us with a dairy free menu.  When we were served our orders, everyone knew who the two individuals were (impressive).  Our server, Owen, was great!  

I am already dreaming about when I can come back!

pics.caption: Sticky Tasty Crunchy Toffee Yummy Cake
Wood Wood Oven Roasted Pig Face

review.des: I love the chef specially watching her on TV. I think of all her restaurants she has and I been to all of them this is the best for the food and the most crowded.   I think the only problem in most of the restaurant that the people taking reservations always say they are booked and when you get there there a lot of open tables and you get there have a reservation and the person you spoke to never took it down. Agh so you are there and they tell you you need to wait 2 hrs and you are like why I had reservations and the host argues with you making a scene when you know he has many open tables and stop  the arguments.  Hold and behold the nicest   Tall and handsome  blond host comes and remembers me from my previous times and sat me down right away.  The food here is amazing i love the goat the empanadas, the chick pea fritters were amazing the pork chic was delicious and the beef tongue was very good.  The goat is very good is my favorite.  The desserts are very delicious .

4.5 rounded up to a 5. We were able to snag a reservation last minute for our anniversary dinner on a Saturday night. I made the reservation via open table and mentioned the special occasion.

We arrived a little early so we were offered to head to the bar while our table was cleared. The host was very kind and wished us a happy anniversary.

We were seated at a smaller table and ordered a plethora of dishes. We absolutely loved the green beans, beef tongue, and pig face. We also ordered a special with both fish and goat (forgot the name) but we weren't wowed. I ordered the pineapple right side up cocktail and wasn't impressed either. The flavors didn't mesh and the cocktail was very heavy.

I'm docking a half of star because I left semi disappointed with the service. Our waitress was manning a lot of tables, so we felt a little rushed and often had to flag her down. Other reviews rave about how the service was great (especially for a special occasion) but we did not receive that.

Tl;Dr:  I liked the food, but the noise level and less than stellar service make me less likely to jump through the hoops required for a return visit any time soon.

Got a res (finally after several weeks of trying a couple months out). The restaurant is extremely loud - painful even. I had a sore throat from trying to talk in the restaurant. Tables are tightly packed but comfortable enough. We had:

Dill sourdough bread with salmon cream cheese. Ok but not much dill flavor.

Escargot ravioli. Very rich broth with 6 ravioli, each with one snail. Very tasty.

Goat empanadas. My favorite dish. Dough was nice and not too thick, filled with braised goat meat, covered in blueberry fruit salsa and on top of a bit of guacamole. Yum.

Pig face. Pig head braised for 24-35 hours (different servers said different times), then the meat is pulled off and formed into patties and fried. Arrives in a large portion of two patties, with tiny strips of crackling and an egg. Yum. Very rich. Large portion.  

Lamb ribs. Four ribs in very sweet blueberry glaze. Delicious.

Calamari brushetta. Very salty, the the rings were cooked perfectly.

Braised Goat belly with lobster. The ONLY miss of the meal. Way too rich and the flavors didn't work for me. Lots of vanilla.

I also had a tasty bourbon cocktail with apricot but don't remember the name.

The service was ok - not very warm or inviting or particularly helpful. I left my sweater on my seat but they didn't call me (even though they had my number from the reservation) and seemed put out when I called about it the next day. Clearly not a restaurant that feels like they need to work for your business. Too bad.

pics.caption: Braised goat belly with lobster. Not my jam. Way too rich
Pig face. Diners next to us thought they'd be getting an entire pig head....but nope.

review.des: This is probably our 8th time here. We have tasted all the menu and they are always developing new dishes. This is the first time we ordered goat shoulder! It was sooooo great! Cauliflower and peppers are our must order everytime great as well!
Simply great. Amazing cocktails, attentive service and unique share plates. Best cauliflower I've ever had and tremendous scallops, duck tongue & lamb ribs. Wish I could eat here every week!

Best for last? It's debatable... definitely best social dining experience I've ever had with strangers. Read on for details.

When I knew I was going to visit Chicago, it was a requirement to visit G&TG. Stephanie Izard has been my favorite Top Chef since her first appearance and just to dine in one of her restaurants has been a dream of mine. I showed up, sans reservations, and was able to find a place at the bar extension. My waiter gave me a menu and put a dot next to which items could be ordered in half-sizes. He suggested that I order four things, so I ordered:
- sauteed green beans (half order)
- wood grilled broccoli (half order)
- springy focaccia
- goat empanada (half order)

The man next to me had also ordered the green beans and I realized once his were delivered that a half order would be way too much for me. I jokingly said that we should have shared one order, and he agreed. A few minutes later, another man sat down across from us, also on his own and sitting at the bar. After my next course was delivered, a woman sat to my right and the four of us started chatting. I shared my broccoli and focaccia with our group and we all tasted sips of each others drinks. Slowly but surely, we added to our ragtag group of Misfit Toys until there were 9 of us passing our apps and drinks, insisting that everyone get a bite of this or that. Not counting the drinks, by the end of the night I had also tasted:
- shishito peppers
- escargot ravioli
- seared diver scallops
- duck tartare
- blueberry bourbon baba
....and so many others that I forgot to write down.

It got to the point where even our fearless bartender started throwing extra servings our way to accommodate the growing crowd of strangers.

This was, by far, the most expensive meal I've ever eaten solo. Granted, I did spend $20 on spices to bring home and another $30 on drinks, so I guess it actually wasn't that expensive.

I know firsthand now why Stephanie is both a Top Chef and Iron Chef victor. These bites were delectable and my only regret is that it will be a while before I can try them again.

pics.caption: Escargot ravioli (again from Alli, compliments of the bartender)

review.des: Wow!   Everything exceeded our expectations beyond anything we could have hoped.  Service.  Food.  Experience. Ambiance.  Way to go guys!!!
Chef Izard is amazing. Every dish is perfection. The presentation and level of service is spot on.

Came into Girl on a Friday night trying my luck to get seating since they were fully committed and had no availability after calling twice during the week and trying on OpenTable. Walking in the hostess with a lovely smile on her face told us that they were on a 2hr wait. I kindly told her no and that I would stalk the bar until someone got up instead. Thanks
Luckily, I found seating over by their lounge area and grabbed 2 seats. We were able to eat and drink there so it worked out fine. I loved the design of the restaurant and wished we were able to actually sit at a table to get the full experience.

Our order:
Drinks- Dolce Vita (was wayyy too strong and not what I thought so I returned it and got something else)
**The Sweet & Spicy Brioche-was ok. The jam that came with it was super delicious
**Pan Roasted Halibut-TO DIE for! there was some blueberry sauce that was hidden in the dish. Wow was it good! You may want to order 2 of theses!
**Grilled Walters Chicken- This is a lot of chicken for 2 ppl. Another thing to note is that it comes with a lot of cilantro on top. If your not a fan...you may want to rethink this dish or ask them to remove it.  We didn't know and my friend doesn't like cilantro so she had to pick through the chicken. The grapes was a nice addition of sweetness.

I would love to come back or try one of their sister restaurants.Girl and the Goat is a great place if your with a group because you'll have an opportunity to try more of their dishes.

pics.caption: Sweet bread w jam. Get it if your hungry and need something right away to eat. Otherwise try something else.. it's ok. The jam is delicious
Pan Roasted Halibut-The best Halibut everrrrr.  that blueberry sauce is everything!
Grilled Walters Chicken. Has a ton of cilantro on it. If you like cilantro go for it!

review.des: Omg...This place is amazing!  Found out this place a  week before my trip to Chicago, so it was too late to book a reservation.  We showed up around 4:30 pm on a rainy Tuesday, so lucky we had a table right when we got in, but we can only have that table for one hour.  We ordered a few plates and all were excellent.  Small portions so recommend two plates per person.  A little pricey, but worth it.  Great service.  Overall everything here is good.  Highly recommend this place.  Just make sure to book a reservation way in a advance.
Excellent food and surprising, particularly considering the somewhat under-whelming interior.  Would recommend for a meal any time of the day.
Chef Steph has really made a name for herself and I'm so proud to see how far she's come! Excellent food and service
The Hype is Real! The Goat Empanadas were straight up delicious! My Favorite places are the ones that are unique in taste as well as amazing in taste, and Girl & the Goat is the epitome of that.

This experience has left me wanting to go back and try everything I did not try on my 1st visit . I called everyday for 6 days trying to get a reservation ( make a reservation way ahead of time ) I was lucky that something opened up as the last seating of the night .  Everything  we tried was superb and if I had room I would have ordered more items .

1. The calamari bruschetta was phenomenal  loved by all in our party of 6

2. Sweet & spicy brioche -- wish I ordered 3 orders of this it was the best bread I ever had .

3. Pan seared halibut  - 2 thumbs up it was cooked to perfection along with a great sauce .
4. Goat empanadas - best empanadas I have ever had ( I have  tried many and these are the best )
5. Pig face - tasty and reminded me of a great hash another favorite of the night.
6. Hamachi crudo - delicate and awesome presentation a must try
7. Goat shoulder - this item must be pre-ordered ahead of time and if you have a big party it will be the center peice of your meal  ( falls off the bone and that naan bread along with the selection of sauces you will want to keep eating )
8. Green beans / roasted broccoli - I am so glad I ordered these it complemented our goat shoulder to perfection great flavor on both of these items

9. Candy corn/ chocolate cake - the servers added candles to these phenomenal desserts ( popcorn with ice cream was something I want to go back for )

The only thing missing was us running into the IRON CHEF IZARD ( will go again in hopes of running into her )

This place is flawless. It's the most yelped restaurant in all of Chicago and the co-owner/chef -
Stephanie Izard, just took the Iron Chef Gauntlet crown 4 days ago. Is this enough to convince you to try this place out?

We knew it was going to be hard to score a table without any reservations so we moved around our schedule and made sure to arrive here by 4:30pm (right when they open). We were 10 mins early and there were already a few parties inside waiting. Already a crowd waiting before opening? I already knew I was in for a sweet deal. When they were ready to seat people, we checked in and they had a communal table open for us. This was a pretty cool concept as they sat parties of 2 at a long table that could seat 8 in total. This gives the opportunity to mingle and talk with those around you and also gives you a sneak peak of the action in the kitchen.

Our server was great - gave us some recommendations and every dish that was brought out was quickly briefed to us on what was in it/how to eat it. If you're coming with a friend, the suggestion is to order 4 total dishes to share. Everything is family style here and is meant for sharing. Apparently, the most popular dish here is the Wood Oven Roasted Pig Face, but the Crisp Braised Pork Shank is also up there and since our server couldn't help us decide between the two, we decided to get both! Along with these two, we ordered the Pan Roasted Halibut and the Escargot Ravioli.

The first dish to come out was the Escargot Ravioli. The ravioli is paired with a very rich, salty broth, as well as some fried onions sprinkled on top. The broth though salty, had an interesting flavor, one that we've never had before. It was also our first time trying escargot and it had a unique taste to it. I think the broth was the main component to this dish - it really tied all the flavors together. Was the escargot amazing? Good, but not amazing, in my opinion. The Pan Roasted Halibut was second, and this had a mix of mushrooms and asparagus all paired with an Asian fusion peanut sauce. It was a nice juicy piece of halibut which I appreciated!

Now, the dishes that stole our hearts: Pig Face and Pork Shank.... The Roasted Pig Face was so unique and flavorful that we were too scared to finish the plate. Every bite was more delicious than the last. The Pig Face gets its name from the patty that is made by the meat from a pigs head. It's meant to eat like a hash, so you mix together the patty with a sunny side up egg as well as the crunchy potato strings. They really hit it out of the park with this one, if you're having a hard time deciding what to order, do yourself a favor and order this. Truly phenomenal. The Pork Shank was no laughing matter either. It came with a side of naan and the pork was fall off the bone, with a crispy skin all around. Every piece was juicy and tender. It was paired with two dipping sauces, but we felt the pork was better by itself.

Overall, this restaurant definitely lives up to it's fame. My only complaints would be small portions and high prices. However, given the setting and the quality of the food, that's expected. We can see why you would need to reserve months in advance to get a table here. Will be back for some pig face!

Had an absolutely amazing experience here. The ambience is warm, the service friendly and the food bountiful and savoury. I can't remember the last time I had such a wonderful experience accompanied by great food. We made reservations approx 3 weeks in advance. If you are dining with 1 other person, ask for the "chef's table". Essentially, this is a front row seat by the open kitchen and grants you and your guest the opportunity to watch the kitchen staff of about 10 chefs (5 men, 5 women) put together some of the most wonderful food creations known to mankind. The great thing? We did not ask for the chef's table but were graciously afforded this opportunity...just because. Since we had to wait (all of 10 mins) to be seated our waiter said that we would get a dish "on the house." Well, that could not have been further from the truth. We ordered 5 share dishes off the menu...and got 10. Outstanding. The 5 extra menu items were called "minis" which meant the dishes were not full courses. Could have fooled me. Although we were 2, we were unable to finish any of our dishes. So, be prepared to deal with first world issues of the inability to eat everything on your plate. Since this was one meal in a lifetime, I was not guilted into thinking about world hunger and enjoyed the sumptuous spread. Everything from the broccoli to the cauliflower to the sweet onion bread was amazing.  There are many choices for the vegetarian, considering my guest and I do not eat chicken, beef or goat.  You are bound to find something you like on their electic menu.  Wish this experience could be gotten in Toronto... Well, on the off chance Girl and The Goat (GATG) was thinking to expand its borders, I did invite its owner to consider opening up shop in Toronto. Bravo GATG, thanks for a wonderful culinary experience.

pics.caption: Walleye fish with small cherry-like tomatoes. Easily one of my favourite dishes. Crispy yet delicate. Mild flavour.
Sweet Onion bread with a specialty butter and a relish marmalade. Just lovely!
Broccoli with pine nuts. Bursting with flavour!

review.des:
I was very excited to try this restaurant.  I made the reservation weeks in advance and even then there were not a lot of available time slots.   The interior of the restaurant is nice but the tables are very close together and it is extremely noisy.  

Our favorite dish was the chocolate dessert.   The Brioche bread was also good.   We weren't as happy with our other choices.    The meat dishes (Lamb Ribs, Pig's Face) were very fatty and heavy.   We also did not like the Kohlrabi Salad.  

We left disappointed and confused as to why there were so many high ratings.

I think the overall ratings of 6K+ people at 4.5 stars speaks for itself!

There's a reason that Chef Stephanie Izard is a Top Chef winner AND a freakin' Iron Chef now. She's taking the culinary world by storm for good reason - her food and ability to mix & experiment with flavours is off the charts!

I came here with my fiance on our trip to Chicago, and we came here on a Sunday @ 7pm and booked almost 2 months in advance. On the night of, this place was PACKED!! But for good reason as you'll soon see!

To begin, the service was awesome. We came in, gave my name that the reso was under, and were seated almost immediately. The vibe was super chill and casual, and they even had a couch area for people who wanted to lounge around.

The drink menu was pretty diverse, with a bunch of IPAs and hipster beers, along with your usual wine menu and some pretty unique cocktails.

Now to the food... the star of the show! Here's the thing, coming into a Top Chef (and now Iron Chef) restaurant, you've got some pretty high expectations. I would say most dishes will definitely blow your tastebuds

sautéed green beans with fish sauce vinaigrette. cashews: This was simply delicious. Such a simple dish with a few ingredients, but executed so flawlessly. The beans were perfectly cooked, and the fish sauce vinaigrette was not too salty, nor too sweet and went very well with the beans. Cashews added a very nice crunch. Very good portion size for 2. 5/5

roasted cauliflower with pickled peppers. pine nuts. mint: This was sooo delicious. Who would have thought you could cook vegetables, let alone cauliflower, so flavourful!!! The mint added an amazing punch of flavour, with a nice zing of acidity from the pickled peppers. What a play on textures and flavours! 5/5

duck tartare gooseberries . pickled mushrooms . gochujang mayo . cracklins . duck fat lavish: Another homerun dish!! The duck tartare was prepared perfectly and garnished with the mayo, mushrooms, gooseberries, etc. on the side so you can mix as much or as little as you wanted to. It came with 3 or 4 big crispy crackers (i.e. cracklins) that you topped with the tartare. It wasn't as gamey as I would have expected and the texture was amazing with so much going on. 5/5
