confit goat belly bourbon butter . lobster and crab . fennel: This was a special of the day at the time, but looks like they may have made it a regular menu item. the goat belly was similar to pork belly, except with a little bit of gaminess. Completely melt in your mouth, and the lobster and crab were also perfectly cooked. Everything in this dish came so well together including the fennel that gave the dish a good crunch and liquorice flavour. Only thing that could have made this better was reducing the amount of butter in the dish... it was literally a pool of butter at the bottom. 5/5

wood oven roasted pig face with sunny side egg. tamarind. cilantro . red wine-maple . potato stix: OK. Everyone said this was amazing on the reviews, BUT I would say this was actually the dish we least enjoyed. It was good nonetheless, but maybe it was because we already had so much great food! You mix the egg in with bunch of crispy roasted pig chunks and potato sticks, and sort of becomes a crispy mush. I think it could have used a lot more cilantro to freshen up the overall dish as it was quite rich. 4/5

chocolatey - chocolate cake shiitake gelato: By dessert, we were insanely stuffed. But we knew we just had to order the most-raved about dessert. Luckily we ordered this cake because it was such an amazing finish to an already great meal. The cake was similar to a chocolate lava cake, with oozy chocolate filling inside. The shiitake gelato tasted EXACTLY like the mushrooms, and it was all topped with a crispy chocolate crunch topping and vanilla cream sauce. I wish I had some of this right now! 5/5

Overall, the flavours were amazing and the portion sizes were surprisingly large. I think Izard would completely kill it (in a good way) if she were to open a fine-dining establishment. She's got a very unique take on mixing flavours and it seems to be working incredibly well. She's taking risks on flavour and I think that's what makes her a killer chef.

pics.caption: confit goat belly bourbon butter . lobster and crab . fennel
wood oven roasted pig face with sunny side egg. tamarind. cilantro . red wine-maple . potato stix

review.des:
This place was amazing. Everything is meticulously planned from the decor, service, and especially food. They will bring out the food to you in a certain way when you order certain dishes with the taste of your palette in mind.

I ordered the very old fashioned, a local IPA from Chicago, and the pork face dish.

Very Old Fashioned - made of top shelf liquor, mixed evenly with other flavors to give a perfect balance.

Chicago IPA - I enjoyed this as it is different from West Coast IPAs. Less hoppy and smoother body flavor.

Pork face - Very good dish! Perfectly roasted succulent pork face that melts in your mouth, topped with an egg, and a crunchy potato sticks, maple gastrique,  and tamarind vinagarette.

Everything was amazing, and I could describe it better, but I just recommend trying it yourself. This place is worth the hype. Also, bring a group so you can try many dishes! It's tapas style.

pics.caption: Chicago IPA, can't remember the brewery

review.des: There is nothing I can type here that you haven't already read or know about this place, just know the experience and the food is worth every bit of the 5 stars! The goat empanadas, the decor around the empanadas, the soft crab cakes looked so damn amazing I wanted to eat them and I don't eat crab cakes, the entrees, this place is must eat for any Yelper who happens to be in the Chicago area. Make your reservation a month out and make sure you get to experience this atmosphere and kitchen mastery!

I had a friend come in from out of town for the first time and out of all the recommendations from all the people he knew Girl & the Goat was the one consistent restaurant suggested. So of course he wanted to go, and of course I was more than happy to play the tour guide!

This was my second trip to this restaurant and honestly it was absolutely fantastic. Maybe it was because I tried a different range of items, maybe the service was just THAT much better (as in, excelled beyond a near flawless standard already), maybe it was the company, or maybe a little bit of all of that but I really loved the experience and can't waitlist go back.

pics.caption: Dessert. The Baba is always a must. And the truffle ice cream was a very earthy and delicious item.

review.des:
Amazing restaurant with reasonable prices. Full flavors with great texture and balanced meals. I highly suggest trying 1 or 2 dishes from the goat, vegetable, fish and meat sections to get the best experience.
This is a great restaurant to bring out of Towners!

It seems as though everyone and their mother recommended this place for dinner. So on our first night out in Chicago this was a must. I'm a huge Stephanie Izzard fan. First of all the bartender not only knew how to make our favorite drink but made it perfectly (so yourself a favor and try a Paperplane) we started off with the Pan fried shishito peppers (beautiful flavor) goat empanadas (yum), roasted cauliflower (lovely), the halibut (really delicious flavor combination), lamb ribs ( insanely tender). And we still had room for dessert..shocker I know. Lol we had the popcorn and malt balls, fantastic just like the rest of the meal.

pics.caption: Fall off the bone lamb ribs. Enough said

review.des:
Always love the food at GATG. Sure the plating mostly looks kind of meh, but the taste is always good. Dishes I have tried range from good to outstanding. Plus, I love that Chef Izard posted her recipes online so that I can learn some of her trick, for example the blueberry nuoc cham! As I hardly successfully book though Opentable, I always walk in, and my strategy is either come early (4:30 or 5 PM), or very late (10PM or later), and I never have to wait too long.

The reason I'm giving GATG 4 stars is that the desserts were never their strength, plus in my most recent visit,my all time favorite dish roasted cauliflower was very salty, hopefully it was a solely low note!

pics.caption: Wood Oven Roasted Pig Face - personally I don't think this dish is that great!

review.des: AMAZING food and service to match!! Missed a couple pictures but everything was delicious and beautiful!! Two dishes per person is a lot, especially two people. Still, so many delicious options, try as much as you can!

pics.caption: Chocolate Pavlova Says-A-Me- Black Sesame bark was so so good!!

review.des:
Worst table after waiting 20 mins past our reservation.  Sat right behind host table up against the bar half with people in the bar standing over us.  3 hosts were bumping up against my chair all during dinner.  A gaggle if loud girls were hanging over the bar partition looking down at our table.  They were shouting and we couldn't even hear each other talk.  Horrible experience.

We've been loyal to all of the "goat" restaurants for years

You'd think their reservation system would recognize loyal customers and treat them with some special attention or even any recognition

Really bad experience.   Will not be back.

My foodie friend literally said "I don't want to drink water because I don't want to wash the food out of my mouth."  I concur, I concur.

The ambiance was cool, with art hanging on the wall, darkly lit with the kitchen fires providing some light.  Our waitress was super helpful, and absolutely nailed the recommendations.  The food is meant to be shared, so we ordered about 7-8 plates for 4 people.

The escargot ravioli was first, and made me stop chewing to slowly appreciate the developing flavors.  Cooked perfectly, I wanted to lick the bowl after we were done.  The goat belly was what knocked our socks off, and had my friend saying what she did.  The crab, butter, sauce, and veggies on top all played beautifully together, making us consider waiting another 40 minutes for them to cook another plate.  The ribs was also a socks-knock-offer, perfectly seasoned, lightly spicy, and soft enough to pull apart.  The halibut dish and green beans were also good, not top tier, but different enough to break up the goat, beef and pork.  

I'll definitely be back, even if i have to come in before the staff does.

pics.caption: Ribssssssssss, my favorite second only to the goat belly

review.des:
I have been wanting to try this place for years.  My husband and I secured an early seating on a Saturday evening (4:45pm to be exact) to celebrate our wedding anniversary as I have been dying to dine here.  First off, it is near impossible to get a weekend reservation, and people are not lying when they say the secure their months in advance.  The restaurant opened at 4:30pm and by 5:15pm it was already packed so you should secure a reservation, or you will be fighting for the limited bar seats.  

The ambiance in here is extremely trendy, and the restaurant itself is a very open space concept.  Because it is small tables are essentially on top of one another to try to accommodate as many guests at one time as possible.  I do enjoy creeping on other people's food orders so to that extent it was perfect seating--getting up to use the restroom though was slightly complicated.  I liked the open kitchen concept.  It was fun to look over to see the team hard at work whipping up delightful treats!
I love tapas style restaurants, and Girl & the Goat puts out an amazing variety of creative plates, but I feel there are other restaurants in Chicago like Purple Pig that do creative tapas style plates just as well!  Don't get me wrong, Stephanie Izard and her team are doing amazing things, but I do feel the restaurant is overhyped.  I do think part of the appeal is getting one of their coveted reservations, which is why this place is a "must dine".  I think it is a creative culinary experience you should opt to have at least once, but there are other restaurants that dish out the same level of creativity.

The service here is excellent.  Gerson was our service, and he was on point.  Very friendly, and informative.  But, the entire team here seems to work as a well-oiled machine from the host to the kitchen staff.   No water glass or drink ever sat empty, and the plates were promptly cleared once courses were finished.  The service was very impressive.

The food was extremely creative, and very enjoyable.  I loved that the menu was split up by the main component of the dish so veggie, fish, meat, bread, goat, oysters and dessert.  I LOVE that there is a whole section of the menu dedicated to goat dishes.  I think that is what sets this place apart from other tapas style restaurants.  The cocktail menu was also diverse and well made.  My favorite was the best of 3.

We ordered the following items: roasted beets, hamachi crudo, goat carpaccio, duck tongue, pig face, vitelo tonnato, confit goat belly, Milk stout tiramisu and malt balls.  The roasted beets and pig face were my least favorite.  The pig face was mentioned in A LOT of reviews, so I felt like we had to try it.  I think it's one of the most boring items on their menu in terms of creativity.  It seemed to just be flavorless and over salted.  The beet salad fell flat in the flavor department.  It was fine, but after eating so many other flavorful items on their menu it just had no wow factor.

My favorite dishes were the vitelo tonnato and the confit goat belly.  Both were dishes that were packed with flavor, and I did not want them to end.  That's the saddest part about small plates, when you find something you love it's over so soon!  The veal tartare was simply divine--the flavors exploded in your mouth, and it was served with house made potato chips.  The saltiness of the chips was a perfect complement to the raw veal.  The confit goat belly interested me because it was served with shellfish.  The flavor combination between the goat belly and lobster was delicious, and the bourbon butter sauce wrapped the entire dish up perfectly. The duck tongue was also another unique concept that we really enjoyed.  All the raw dishes were uniquely prepared and extremely flavorful.  I would really love to try more of the goat themed plates.  

As for the dessert the malt balls were the extremely unexpected favorite.  The combo of the caramel corn and ice cream was a great surprise.  The tiramisu was served very creatively in a coffee cup, but the flavors were just ok.  I think the milk stout took away from the sweet liquor taste of standard tiramisu.  

All in all our dining experience at Girl & the Goat was great.  Their menu is extremely creative, and the food was well prepared.  Service is also top notch.  It is a great restaurant, but I wish reservations were more easily accessible.  There are also other restaurants in the city that dish out creative tapas as well as Girl & the Goat, which is why I think it is overhyped a bit!  Everyone who enjoys creative small plates should visit the Goat just once!

Visiting from LA I was so excited to find out my friend scored a reservation for the group of us. The place was amazing, our server was amazing, the food was amazing.

What was NOT amazing was the glass of milk the busboy spilled down my back. He of course wiped it up but I was disappointed that nobody acknowledged the fact that I had to remove my soaked shirt. Thank god I had a T-shirt on underneath that didn't get that wet.  Not a big deal but an apology would have been nice considering the 10 of us dropped $900.

Never been.  My brother went and said that it was FIRE!  He's been grinding too much too take me with the kid and all.  

G&tG I can't wait to taste those saucy bites!

This place went easily to my top 5 places in Chicago! You just have to get past the names of some of the things on the menu but once you do its well worth it. I was blown away with every single thing I got on the menu. One of the best scallop dishes I have ever had. Pig Face was amazing flavors too Crispy pork shank. Lobster dish was excellent as well. I can't wait to go back for more! I tried to come to this restaurant 4 different trips to Chicago and every time they were over 2 hours wait. So I finally went right when they opened and got a table. Highly recommend this place.

pics.caption: One of the best scallop dishes I have had
Pig Face was amazing - Just order it

review.des: We went for a surprise birthday date and they put us up at the chefs table! The waiter was so good. They took such good care of us. The waiter bought us a complimentary side, the chefs made us some special dishes on the house, and the waiter gave us an additional free desert when we couldn't decide between two! I've never had such a great experience being taken care of and the food and wine was excellent. Girl and the Goat has a stellar reputation and they exceeded that expectation wildly!

So say you're me and you're in town for a bit and you're considering this place because all of your friends who have been to Chicago have highly recommended this place, but you're like "Wow but it's $$$, I'm not loaded!" But you're also like, "But how many times do I really go to Chicago though?"

Well stop being indecisive and make a reservation here already (you'll need one!) Or if you're just like me and super late at planning and try to walk in for a table no matter what the wait is, you might end up sitting in the lounge area where they have open seating and still serve food, so your day isn't completely ruined. You might even end up sharing a table with some friendly locals or maybe some tourists in town, just like you.

Now you have to order. Get the duck tongue. It might sound gross, but seriously, if you don't get this one, you're missing out. Get it. First thing on your order should be the duck tongue.

As for everything else, EVERYTHING IS TASTY!!! Ask the server for recommendations as I do, and order everything they suggest. Okay maybe not everything, but however much your group and your collective wallets can handle.

Walked in without reservations, and we had two options. sit on the lounge area or the bar top. Our server was great and gave us wonderful recommendations. Everything was delicious but my favorite dishes are Sock eye salmon and the Pork Shank. Order it and you won't be disappointed.

10/10 would highly recommend this place, but make sure to call in advance and book a reservation if you're picky about where you sit.

I was excited to try out new things in Chicago, but was warned to make reservations for this place online in advance. So I just clicked for reservations for a 10:30pm table for 4, about 2 months in advance. It was nice that they also made a phone call about two days before the reservations so we would be reminded that we had a table.

Walking in- the place is dimmed and packed and super busy
Sitting down- the tables were a bit tight and I almost hit the table behind me. oopsies

What we ordered:
Roasted Cauliflower ($13) this was good. a different take on your usual cauliflower

Wood grilled broccoli ($13) nice texture and it was cooked perfectly

Sauteed green beans ($12) This was okay. Wasn't special to me

Seared diver scallops ($18) Only had two pieces, which was a bummer. Scallops were cooked just right.

Pan roasted halibut ($19) Not a fan of this. Was a bit disappointing to the table.

Duck tartare ($16) This was my favorite one out of all the dishes! The waiter said it won awards too, and you can easily taste the dish and understand why that happened!

Lamb Ribs ($17) I personally do not like lamb, but this was cooked nice and fell right off the bone. The sauces were good and the meat was nice and juicy.

Goat empanada - I did not try this but my table liked it.

Alcohol - good drinks, but seemed a bit water downed

Paid about $240 for 4 people and left just full

100% worth the hype. Everything from the service to the lighting (and obviously the food) was perfect. Our server was extremely helpful and guided us through the menu, providing suggestions and even a few items on the house because they paired nicely with what we had ordered!!! The goat empanadas were amazing, as was the pig face and the green beans!!! When I go back I'll skip dessert and order more appetizers.

Thank you Girl & the Goat for the most amazing dining experience.
Great service and amazing food.
A trip to Chicago must include at least one meal at Girl and the Goat!

Waiting area was awesome. Drinks and appetizers before the meal while. You wait the very long tome It will take you to eat!
But worth the wait!

Wow! A truly magnificent dining experience. It's shared plates style, we did 2-3 plates per person for a party of 3 and ended up with a check of $157 with 2 drinks too. Not bad at all, and we were stuffed.

Highlights: Hamachi crudo, scallops, pig face

Everything we ordered was awesome though, you definitely have to try the green beans and get one of the freshly baked breads, we went with the onion brioche and loved it.

They have good cocktails! Great wine and beer list too

Oh, you need reservations!

Amazing food. Amazing service. Always worth the trip and the reservation. When we were there last we were surprised to be comped a fish appetizer. I typically do not like seafood and really enjoyed it. Can't speak highly enough about this place.

What an incredible dinner.  My wife and I finally made it here together and we were NOT disappointed.  From start to finish, we were so pleased.  I met Stephanie Izard years ago when she was in Ann Arbor, MI for a lecture / demo and her thoughts on the Chicago food scene impressed me even then.  She is a creative and culinary force.
My wife and I split seven different courses and each one was incredible for all the right reasons.  Unusual flavor combinations, interesting textures, it was all focused, driven, and exciting.  Our server just threw in an extra oyster dish because she HEARD us contemplating it.  Our server was superb.  Attentive, fun, knowledgeable, and made us feel like we were her only table.
I can't recommend a restaurant any higher than Girl & the Goat.

This place was on a must try list recommended by my friends. After rushing there prior to opening to grab a seat! We were so thrilled to try their food! The vibe inside is so nice and great for dates! I LOVED their soft shell crab cake and duck tongue!!! However, everything else was meh... The pig face was SO porky and the lamb belly was weird. All and all, it was a great experience. The food was not worth it's price. Prob won't be back.

pics.caption: Green bean with lots of cream..
Soft shell crab cake..best in the house

review.des: This place is slamming so make sure you make reservations a head of time. We waiting for 2 hours and found a seat at the bar. Everything was relishes tapas style. I highly recommend!

Such a great experience! Service was impeccable, the food was great and a very lively atmosphere. Our server, Owen, was absolutely amazing! We went to the restaurant to celebrate a job offer and Owen was sure to make our experience the best it could be. I cannot wait to come back!

Food was great aside from our waitress who looks like a horrid & apparently deaf version of my speech professor, who kept condescending me for no apparent reason other then me answering to what I'm allergic to which is a shellfish preservative. Anyway, I didn't even want seafood & almost didn't order anything w/o her misunderstanding & talking over me w/her bitchy valley girl voice, "wait, whuuuuut?" Geez, have a lil' understanding & patience, woman! I didn't kill your cat!

Rarely does something so "hipster" and "cool" live up to the hype. I visited on a Tuesday evening and was shocked by how crowded it was. I just managed to grab a seat at the bar.

The staff was friendly and attentive, which is rare for similar places I've visited. They made up for the mediocre cocktails.

I loved everything I had, from the green beans to the halibut to the bruschetta. If I ever manage to go again, I may actually try some goat (and not cop out with goat cheese)!

not impressed. we decided to walk in at a weeknight and got in 1 hour after putting our name in. we decided to sit at the lounge instead of the dining area but food is served the same.

we tried some of their signature items which comes in tapas style (sigh, meaning less food for more!) - their goat carpaccio, escargot ravioli, and bucatini. favorite was the goat capaccio and while i liked it, the flavors just weren't anything to write home about. the escargot was tasty but couldn't tell it was escargot. overall, we left feel unimpressed and didn't know what all the hype was about.

Round two for our dining in Chicago.  Girl and goat was delicious! We had dinner at the bar, Lilly our barista was a trip and guided us to what foods to order and how many to order to get the full experience.  We had so much we nearly rolled out of there!  The final order was a pork shoulder with lobster pieces in butter. I can't say enough how amazing it was.  We opted to not roll out and walked 4 miles home because we overindulged!

It only took me 4+ years of regularly visiting Chicago to check this place out...

When I got my work schedule to see when I'd be in Chicago, the first thing I did was to see if I'd be able to score a reservation during my visits. Luckily for me, I was able snatch the only table left on a Saturday night at 9:30 PM. Once we were seated, the server explained to us it is family-style and to order everything at once, and they will progressively bring our meals out. Our items came out in the following order

- Goat Liver Mousse ($14): a bit of an "aggressive" start to our meal, but the light and airy bread was AWESOME
- Calamari Bruschetta ($17): perfectly-cooked calamari and once again, awesome bread
- Sauteed Green Beans ($12): nice and crunchy, and the fish sauce vinaigrette was creamy, with little to no hints of the fish sauce
- Escargot Ravioli ($16): the highlight was the delicious bacon tamarind sauce, which tasted more like a brown butter sauce
- Wood Oven Roasted Pig Face ($19): tender pieces of pork, with the crunchiness of the potato sticks, and the richness of the egg. Hands down, the best dish of the night!

Overall, a fantastic meal with no duds. I give it 4 stars, because one of my friends found everything to be salty (which I can agree with to an extent). I can see why it's ranked #1 on Yelp, and hopefully it won't be another couple of years until my next visit!

I went to this restaurant years ago when it first opened! And it was AMAZING! I went in early May 2018 and I wasn't as impressed. Don't get me wrong it was still very good but something was missing from the flavor profile of the dishes. The service was great! All in all I recommend

We decided to check this place out after learning that owner,  Stephanie  Izard is an iron chef. We are not able to make reservations but we're told to arrive and there would be room at the bar if we waited. Ended up waiting 40 minutes. When we were seated the staff was friendly, knowledgeable about the drinks and food. This place is tapas style. For two people should order 5-6 dishes.

We ordered Pan Fried Shishito Peppers parmesan, sesame, miso which was delicious and tad bit spicy. Great starter.

We also ordered Crispy Beef Short Ribs which came with red grapefruit chermoula. This was amazing and would highly recommend.

The Goat Empanadas was also delicious and made with miso-blue cheese aioli, and cane with side of squash-apple slaw.

The roasted cauliflower came with pickled peppers, pine nuts, mint. This dish was a little greasy and I wouldn't order it in future.

Lastly, the grilled halibut was also crispy and nicely seasoned. Would try it in future.

In summary, I would come back in the future. This restaurant has laid laid back rustic ambiance and amazing flavored food.

My girlfriend and I came here right at opening (4:30 pm) and sat at the bar since we didn't have a reservation. We ordered the pig face and lamb ribs, which were both good, but that was where the good things about this restaurant ended. This was the absolute worst restaurant experience either of us have ever had, the bartenders were beyond rude and condescending. As soon as we told the bartender we wouldn't be ordering any drinks, she glared at us and proceeded to ignore us the rest of the time we were there (while being extremely friendly to the people next to us who were spending hundreds). Someone needs to teach the servers that they need to treat everyone with respect, not just the rich customers. Would never come back or recommend to anyone.

Love this place, checked on the reservation site and happened to see an opening Saturday for Saturday night! Score!!! Great date place of course.  Food and cocktails were on point.  We actually went in for just some snacks and a drink and ended up not being able to stop ordering the food was so good.  Scallops were my favorite the broccoli was pretty great too.  These guys do a fantastic job.

I'm really on the fence about this one, but as a caveat, I had really high expectations for this place because of how many of my friends raved about it. First time in Chicago -- already tried many many delicious places, and this was my last stop before an early flight home.

Ambiance: Very loud and lively (was a little too much hustle and bustle...) Artwork on the wall is pretty dope.

Service: I can see why some of the reviews say it's a bit pretentious. I didn't like the vibe our hostess gave off. I don't know how to put it but it's less than genuine. Our server...on the other hand, was amazeballs! I feel bad for forgetting her name but she went above and beyond to cater to our table. One of us was allergic to egg, and the other was vegetarian. She went to the kitchen, marked all the allergy safe foods for us, and made adjustments to our orders as necessary. I've never seen a restaurant do this before. Truly appreciated!

Food: The food was delicious, but I wouldn't say it's amazing. We ordered:

Fish Sauce Green Beans - this was good but I'm more of a fan of the traditional asian style (whether it's fish sauce and XO, or szechuan style)
Hamachi Crudo - good
Goat Empanadas - good
Shishito Peppers - meh. my friends liked it a lot
Braised Pork Shank - delicious
Pig Face - BEST THING I ate - would definitely come back for this!

We went to this place as a recommendation from a friend. It was an absolute amazing experience. My wife is not the most outgoing when it comes to food, but the way they prepare everything made it for an experience we would recommend over and over again. Amazing food, experience, drinks and service.

This place was absolutely amazing. I didn't have reservations but my partner and I found a seat right away at the bar. There we were greeted by Jason who was very knowledgeable in the menu and gave us some great options. For starters we had the goat liver moose (delicious), then the corn perogies (favorite), confit goat belly (amazing), sautéed green beans (on the house), and the crisp braised pork shank. The liver moose was very good and filling, so I wouldn't recommend if you're getting many items like this. By the end of the moose dish we were pretty full. The perogies were SO GOOD. Honestly the best I've ever had, cooked to perfection with a Latin spin to them. The confit goat belly had a butterscotch flavor to it that made the entire dish, I mean it was just perfect. We were surprised when a server came by and dropped off the green beans dish (on the house). The green beans were the best green beans I've ever had. The fish sauce was perfect and not too overbearing, and the green beans were cooked perfectly. Lastly we had the pork shank. This was a large plate and we were so full that we had to take most of it to go. Honestly it was my least favorite dish, but it was still really good and cooked perfectly. Jason was such an AMAZING server/ bartender. All the options he gave us didn't disappoint and he checked up on us at appropriate times where we didn't feel forgotten or too pushed. Honestly great service! His drinks were also TOP NOTCH. It was nice having conversation with Fabian as well. Just very polite gentlemen, good service, and great food. I plan on becoming a regular here.
Such an amazing FIRST VISIT!!!!

When friends come to Chicago... this is the first place I recommend. Getting a table here isn't easy, but if you can book in advance then your won't regret it.

Just an amazing place with cool fun vibe... a great date spot (if you really like the person as if can get pricy) or just a fun spot to grab a bite and drink over the weekend with friends.
Super tasty. I love the cauliflower dish and the servers are very knowledgeable  this is a must try in Chicago

Impromptu date night after we couldn't get into tonight's yelp event. Even better was there was immediate seating on the patio which we gladly took advantage of rather than a 1-2 hour wait since we didn't have a reservation.  It was a little cool but not intolerable. The fact that I could hear my husband and actually engage in a real conversation was a plus- it can be a little too loud in the main dining hall.

Stephanie Izard's restaurant is hands down my favorite in the city. I think this is my 10th visit?!? There is a reason she is the current Iron Chef winner. She's freaking brilliant with food.

You don't like vegetables? Come here. They will be a party in your mouth. We started with my tried and true- the sautéed green beans which were then followed up with the roasted cauliflower, hamachi crudo, and lastly the beef tongue. Mind you, I normally don't do beef tongue but hubby wanted it and since he was treating, I figured we had to get at least one thing he was interested in trying.

I would get all of it again. If I had a bigger crew, I'd also get pig fave and the pork shank for good measure. The green beans are a MUST TRY. I am going to also write a tip to get that point across.

pics.caption: Chocolate cake. Server's recommendation. Not my favorite but not bad.

review.des: I've tried to make reservations to this restaurant multiple times and it's always booked out for weeks. I decided to stop by right when it opened at 4:30 and was able to get table right away! Ordered the goat empanadas, roasted cauliflower, tilefish and goat loin. Delicioussssss.

The first time I came here, I thought it was one of the best meals of my life. This is hard to top a second time around, but I was still pretty blown away. And I'm not even that big of a goat fan -- blasphemy, I know.

Roasted Beets was a cool take on a beet salad. Sishito Peppers were as good as sishito peppers always are. Wood Grilled Broccoli was good. Hamachi Crudo was pretty yum.

The Pig Face was really very interesting but not as great as I was hoping. The Goat Empanadas were really good, something about the empanada casing and the sauces on top really complimented the goat well. The Goat Belly itself sort of got lost among everything else on its plate. I was really impressed by the Pork Shank -- definitely MVP, the buttermilk dressing and radish kimshi really added some good texture and interesting flavors.

This place knows what it's doing, and it's running on all cylinders. Props to all hands on deck. A must-have for anybody in Chicago.

I'm going to give this restaurant 4 stars because honestly there wasn't anything bad about the experience. The service was great and the food was really tasty, but for as much hype as this place receives, I don't think it quite lives up.

My boyfriend made the reservation almost 3 months ago just to get a decent time for a weekend night.

We got 5 dishes: green beans, broccoli, goat belly, goat empanadas, and the pork shank. The stand out dishes for me were the pork shank, goat belly, and green beans. The food was all really good just nothing wowed us.

The dessert was very good, we had the blueberry bourbon baba.

We left completely stuffed.

Again, good food and great service, I'd recommend it, just for how much this place is talked about I wasn't blown away.
One of my favorite spots in Chicago, very creative and clever with their dishes. Tried the green beans, the soft she'll crab, the halibut, the pig face and lamb shank. They were all incredible

Amazing farm to table delicacies by #masterchef #stephanieizard. A trip to #chicago must include at least one meal at #girlandthegoat! Ask for Cesar who took excellent care of us. Lamb ribs cooked with tamarind glaze were amazing as well as melt in your mouth Pork Shanks, wood grilled peppers, stuffed squash blossom crab ragoon, corn pierogis. For dessert, the bourbon soaked cake pieces with amazing bourbon ice cream topped with blueberries is a must have even if you are full. The sauces and garnishes result in an explosion of flavors that make the dining experience unforgettable. I highly recommend this gem of a restaurant where locals and tourists converge to experience the succulent flavors of Chef Izard's cuisine. Reservations a must! Thanks to Amex Platinum for getting us in with 24 hr notice when no one else could!

I went back in February 2018 with a group of 8 friends and family. The staff was very friendly despite the restaurant being packed. And my friends think i'm crazy for saying this, but simply put, the food wasn't very good.

It wasn't bad, but i don't see what all the excitement is about.

There wasn't one dish where I said to myself "wow, that was amazing". And I'm not that hard to please.

It's just not that good, people.

Top-notch service with great food! Branzino with papaya salad was a standout for us. Would have preferred just plain oysters on the half-shell but were good anyway. The carmel corn/ice cream/chocolate dessert was good but expected to be blown away; I guess it's an easy sale (us for one!). Loud and tough to walk to/from table because it's so crowded in there.

I loved the unique flavors of this restaurant. The mix of asian and Western flavors were done beautifully. The service was excellent and decor tasteful and whimsical. It gets a bit loud later in the night. I would definitely come back! I strongly recommend reservations.

Visiting from out of town and finally got to try girl and the goat, which has been on my list since I saw Stephanie Izard winning Iron Chef ! We were seated at 10:45pm on a Friday as that was the only available reservation a month in advance. We were told by friends who had visited previously that we should tell our waiter we'd have what the chef recommends. Ended up getting:

Fried oysters
Shishito peppers
Sautéed green beans
Scallops
Skuna bay salmon
Pork shank
Goat empanadas

We then proceeded to also order:

Lamb ribs
Goat belly confit
Honey cake
Caramel corn and malt balls

This was all for three people. Everything was good and overall, I would say the restaurant is worth visiting / trying at least once. The ambiance was very nice, the restaurant was beautiful and the staff was very attentive. I don't think any one particular dish stood out that blew my mind so I wouldn't go in with too high expectations.

Creative and entertaining dining .
Atmosphere: the space is incredible. It's very laid back , small tables, great lounge nook areas and bar sitting area. The decor and flower arrangements are very complimentary to the overall theme of the restaurant.
Service : very attentive and seamless . Although at times it felt like the dish was pulled away from me before I had a chance to really savor it .
Food: everything was delicious. I had their famous green beans - solid dish with a nice sauce (fish sauce based). Lamb ribs - cooked pervectly. Crab rangoons are light and crisp. Pirogies are simple, might not be worth trying . All of the drinks were very well balanced and beautifully presented.  Overall , good food. It lacked spike and daring flavors and combinations I was expecting .

I am very impressed though with the creativity around the name of the restaurant and following through  with the theme throughout every aspect of customer's dining experience.

What an experience. The tapas style was a great way to experience all the gastronomical treats. Of special  note: scallops, pig face, goat empanadas, chick pea fritters, and shishito peppers. Plates are small but rich and flavorful. Worth every cent.

Service was world class and our waiter was the best we've had in a long time. Thoughtful, attentive and funny. All in a very cool, laid back but classy environment.

I was looking forward to having dinner at Girl & the Goat after checking out their ratings (4 1/2 stars with over 6,000 reviews)! The setup inside is great, with a rustic feel to it. The plates are all family style (I'd recommend getting 4-5 plates for two people).

We ordered the focaccia bread and kohlrabi salad to start. The salad tasted fresh and included fennel, evalon, toasted almonds (favorite), and blueberries. The bread was served with a caesar dressing and cauliflower, which was pretty unique but surprisingly went well together. We then proceeded to share the halibut, lamb ribs, and pork chops. The lamb ribs literally fell off the bone and melted in your mouth - they were the most delicious ribs I've ever tasted. The pan roasted halibut was equally delicious - the almond butter, white asparagus, and blueberry nuoc cham gave it so much flavor and kept it very moist. The pork chop wasn't my favorite and was a bit too dry for me, but my husband seemed to enjoy it. It was served with kimchi and naan, which was a definite plus.

Overall, all of their dishes are very unique and tasty. If you're feeling especially exotic, I'd try the pig face (seems to be the most popular item on their menu), beef tongue, or any of the goat dishes - they all sounded very interesting!

pics.caption: pork shank - buttermilk dressing, grilled spring onion and radish kimchi, naan

review.des:
Fun and tasty food at an affordable price. We really loved Calamari bruschetta. The grilled calamari was served on top of bruschetta and ricotta cheese, and the fresh green apple slices add an amazing layer of flavor. The beef tongue and goat dumplings were decent as well.

Besides, the interior design of the restaurant is antique. The atmosphere is romantic. The only drawback I can think of is that the restaurant is a little loud.

Such a variety of small plates, it's amazing! The menu changes often but the pork shoulder is AMAZING! The corn appetizer is soooo good!

I went twice. The first time was with three others and we shared 7 plates between us ... it was PLENTY! The second time I went with my big brother and we shared 4 between the both of us and we were STUFFED.

Great food and service, when they missed a wine order, they comped 2 Veggie items. Note to couples.... tables for 2 are very close, which make the experience loud or can lead to nice conversations with neighbors.

We went as a large party so maybe my experience won't be the most relevant to everyone. But it was amazing. They have a room in the back, away from the noise and business of the main dining hall for larger parties and it was great to have our own space. The atmosphere was intimate and we could hear everyone across the one large table of 20.

The food was spectacular! From the breads to the empinadas to the vegetables and fish that I had were among the best dishes I've tried.

Don't leave without getting the pig face & bucatini! And we should have ordered 2 lamb ribs lol. They fell off the bone...so yummy!
Stephanie - we loved your place!!! Top Chef ladies don't disappoint!!!! Awesome meal
Amazing food, great service, and an awesome atmosphere!!  The menu seems a little scary at first, but all 13 dishes we tried were phenomenal!!

We came into town from Denver and were disappointed because we didnt think we would be able to get a reservation. Magically, something opened up for us during our stay. We were so incredibly lucky to get a seat for two overlooking the kitchen. The kitchen staff was amazing! Friendly and answered all of our questions.

The food was to die for. We had the pig face, broccoli, pork shank, peppers and the whole fish. Everything was delicious but the pork shank was the highlight. It falls off the bone and has a perfect moist inside amd crunch outside. They also provided us with complimentary dessert and a side of cauliflower which made us feel so special and welcome.

Chicago is so fortunate to have this amazing non pretentious restaurant that just focuses on the food and making sure everyone is having a good time. The highlight of our Chicago trip!

Lots of hype about this place. Getting a reservation is difficult.
The food is unique no doubt about that but the portions are too small and totally not worth the price. The dishes half the price would still make the place expensive.
The service was not as expected. Main course was served before the starters.
Tried the goat empanadas and crab rangoons for starters. Empanadas were okay. The sauces were good. Rangoons are ok too, I've had better ones at less than half the price.
We ordered grilled chicken and pork shank for main course. The grilled chicken had coconut but the details did not mention it. It was also uncooked at a few portions inside.
The pork shank was good but I wish the sauces were better.
Overall one time go due to the hype, you will get better food at a much cheaper price elsewhere.

I'll add my review to sing the praises here. Dang - knocked it out of the park!! We tried so many things and each one was delicious - some were so much so that we were definitely tempted to lick plates...
Started with the kohlrabi salad - which was good but not breathtaking. But then we moved on to the grilled cuttlefish which was mind blowing. The hamachi crudo was tasty tasty but over way too quickly - only a couple bites... We loved the empanadas - such a crazy combo of almost sour and savory. The short ribs were cooked perfectly but you might find those elsewhere - the same cannot be said for the goat belly with sweet butter fennel and lobster - omg.
Finished it all off with the chocolate cake which was not typical at all - almost savory and sweet at the same time.
This place is so so so good.

pics.caption: Those chunks of lobster are swimming in butter and nestled up next to some goat belly. For real.
Short ribs with sublime avocado and sour relish

review.des: Do not leave Chicago without not having the goat empanadas and the Pork Shank! Great food AND service!!!

Wow. Where to even start? This place is phenomenal and TOTALLY lives up to the hype. We arrived around 8 for a reservation for 8:15, it took us over a half hour to get seated because of the table we were supposed to be seated at was taking their sweet time to leave! So we grabbed a drink at the bar and the hostess came by and explained the menu so we could order once we were seated. Our waiter and host were both very helpful and were trying their best to get the other party moving. Since all items on the menu are shareable items, our host recommended about 5-7 dishes for our party of 4. The menu is divided by Veggies, Fish and Meat entrees which is helpful in ensuring you're able to experience a variety of dishes. Our party of 4 tried 4 entrees (we ordered 2 of the same dishes for a total of 5 entrees).  

We started with the Goat Empanadas, which were AMAZING. The goat is flavorful and the empanada is just the perfectly crispy, it will literally melt in your mouth. The sea bass was brought out next, it was flaky and flavorful but the aftertaste was a bit off, so out of the 4 dishes, I would say it was my least favorite. Lastly, the calamari bruschetta and the crisp braised pork shank came out together. Both of these were PHENOMENAL. The braised pork shank is cooked to perfection. The pork literally falls off the bone and its paired perfectly with the crispy naan and buttermilk ranch. We ordered two thinking since the dishes are on the smaller side we would need the extra order but boy were we wrong, this has to be one of the largest dishes on the menu and it's easily shareable by a large party (just order extra naan). The calamari bruschetta is also another must try. The calamari is grilled and not fried which is a plus and it is paired with apple, ricotta cheese and goat bacon on top of perfectly toasted bread. It's an amazing combination of flavors and totally unexpected.

Overall, I would say the food, service and ambience are all a 5/5. Easily one of the must try restaurants in Chicago.

Now we know why it's hard to get a table there. Nobody picks up the phone ever!
We made a reservation a month ago for this Sunday but I forgot the time so I called nobody picks up. I left a message. Called again, left a message. Next day they calling me to help me further with my request. I told them this was for yesterday !!! Very unprofessional.

By some miracle, I was able to get a reservation for 7 about a week before I visited. Don't be stupid like me. Reserve early plz.
Arguably the 2nd hottest restaurant in Chicago (after Alinea of course), Girl and the Goat is unique in many elements. The food here is creative, the ordering system is tapas-esque, and service rivals that of a high Michelin-starred establishment.

Our table of 7 broke up into groups of 4 and 3. The ordering system threw our groups into disarray, as we weren't sure how much food we would have to order to leave full. However, our waiter was extremely helpful and friendly with us, recommending the popular dishes and greatly calming the chaos. The service stayed consistently excellent throughout our meal.

My group of 3 ordered the Pan Fried Shishito peppers, Calamari Bruschetta, Escargot Ravioli, Pig Face, Goat Belly, and some Citrus Brioche for some extra carbs.

Our dishes came out one by one, so we were able to sample everything by itself before polluting our tongues with another flavor. Our favorites were the Pig Face, Calamari Bruschetta, and the Goat Belly. The pan fried peppers had a nice char, roasted flavor to them, and they worked well as a vegetable counterpart to all the meat we ordered. The Escargot Ravioli was disappointing, both in terms of size and flavor. The ravioli were extremely small, and because of this, the escargot wasn't very noticeable. With escargot being such a niche and interesting ingredient, I felt like it could have been highlighted better. The broth that came with the ravioli was arguably the best part of the dish.

The Pig Face was special. The wonderful egg, the crispy potato, and the pig itself were all extremely memorable. It was our unanimous favorite. The presentation is also stunning in its own right.

The group of 4 ordered similar dishes, with the addition of the Green Beans and Pork Shank. Both these dishes were delicious as well, and I felt like they were great representations of the quality of Girl and the Goat.

Is the food pretentious? I suppose it can be to some eyes. The fine line between creativity and pretentiousness is something that Chef Izard handles gracefully, as the food pushes boundaries without seemingly destroying them.

Our meal wasn't cheap. The per person breakdown was over $30, but I left satisfied knowing I had sampled the amazing variety that Girl and the Goat had to offer.

In the days afterward, my friend wouldn't stop shouting out "Pig Face" whenever I asked him what he wanted to eat. Seems like I wasn't the only one who was impressed.

The caption for five stars pretty much sums it up, "As Good as it gets." In town on business and was able to walk over and get a single seat at the bar with no wait. The staff was attentive and helpful, and all of the food amazing. The combination of flavors - none of which overpowered any other - and textures is simply superb. Starting with the shishito peppers, they were perfectly roasted and topped with fresh parmesan, the level of heat was absolutely perfect and a great pairing with the bartender recommended beer. Next came the calamari bruschetta which was so visually appealing, no less than three people asked what it was. The calamari was some of the freshest I've ever had and paired perfectly with the lightly toasted bread and other toppings. Finally the signature pig's face - not to worry hear, no actual resemblance to the face of a pig - simply some of the best pork anything I have ever had. Topped with a lightly fried egg and resting on a bed of crunchy frittes, the dish ties together in such a way it seems to improve with each bite.

I can't recommend highly enough. No trip to Chicago should be considered complete without a visit!

Gave this place a shot twice and was not impressed both times! Girl & the Goat always comes up on vegetarian places to try in Chicago and so many people rave about it (thus the second chance) but both times the food was just okay and IMO not worth the price. The second time I went with friends who ate meat and they thought the vegetarian dishes tasted better but overall not impressed either. I'd skip this spot if you are in town for a short period of time!

Heard amazing things about this place and was super excited to try it when I came to Chicago. We arrived for our 945 reservation but still had to wait about 15 minutes till we were seated. The restaurant is loud and somewhat cramped ( you might be very close to the couple/group next to you).

Our waiter was great and attentive, explained all the specials and made recommendations for our party. We got a bunch of plates to share, mix of seafood and meat options. The focaccia side with their spicy butter is amazing. Dessert was great as well.

I would definitely come back here.

Hands down our best dining experience in Chicago!!!      6/25/18

This place has really transformed our dining experiences, my girlfriend and I fell in love with this place.  A few friends of mine in the restaurant industry highly recommended this place to us, as did all the online hype regarding this establishment.  Girl & the Goat lived up to the recommendations and surpassed them by a lot!!!!

I called and tried to make a reservation a few days prior to coming into Chicago from San Diego, we weren't sure on our schedule and how we could make this dining experience work.  Once I called, the prime time dinner hours were booked on the day we wanted, I'm not surprised at all after our dining experience.  So, we just chose to show up right when they open at 4:30pm.  We were seated almost immediately and the hostess and manager were extremely kind and very welcoming upon our entry.

Once we were seated, almost immediately a busser came by with water for us, like ninja quick.  Extremely attentive young man, he was hustlin' and bustlin' around the restaurant, kudos to him, very hard efficient worker.  Our server, Trevor, greeted us in a very welcoming manner and really took us along for the ride with our dining experience.  

I ordered a glass of Roccascossa red wine, it was very delightful and the staff favorite.  I had a martini at another bar right before, while we were waiting for this place to open, so I was trying to behave myself because I was on a date with my lady. I really wanted to try a few other cocktails but we had things to do after our meal.

Trevor took us through the menu and gave us recommendations and assisted in suggestions and possibilities for my girlfriend's dairy allergy.  He was extremely helpful. This place has small plates that are meant to share with one another, such an awesome concept.  

We started with the Sourdough Blueberry bread with a homemade Berry lamb jam and Spring onion cream cheese.  She loves bread and we loved this bread, in fact she's going to try and make it at home, good luck babe.  The berry lamb jam was like nothing I've ever had before, I wish they sold jars of it. I'd wash my face with this stuff in the morning, lol.

Hamachi crudo, Chili-soy vinaigrette, Finger hots, Pickled kumquats and Puffed black rice; Melted in your mouth like butter, so damn good!!

Next, we ordered the Green Beans cooked in a Fish sauce vinaigrette with Cashews.  Oh my goodness these were AAAaaAAmmazing!!  Cooked to perfection and tasted like no other green beans I've had before.  Best part is, I got to eat most of these because she's not the biggest fan of green beans, thanks honey!  

Pan Roasted Halibut with Marcona almond butter, White asparagus, Blueberry nuoc cham and Beech mushroom. My mouth is literally still watering from this dish two weeks later, I was so happy I ordered this.  It was on my radar before arriving to the restaurant after looking at the menu online. I want another one!!  
Because this dish was made with butter and my girlfriend couldn't share, our server Trevor dropped off a small portion of the Kohlrabi Salad for her to enjoy.  It was made with Fennel, Evalon, Toasted almonds, Roasted shiitake and Blueberries.  It was such a nice gesture and she really loved the salad while I indulged on my Halibut. She let me try her salad, it was very very good.

Finally, we ordered the Crisp Braised Pork Shank, with Buttermilk dressing, Grilled spring onion & radish kimchi with Naan.  This was so damn good because of the crispiness on the outside was perfection, very very impressed.  The Naan bread was so fluffy and delicious we almost ordered another piece.  Best Naan we've ever ate, hands down!

As we were approaching the possibility of dessert, we realized we had to get going to get on our Architectural Boat Tour of the city that was boarding in 20 minutes.  We asked for the check because we didn't have much time, and right before the check arrived, Trevor came by to drop off a side of the blackberry sorbet (I think) because my girlfriend was intrigued by this item.  He really made our dining experience extremely memorable and created this amazing experience for the two of us.  I've been in the industry since 1995 and it's really hard to find great people like him, thank you very much sir we greatly appreciate your whole-hearted customer service!

Overall:
An absolute must try if you're in the city of Chicago!!!  The food was absolutely delicious, flavorful and creative.  Everything was cooked to perfection, the ambiance was very warming and soothing.  The staff was incredible, you can tell how well the staff works together and it really sets the tone for the restaurant.  Kudos to the owner and management for this well oiled machine, you guys are a blessing to society. Once again, thank you Trevor for one of our best dining experiences this year, you're a rock star dude.  If you ever come to San Diego, let me know I'll take care of you and return the favor.  Cheers!!

With so many amazing reviews, I tried booking this place a month in advance and still had to settle for a 10:15pm reservation.  I had high hopes for this place because of all the hype!  The restaurant was laid out and decorated nicely - it was loud and lively but surprisingly not so much that you have to yell at the person across from you to hold conversation.  I loved the ambiance, the vibe, the decor and the open kitchen.  The seats were a bit off, especially for the bf cause the table and chair height seemed off and a little too short for his frame to be comfortable.  We weren't super hungry because we had a snack around 7pm to hold us over before our super late reservation.  

We ordered the:
* Puttin on a Spritz Cocktail - Chicago Distilling Ceres Vodka . Aperol . Pamplemousse Rose . Lemon . Grapefruit Tonic . Sparkling Wine - this drink was so amazingly delicious.  One of the best cocktails I've had, though I didn't taste the alcohol and it tasted like juice.  Could be dangerous but I'm not sure it had very much alcohol in it cause it was so deceiving.
* Sauteed Green Beans - Fish sauce vinaigrette. Cashews - The server told us this was the only dish on their menu that has been on there since the restaurant opened years ago, so we definitely had to try it especially cause I love green beans and string beans (if you can't tell from all my posts).  The green beans were cooked perfectly.  The fish sauce vinaigrette was so unique as were the addition of cashews.  It wasn't a flavor I've ever tasted before and we loved it.
* Escargot Ravioli - Bacon tamarind sauce. Escarole and celery. Crispy onions - I love love love escargots so when I saw this on the menu, I wanted to have it.  I was slightly disappointed cause the bacon tamarind sauce was a bit too salty and you can't taste the escargot (or the typical garlic butter escargots you learn to expect).  I didn't love this dish and the filling was too small for the pasta size.  
* Crisp Braised Pork Shank - Buttermilk dressing. Grilled spring onion and radish kimchi. Naan - I love the their take on this.  The pork was crispy on the outside, as if you were eating chicharron.  You can tell it was brasied and then deep fried cause of the perfect soft fall off the bone meat and the crispiness of the skin.  You wrap the meat in naan, though it was more like a pita than a naan, and then you add the radish kimchi sauce, grilled spring onion and you have sorta a "bao".  This dished reminded me of the white bao and peking duck AND it tasted like it too.  I liked it.  It was different and a unique combination but the flavors were not anything I haven't experienced before combined.

I do like the place and the food was good, some dishes better than others.  I would love to come back here and try other dishes they have to offer cause there was so much more to choose from!  The waitress was also tentative, but not overly so, and very friendly.  She didn't force you to order more and was perfectly helpful and courteous.
Overstated, overly salted food but always delicious and satisfying.  Great service and good atmosphere!  Great desserts too!

We are about half way through the year and this had to easily be the best meal I've had in 2018. Everything was delicious, thoughtful, and unique. This was our last night in Chicago and I was lucky enough to score a last minute table for 10pm. We enjoyed 5 dishes +oysters +dessert for two very hungry people. let me tell you.... every piece/sauce/ garnish was devoured.

We enjoyed:
-duck tongues 10/10
-roasted beet salad 8/10
-oven roasted pig face 9/10
-rock shrimp 9/10
-confit goat belly 10/10
-wood fire oysters 10/10
-chocolate pavlova 8/10

I can't wait to come back and try the rest of the menu during another visit to Chicago.

Cheers to the chefs, waiters, and all at the Girl & The Goat! Thank you for the truly wonderful experience.

Have been wanting to try this restaurant for some time, and finally made it with 2 friends for dinner. Drinks were a bit strong and the dolce vita is def heavy on the fernet (not for people who don't like cocktails that taste like grass). Food was delicious, rich and flavorful. Ordered the raw oysters, pork shank, grilled octopus, lamb empanadas, shishito peppers, wood fires skirt steak, and the malt ball ice cream.

Skirt steak was my favorite. Although odd, the salted caramel flavoring worked well and wasn't overpowering. Steak was tender and flavorful. Shishito peppers were also unique in that there is a cheesy crunchy topping crust on the perfectly grill charred peppers. Dessert was surprisingly good- ice cream had an addictive flavor.

Glad we finally got to try this highly raved about restaurant.

This food is so full of flavor even the dishes I don't normally think I would like I LOVED. My mom and I licked the plates clean literally it was a sight to see. we didn't have a resi but got seated outside by heater right away. And every time we have been we have gotten a dish on the house of their choosing. Thanks G AND G! YOU ROCK AND WE WILL BRB

So glad I came here while in Chicago.
The ambiance, drinks, food, and service was all exceptional!!!
The food is all tapas style so we ordered four things between two people.
Chickpea Fritters: delicious!!! Would definitely recommend- cooked to perfection.
Halibut: My personal favorite! This dish was perfect in every way...
Cauliflower: Yum!!! Crisp and delicious...
Empanadas: unfortunately, i was super excited about this dish but by the time it came to us, it was kind of cold so i didn't enjoy it as much as i would have liked.

i recommend stopping by as the lounge area is pretty accessible and spacious... so if you are willing to wait a bit, I am sure you would get a spot.

Lived up to all expectations! Make reservations and order and split as many plates as you can.. I don't think any of them could be a let down. We got the pig face, goat belly, & scallops and each dish was unique and delicious. The atmosphere was great.. not too loud & cozy.

I went here for my birthday and was not disappointed.  Solid 4.5 stars.

Service : 5/5
Atmosphere : 5/5
Food :

Oysters to start : 3.5 - Smaller than I'm used too, would like it if the spice is already applied to have some variety.  Still very good though.

Goat empanadas : 5/5 -  Delicious, loved the spice and garnish

Sauteed Green Beans (complimentary!) : 5/5 - A very nice surprise!  I wish I could've actually finished them.

Chorizo Flatbread : Not a flavor profile that I really liked at all.  Nothing wrong with it, but I just kind of ate half of it because I ordered it and for no other reason.

Scallops 5/5 : Strong contender for best thing I ordered of the night.  

Tiramisu 6/5 - What can I say?  I love a giant portion of tiramisu....  This was especially well made.

Drinks were tasty as well, Taylor Fladgate with something chocolaty is always great.

I go into this review with a heavy heart. A heart that yearns for more Goat Empanadas, more Pig Face, more Whipped Fetta.

First, make a reservation way in advance, then prepare to wait past that reservation time. It will be more than worth it. When you sit down, order some drinks and get the Sourdough bread, Goat Empanadas, and Pig Face (if you are me, you can also order the Calamari Bruchesta. Your girl loves it, it's just okay to you.)

The bread comes to the table. Sourdough, Whipped Feta, and Red Onion Mostarda. You spread some feta on the bread and your eyes open wide. What is it about this magical spread? Why did you even doubt the bread in the first place? "Try some of this onion," she says. When it hits your taste buds the fireworks have intensified. How can this flavor exist in cold onions? What kind of black magic is this?

The Goat Empanadas come out. Dressed with tiny mushrooms. Oh, how you have been waiting for this. You cut out a bite, making sure every bit of flavor is on the fork. Crunchy, then....woah. The only word that comes out of your mouth is "Woah", like you transformed in that holy moment from a man enjoying an amazing dining experience to a teenage mutant ninja turtle. You want more and less at the same time, knowing the more you eat the less there will be. You contemplate ordering a second plate already knowing this bill will be north of $150.

Then....then it happens. Pig Face. Have you ever ate something that changed your world views? That made you question your existence? It happens rarely, but when it does you fight back tears and get lost in a wave of ecstasy that extends from plate to fork to mouth. Bites of egg and potato stick adorned this crown jewel with the respect it deserved. A compliment that made way for the king.

Crunchy, then butter. Nothing but the beautiful fat that sits on the tongue and takes you on a roller coaster ride to Nirvana. Babies are born, young lovers married, and world peace is cried from the mountaintops. You are home.

Stop waiting, stop looking over reviews that tell you it's overhyped. Come join me in a place that few mortals will ever go. Come celebrate with me in Valhalla. Go to Girl and the Goat. Then go back as many times as you can. I know I will.

The 6 of us ordered many items from this restaurant and shared everything. My faves were the crisp braised pork shank (ample portion), wood fired lamb ribs, shuna bay salmon (salmon salad w/ strawberries), pan fried shishito peppers, roasted beets (beet salad), and the raw oysters. These we all so delicious. You should try this restaurant, you'll be pleasantly surprised how good it is. Rick D, San Diego, CA.

Honestly, I have never written a review for any restaurant before but I felt the need for this one.

This place is way overpriced for their portion sizes. They stress that it's family style dining but you'd have to order at least 6 menu items for an average four person family to be full. Most things on the menu appear to be for one person or at most, two thinner individuals. Overall, I wouldn't recommend this restaurant to families unless you're willing to drop at least $70 on a not so satisfying dinner.

This restaurant never disappoints! I have gone with my boyfriend about 4 times now and each time we've had an extraordinary experience! This time, the menu changed quite a bit so pretty much everything we ordered was a new dish. And just like all the other times, every single dish was so delicious and flavorful! Can't wait for our next visit!

pics.caption: Goat Wood Oven Roasted Pig Face

review.des:
Having now gone to all of Stephanie Izard's babies here in Chicago, I can officially dub her as...well...the G.O.A.T!

After months (literally) of waiting for a table that fit my schedule, I finally got into G&TG. Id stalked the menu for weeks leading up to my dinner and was so ready to experience the culinary originality of Her Majesty Izard!

Location: We all know that Miss Izard is the Empress of Fulton Market. Literally. If you say "Fulton Market" in conversation, I guarantee you either the words "duck" "Izard" or "goat" will soon follow. She has certainly left her stamp on this area of Chicago.

Decor: Dark. Intimate. Edgy. Nothing else really to describe the design aesthetic here.

Service: Like DDG, There was a lot happening here in terms of service. I dont think we really had one designated waiter. Our waters were refilled by like five different wait staff, different food items were delivered by two or three different staff members. I appreciated their dedication to being prompt, but that connection with our own personal waitress was missing. I look for that when I go to restaurants. One thing I can say that annoyed me is that they bought spoons and big plates out with every little dish. It wasn't really necessary and because we were already sandwiched between to other couples with little room, our small table got cluttered quickly.

Food: The food here is A+MAZING! Some of these inventions Miss Izard created were so incredibly original. I only had one miss, but we will get ti that.

Sweet Potato Bleu Cheese Pierogies: ORGASMIC! The sweet sweet potatoes mixed with the bitter tangyness of the bleu cheese sauce wed perfectly.

Broccoli: Rice krispies and broccoli would sound gross to me 5 years ago, but leave it to Queen Izard to pull this off. One thing that I can say is her vegetables are ALWAYS just as delicious as the main courses. A massive portion size also. The sauce with this was incredibly tasty. And the rice krispies gave the dish a much needed crunchy aspect.

Brioche: okay. Nothing spectacular. Was expecting better.

Goat Empanadas: probably my favorite dish of the night. I'd never had goat, but I am a big fan now. Because of this dish. Everything just mixed perfectly.

Catfish: like the brioche, I thought it was just okay. The fish itself was pretty good, but the rest of the dish didn't really compliment it.

4 stars for great food!

We are in Chicago visiting family, and my brother in law and his fiancé love this place! We had dinner here last night and it was THE BEST meal I have had in a long time. The service was excellent and very attentive. They were constantly refilling water, giving us clean plates, etc. The pacing of the meal was perfect.

We ordered:

Sourdough Bread with whipped feta and red onion mustarda - AMAZING. Both the feta spread and red onions together almost reminded us of a bagel..it was delicious.

Goat Empanadas

Bucatini with braised pork shoulder

Crispy Beef Shortribs - seriously one of my favorite items of the entire meal. The meat was so flavorful and perfectly seasoned. I wanted MORE!

Goat Sausage Flatbread

Wood Oven Roasted Pig Face - one of my brother-in-law's faves, but not my top choice of the meal. Still good!

Sauteed Green Beans- tied with the short ribs for my favorite of the night. These are ADDICTIVE. My brother-in-law said he doesn't even like green beans, but he enjoys these. AMAZING.

I also had the Bananas in Cabanas cocktail and loved it! Absolutely delicious. I would absolutely come back here again. Make sure you make a reservation well in advance!

we have been at this restaurant 3x already and it was all during our wedding anniversary. this is a very popular restaurant and if i want to have that special dinner on our anniversary I have to make a mental note and remind myself that I need to place that reservation 2 to 3 mos ahead of time.

We have never been disappointed with this restaurant, always full and vibrant atmosphere.

Our favorites and highly recommended wood oven roasted pig face, escargot ravioli and crispy beef short ribs. we will be back this year again for our anniversary and we'll be ordering our favorites plus probably try a new one.

Chef Izard has 2 other restaurants and we've tried the little goat diner, next in the list is the duck duck goat.

GnG

While this restaurant still impresses with food almost a decade since its opening, it has lost the passion, charm, service, and appeal of when it first opened. The food is no longer flawless and the service was discourteous and below average.

My most recent (3rd) trip to girl and goat left a lot to be desired. Our server was just cold, didn't crack a smile the whole evening despite multiple interactions, and it was clear that she just didn't plain want to be there serving patrons. Most of the 12 things we ordered were spot on and delicious. However. We had to send back the octopus that was overcooked and rubbery. We also sent back the awful and inedible tiramisu (I can't believe that GnG would serve that nonsense). The 2 veg dishes (cauliflower and shishito peppers) were terrific . Other than the octopus, the hibachi was great but was a tiny and ungenerous portion for the price. The 6 meats were really good - The best being the tartar. The lamb shank was unfortunately mediocre and not of flavor of quality validating a small tapas portion for $30.

The goat liver pate - while beautifully served - was too waxy and lacked the balance or intensity to make for a memorable dish.

The cocktail I enjoyed the most were the Highgarden (nod to Game or Thrones). The other three I didn't find good enough to remember.

Overall, I will pass on GnG in the future. Can it serve up a good meal? Sure. But is it at the same level as it used to be - not even close. Pity - this was my favorite restaurant in Chicago alongside Grace and Alinea.

PS: the manager Einstein is actually very pleasant and did stop by our table to greet us warmly. Sharp contrast to our server.

I've always been a huge Top Chef fan, so when I had the opportunity to come to Chicago, I knew I had to give this restaurant a try.  The place was packed, it was a smaller space than I thought it would be.  We ordered 4 dishes and shared all of them.  The soft shell crab was tasty.  The pig face dish was superb, and the goat confit was good, but tasted like beef.  I couldn't tell it was goat.  While all the above dishes were excellent, my favorite was the green beans.  They were perfectly cooked; crunchy, supple and seasoned well.  The only disappointment was the dessert - the pavlova was odd, and the sesame ice cream was not good - it had an oily off putting flavor that just didn't work for me.  When the server asked my opinion of the dessert, she admitted that it wasn't her favorite either.
The service was excellent.  Not only was she attentive and friendly, but she removed the dessert from the bill without me asking or even informing me she was going to.  It's an outstanding restaurant, I'll definitely go back whenever I return to Chicago.

All I can say is that there's a lot going on in every dish that came out. In all of the dishes we ordered, each bite had a lot of flavors happening all at once. It was a bit overwhelming towards the end.

First order was the Kohlrabi salad. This was my favorite dish of the evening. It was a salad of, well, I guess kohlrabi with some toasted almonds and currants, I think. Very good.

Octopus - This was more of a roasted octopus salad with more of the fixings rather than octopus. A little disappointing. Lots of different flavors. I was hoping for something like a greek style roasted octopus.

Skirt steak - A few slivers of steak. While good, I was expecting something a little more.

Goat loin - slightly gamey, like the taste of lamb, but not overpowering.

Pig Face - Looked like head cheese topped with an egg. Good, but again, a lot going on as far as taste.

For me, less is more sometimes. While I appreciate the complexity of the dishes, I think I needed a break on some of them and needed a dish which had simple flavors instead of dish after dish of a variety of flavors hitting your mouth all at once.

Worth the wait. We didn't have a reservation so we hung out at Soho House and walked in at 11. Got the pierogis, calamari bruschetta, lamb ribs, sweet brioche, and the goat belly for the table. Goat belly is a small portion, but one of the best (so get your own and don't let anyone else have any). The lamb ribs fell off the bone and the apps were timed perfectly one after the other. No complaints at all and definitely coming back to try everything else on the menu.
Love the food here! The pork shank is so well cooked and the meat came off very easily.

pics.caption: The dessert is so amazing. All the flavor is perfectly balanced.
The pork shank is so nicely cooked. The meat came off very easily.

review.des: My co worker recommended this place and I'm glad she did! The dishes were all very unique but simple and had so many flavors . You can tell that the chefs take the time and serves each dish with perfection. I enjoyed all 5 dishes. The portions are more like tapas portion so order a couple and share with your loved ones!

I had numerous friends and family recommend me to this restaurant and was really hyped up. Glad to say I wasn't disappointed at all! It was by far my favorite meal while visiting Chicago. We were worried about getting a table because we did not have a reservation. Because of this, we went right whenever they opened and was seated right away.

The interior- beautifully decorated with their cute logo of a goat on many items including their menu and napkins.

Cocktails- my table ordered an old fashion and another cocktail. Both tasted decent was great to slip on while we ate.

Food- we ordered 7 plates for a party of 3. By the end of the meal, all 3 of us were very full. My favorites include the roasted cauliflower and pig face. The cauliflower was so simple, but taste delicious. The pickled peppers added a nice kick to it. As for the pig face, it's one of those dishes you have to mix up. The pig was very tender. The potato stix's gave the the dish the needed crunch. A must get!

If you're ever visiting Chicago, check out this place.

There are a few times in my life where I sat down for a meal at a restaurant where it was an unforgettable experience and during my short birthday trip to Chicago I had that. Girl & the Goat gave me that experience. I now understand the long lines and the reviews.

Meh. Bland and unchallenging. We ordered french toast with chicken; eggs and sausage special; okonomiyaki; bloodies. Hostesses screen for white couples in the dining room, send others to the bar. Food could have been a lot better.

Believe the hype! The best meal you will ever eat! You must make a trip here.

My rank over two visits (Jan and June 2018):
-pig face (must get for meat eaters)
-confit goat belly
-sockeye salmon
-green beans
-crisp braised pork shank
-kohlrabi salad
-goat empanadas (good but not memorable)

This is the kind of place where no matter what you order, it'll be delicious! Make your reservation and head on over! You will be glad you did.

I'm pretty sure Girl & the Goat doesn't need any more reviews but I'm going to write one anyway. SO THERE! A friend from out-of-town asked me for a dinner suggestion at 4:30pm on a Monday. I only thought of Girl & the Goat because it was snowing and I figured we might get in as it would be less busy.

What I learned: I should have been coming here for years! If you go early enough you can sit down for the full menu at the bar and also the lounge area. Now I wouldn't want to eat at the lounge, but the bar is perfect for 1-2 people, maybe 4 if you can squeeze in.

The beef short rib was amazing, I could eat two orders of this no problem and go home happy. In addition to this we had the oven fired shrimp (alright), the goat empanadas (also alright) and the pork shank (meh, the dressings overpowered the pork - probably not what they had in mind, the naan was a cute touch but really Naan, kimchi sauce, buttermilk sauce and a squash salad? Too many flavors trying to make a pork shank exciting??? Making a little naan pork taco really muddled all the flavors -- I ended up just eating the pork on its own in order to get a real taste for it). Next time I go back I'll be trying some more of the adventurous cuts. Really, the big standout was the beef short ribs, order it and you will thank me!

Service was great, the food was good and we didn't need a reservation! +100 points!

pics.caption: Pork shank is doing the most!

review.des:
4.5/5- Rounding up because the dishes I was not as big a fan of, weren't my dishes.
I just went through a beer tour + a food fair right before my 9pm meal here and despite my dying stomach I was still impressed by the food here.
