Both great but liked the yuzu butter the best. Our first round we ordered the goat empanadas, the duck tongue, and the dear drives scallopsWe all agreed that the best was the goat empanadas. The goat was very tender and had so much flavor. The duck tongue was a close second. It definitely was different than I expected, but the flavors were still delicious. Our second round we got the sautéed green beans, the calamari, and the steamed mussels. The green beans were delicious with the fish sauce that they included. We went for two different desserts, the caramel corn and malt balls and the toffee cake with gooseberries. Everyone talks about the malt ball dessert but my table was a fan of the toffee cake. The contrasting flavors made your mouth tingle and the gooseberries were such a mystery.

Overall if I had to recommend some must have dishes, I would say go for the empanadas, the green beans, the duck tongue and the toffee cake dessert.

You know those meals where you get shit like duck tongue and goat stomach and broccoli marinated in like the sweat of pigeon and it comes out looking all decked out and you eat it and you're like fuck??? That's exactly what this is. You know what you're getting into, and I would be shocked if you went here and weren't thoroughly entertained by the array of options and the way it all comes together. The vibe is super duper good too.
Space was adorable. Simple. And the food and people were great! I'll definitely  return when I'm in Chicago again.

Another Top Chef restaurant checked off my list!

Yes. It's good. I had the opportunity to go to the sister joint- Little Goat Diner across the street and was left lukewarm, so I wasn't sure what I was getting myself into. This was definitely a step up.

We made reservations about a month or two ahead of time, knowing it gets packed. The restaurant is dark and has a nice rustic handmade feel to it. The atmosphere is very casual, not stuff at all. Staff is friendly and our waitress was over the top stellar. I don't remember her name, but she went above and beyond the call of duty to make our experience exceptional.

We had a large group and some had food allergies- she went out of her way to understand the allergies then markup the menus to show which ones had what ingredients. In addition to that, she went back to the kitchen to figure out if there were alternatives. When the food came out, if the dishes were in their original form, the serving staff was on point and made sure the allergic folks knew what to eat vs what not to eat. They were pretty dead set on not having an epi-pen incident.

All the dishes were amazing. I honestly didn't eat a dish and go "meh", they were all really good. The pacing was well done, we never felt rushed and there was always food on the table. Unfortunately the visit was a couple of weeks ago and I can't recall any of the dishes we shared, but they were all fresh and full of flavor, top notch. The cocktails were also well made. We hobbled out of there very full.

Overall, the food was fantastic and the wonderful service was icing on the cake. I plan on going back the next time I'm in Chicago.

It seems this place had connoisseurs in mind in its conception. As you walk in, you'll be greeted with well-trained host who promptly seat you despite their usually heavy traffic. The servers know how to add a lot of color to their description of food and passionately express that to their guests. Even the ambiance seems like it aims to put you in the center of a bustling industry-- one that they are successful at. You can see the line comprised of young and energetic chefs who's creativity bleeds into the menu. I distinctly remember their presentation of crabcakes, while not at all traditional, was extremely innovative and delicious. It making me think "should I stand up and clap now?".
Girl & the Goat lives up to all the praise it receives! My boyfriend and I got to sit at a bar in front of the kitchen, which was really cool. This is a very vegetarian friendly spot.

Once you taste this food it, you'll understand the line out the door. Absolutely amazing place in every way possible - great staff, lovely decor, and tremendous menu!

It's a shared plate place, so be ready for that, but also be sure to come hungry and want to move in.

I had the scallops, sea bass, goat belly, and pig face and it ALL was great.

I went to be a bit adventurous and I was blown away. Make a reservation, be prepared to wait in line for your table, and enjoy.

You can not go wrong at Girl at the Goat. Outside of the service being incredible (from drink and food recommendations to friendliness), the food is fantastic. We ordered 3 dishes from the meat, fish, and veggies sections. We loved the scallops and the short ribs, as well as the shishito peppers! The "least" disappointing dish were the green beans. We had a late 9pm Thursday night reservation and the atmosphere was fantastic at that hour!

I'd heard fantastic things about this restaurant, and I'd also dined at the little goat diner and duck duck goat, which were great, so I was excited to try Girl and the Goat. We ordered 8 items off the menu to get a wide variety. The entrees, some were quite good (halibut), some I thought were quite bland (salad), and every plate was tiny. Every plate was definitely overpriced, even compared to many other phenomenal 5 star restaurants I've enjoyed.

Oh sweet Lord in heaven and above... This is good eating! Do not I repeat do not eat the day you are eating here. You won't regret the restraint-you need the space. If you even sort of like fish, get the salmon it's raw and sooooooo good. Fresh, tender with a complimentary sauce that doesn't overpower-it will be in your top 3 for sure. Pig face, pig face, pig face-say it 3 times in a dark bathroom, then stop being a weirdo and order it here. The best breakfast scramble you'll have for dinner. Sorry southern relatives-this is the way to do green beans. Enough said. Dessert-BABA-just do it.

Honestly it is my favorite restaurant in Chicago.  I always come solo and have never not been able grab a seat at the bar.

Pig face- super good. Loved the egg on top.
Pork shank- comes with a tortilla. Super crispy and good.
Green beans- maybe the best green beans I've ever eaten.
Beat salad- just ok. The only thing I've gotten here that I didn't love.
Goat empanadas- loved them. Super big.

Bartenders are friendly and there are a bunch of good wine by the glass.   Can't wait for my next chicago trip!

The food here is amazing!! The waitress was super helpful and knew what we wanted. We got 5 dishes between two people, but we really should've only gotten 4. Even though they are small plates they are super filling and delicious! Would highly suggest the fried oysters and lamb shank.

We had reservations for Girl and a Goat and I wasn't sure what to expect since I'm on a plant based diet and my husband... well, he eats everything. Let me start with the fact that they have a Vegan Menue! I'v tried shishito peppers, bucatini with mango and maytaki mushrooms and their sourdough bread. It was sooo good! I with they had something for vegans with their smoked beets! I snagged one from my husband just to taste and it blew my mind!
My husband had scallops, pork cheek and a hoat empanada. He LOVED everything he had!
As of my meal, it was delicious but bucatini flavors didn't work for me at all.
Service was flawless!
Selection of wine and beer is outstanding!

This was my 3rd attempt. This time I was able to sit, eat & drink. I got duck cheek, not something I would get again. It was a humid day so the fried cheek felt heavy. The black bean was really salty so I felt bloated. The second dish was the halibut, which was over cooked and the vinaigrette sauce over powered the natureal flavor of the fish.

pics.caption: Halibut in a vinaigrette sauce which overpowered the over cooked fish

review.des:
Have been here twice from out of town and truly adore it. The menu has changed since my last visit but everything is still just as delicious. This visit we shared the beets, green beans, corn pierogies, goat confit, bucatini, diver scallops, hamachi crudo, peanut butter and jelly dessert, and the caramel corn dessert. I also had the Salt and Ash cocktail which was delicious and exactly what I thought it would taste like.

Service was amazing, received great recommendations from our server who also checked in often and always had a smile.

Standout dishes:
Green beans- delicious delicious delicious, the fish sauce and the creamy sauce on top were different and inspiring
Corn Pierogies- soft and crispy, great corn flavor
Diver Scallops- fabulous flavors and textures, scallops perfectly cooked
Goat Confit- my favorite dish of the night, rich, reminiscent of pork belly, basically licked the plate clean
PB and J dessert- the PB mousse component was so light and airy and had such a great flavor
Caramel Corn dessert- well balanced in terms of flavor and texture, get a little bit of everything in each bite

Just as amazing as I remember it being. This is my Chicago go-to!

Came here while on vacation in Chicago celebrating my 2nd anniversary and the food and service were amazing. The waitress even surprised us and brought out a cute little dessert with 2 candles and everything. It was really nice and delicious too! We definitely be coming back here next time we visit!
Great food for a nice date night. More on the expensive side but the way the pair various flavors, it is worth it!

It was really hard to get a reservation but this place was definitely worth the wait! We loved everything we tried - calamari, pig face, empanadas and others! Highly recommend if you can get a reservation!

Great food, pleasant staff, small plates, full belly, light pocketbook. Food was very flavorful, impeccably prepared, unique combinations of flavors, and fun seating options. You can sing inside on sofas (tables could be a but higher in this area), the bar, a patio (weather permitting), and of course tables. So overall the food was great, the service staff amazing even on a busy Friday night after a street festival.

Food is served family style and is in varying portions and quantities. Suggestions of  2-3 items per person were honestly for me a bit excessive in both quantity and cost (each items is quite pricey for the size, like tappas), glad I only opted for 2 items as i still ended up wasting and leaving food on my plate which kinda bums me out because it was quite good. Would definitely recommend to others, simply get less than suggested unless you're a big eater or super hungry. A cute niche restaurant, I get why it's so beloved, may just not be for me.

Overall still a great meal and restaurant.

pics.caption: Goat ribs. Great caramelization and char.

review.des: Took many months to finally get a reservation but I now see why this delightful place is packed every night. Delicious small plates ( which are not that small) packed full of subtle flavors. Our waitress was friendly and helpful with our choices . When she discovered it was our anniversary 2 deserts appeared on her! Highly recommend Girl & The Goat for a memorable dining experience

Girl & the Goat is never disappointing! Drinks come and food arrives with a sense of unforced happiness that's hard to really describe. And the food is absolutely incredible!

I highly recommend.

Girl & the Goat serves up some of the best food I have ever had. Chef Stephanie Izard has really put together an amazing restaurant with such an eclectic menu full of bold flavors. It is highly recommended that you get a reservation way in advance or you'll be stuck with a reservation at 10:45pm...if you're lucky. Of course, you can always test your luck by just showing up without a reservation and get seated at the bar or outdoors with a bunch of strangers. As uncomfortable as you may be squished in between strangers and sharing table space with them - the food makes up for it. Also, the breads and desserts menus seem to change frequently.

The dishes here are meant to be shared so bring a few friends so you can order multiple things off the menu. The sweet 'n spicy brioche came with a delicious honey sambal butter and refreshing spring lamby jam. I wish I could have a jar of both the butter and jam to take home. The confit goat belly at $19 was pretty much the definition of small, pretentious food though. While tasty, it came with a small piece of goat belly with bourbon butter, lobster, crab, and fennel. I am not a huge fan of vegetables but the roasted cauliflower was a rockstar. I never knew cauliflower could be so good. The pickled peppers, pine nuts, and mint really added nice flavors to the roasted cauliflower dish. The wood oven roasted pig face was so succulent with the perfect amount of fat. It's a beautiful dish with gorgeous colors. My favorite dish of the night had to be the crisp braised pork shank. The pork was so flavorful and tender. I loved the crispy exterior because it added a lovely crunch. The made-from-scratch naan bread that it came with was the best! So warm. So soft. I could have munched on it all night.

For dessert, I opted for the donettes. Not the best choice on my part. It came with two donettes and a small scoop of ice cream. I wish it came with an extra scoop because it really balanced out the warm donette well. The entire dessert was topped off with a bleu cheese caramel that was a bit too strong for my taste. Regular caramel would have sufficed but it wouldn't have been a creative dish if it didn't have that cheesy caramel, right?

Service was amazing. Our waitress was a gem. We came around 9:00pm and got seated at a large outdoor picnic-esque table with multiple strangers so she had to deal with all of us PLUS having to deal with us moving indoors due to the unexpected rain. Our food still found us despite the move and we still received stellar service. She even packaged up our leftovers nicely and gave us a little extra naan bread and grilled spring onion and radish kimchi for the pork shank.

This has to be one of my favorite restaurants of all time.  When you're in Chicago you have to come here.  Make reservations in advance as they fill up very quickly.   Sit at the bar and enjoy a craft cocktail made to perfection by one of the friendly bartenders.  , About an hour before your reservation as it's not easy to get a spot at the bar... But I highly recommend it so that you can get a feel for as many aspects of the restaurant as possible

After thinking about coming here for 4+ years, we finally did it tonight! Living in Chicago, we knew how hard reservations are. So, we decided to just show up, the two of us, later on a Sunday evening. We asked the host if we could put our name on the list while we had a drink at the bar. No problem---had a glass of wine and, as we finished, our table for two was ready. Perfect!

I won't go into all the details on how the place works, atmosphere, etc. It works well. Read other reviews for those details :)

Food:

-Foccacia bread with feta. Good. Nothing crazy, but solid.
-Warmed olives. Ditto to the above.
-Goat empanadas. These were kind of a letdown. The very middle bite of the empanada was amazing, as it had all the tender meat. But, the rest just tasted like any normal, fried empanada.
-Corn pierogies. Very good pierogies. Would I order it again? I don't think so. These were fine and all, but looking at the rest of the menu, we could have made potentially better choices.
-Green beans with fish sauce and cashews. Perhaps the highlight! These things were so f-ing good. Get them.
-Pork shank. Ditto to the above. Tender, fall of the bone pork. They serve it with naan so you can make little wraps. I used zero bread---the meat was just too good by itself. The buttermilk and buffalo sauces served compliment each other (and the pork).

So, G&G was very good. I compare it to Purple Pig given the style but, so far, give the edge to PP. However, this was my first time at G&G whereas I've been to PP half a dozen times. I think I would order a little differently next time and probably find a much better food experience that way, as some of the early items were just okay while the later items knocked my socks off!

Advice: Go here and order what sounds good to you.

G&TG wins best place to have dinner in Chi-town.

Been here twice and it's a must for me when I'm visiting the city.

Getting a table can be hard, so come early.

Pig face is my favorite. Messy and tasty... love the textures and flavor. Different is good.

I'm coming back the next time I'm in the city.

I made a reservation for our anniversary about 3 months in advance after finding out we were heading to Chicago to see Hamilton. I'd been dying to try Girl and the Goat.
It was packed on Friday night at 9:45, making a reservation is in your best interest. When we we arrived my husband was veryyyy skeptical that he was going to like anything. He started the evening by saying that I could just order whatever I wanted, but after further inspection of the menu we both decided we'd order two things a piece (everything to share our course).
I ordered the chickpea fritters and the goat belly, my husband ordered the goat empanadas and the pig face. Everything was perfect! Each dish was bursting with wonderful flavor and textures that complimented each other so well.
We want to go back again soon! I think we would have a hard time not ordering the same things again. If we had a larger group we probably would have tried one of their signature breads, so that's definitely on our list for next time.
As far as service goes, we were seated right away, even though we arrived about 15 minutes prior to our reservation. Our waitress and the serving staff was super attentive throughout the whole evening.
When setting our reservation on open table I marked that it was our anniversary and they brought out a dessert on the house!

We chose to visit when we were in town and I'm so glad that we did! We made reservations for a Thursday night several weeks in advance and only were able to get in at 1015 pm but it was worth it!! We ordered small plates and an assortment of veggie and meat options. Our breads were amazing. The green beans and chickpea dishes were phenomenal!! The beets and salmon also delicious. I could have done without the calamari however. The atmosphere and sequence that the food was delivered to the table was phenomenal and complemented perfectly. I would highly recommend!

Probably one of my favorite meals of all time. The menu is tapas style where two people can share 4-5 dishes. I must first rave about the pineapple right side up cocktail, it was probably one of the best cocktails I've ever had. It had fruit flavors, toasted notes but wasn't overpowering on sweet or booze. Some of the things that were top notch were the goat empanadas, crispy beef short ribs (probably the best short ribs I have ever had), chick pea fritters, and black bass. All of these things hit the flavor notes they were aiming for. The brioche was serviceable but not a favorite. The service was quick and professional (not too chatty but polite). My only wish is that my husband would have wanted to order dessert.

The hype is REAL, y'all! I try not to pile on compliments for places that are already this well-known and renowned, but I can't help but give props to Girl & the Goat for one of the best meals I've ever eaten. During my last visit to Chicago, I didn't plan ahead and could not get a seat to the restaurant. I learned my lesson, and this time, some friends and I made reservations about a month in advance.

As a group of four, we ordered six dishes and two desserts, and it was more than enough food. We tried the goat empanadas, sauteed green beans, tempura soft shell crab, glazed lamb ribs, roasted pig face, and my personal favorite, the crisp braised pork shank. I don't think I've ever heard so many "Wows!" and "Oh my Gods!" over a meal in my life. Each dish was mind blowing and prepared with such great skill and technique. Every component part went perfectly well with the main item making each bite an adventure of flavor and texture. And the sauces, I would have happily drank them as shots because they were so delicious. The cocktails were also great and had plenty of punch to make our dining experience extra fun. I would also recommend saving room for dessert because the two items we tried, the chocolate cake and the rhubarb and goat cheese bavarian, were very impressive.

For about $50 a person (including a round or two of alcohol), we actually found our meal to be a bargain. The whole experience, from the service to the food and drinks, was excellent. Add me the ever-growing list of fans of this place, and you better believe I'll be fighting for a table here whenever I'm in Chicago.

The food was pretty interesting, lots of flavorful choices to satisfy everyones palates. The pork shoulder was so tender with juices spilling out it was shared by the table. Decent wine selection for those conissours.
Low ambiant lighting, low roar of patrons enjoying conversations makes the atmosphere perfect for date night.

I went here for my 22nd birthday party dinner with my boyfriend. It was months ago (March) but I still wish we went to different place to celebrate. The waiter was very mean and had no smile at all. My bf mentioned it was my birthday to him while he was serving food. We didn't ask for anything and he went straight to "nice, there is nothing we can serve separately". It made me blush. I didn't even ask for anything and he had to make it look like I as begging for dessert. We ended up writing on the receipt "smile!" and gave $1 as tip.

Food was good and presented very well. Most likely all waiters are not like the one we had but least for me it's not a birthday celebration spot.

What a great find. Thank you, Yelp!  Food and service were over-the-top good. Beware, it's noisy, but worth seeking out, if you are tourists like us. I would skip the beet salad, unless you are a fan of frisée, but everything else was wonderful.
I have never been to this place. How this review ended up here is beyond me!  My original review was for Brunswick Zone in Niles.
Every meal seems to be original, balanced and delicious! You can't go wrong with whatever you choose. Goat empanadas are a must!
Best restaurant in Chicago. Do yourself a favor and get the Pigs Face and the Green Beans

Excellent food, enviroment.  
The service is really fast, amazing service and amazing food.
Came for a birthday celebration. Absolutely stunning meal that I will remember for a long, long time.

Well known, yet overrated. The wait times are insanely long and the prices are certainly not worth the small sizes and just above average quality of the dishes. It's also packed inside which takes away from the otherwise great ambiance. The waiters were great, nonetheless. Expect to order at least 2 dishes per person. It wasn't horrible, but the price : quality ratio definitely was.

Six thousand reviews with four and a half stars is a hard bar to meet. But Girl and the Goat sails right by that bar every time I've dined there!

The pork shank build your own naan and ranch/buffalo sauce combo is a must-get. It's a hearty apportionment of meat, so be sure you bring at least one other person with you so you can enjoy this along with other things on the menu. I recommend ordering an extra naan, lest you be fighting for bread scraps.

Vegetable sides here really shine. During this most recent visit, our server informed us the green beans have been on the menu since the restaurant's opening, and I see why: aside from being blanched to a perfect crispness, the fish sauce aioli adds a very unique and tasty flavor. Also highlights from my previous visits - both the cauliflower and broccoli dishes. These portions are generous: expect one side to be a reasonable amount for 3-5.

Everyone in our group agreed the lamb ribs with sticky Asian sauce - a recent special - were a top highlight. Here one should note the quantity will leave you wanting more, there are just four small, but very delicious ribs in the order.

Despite the restaurant's name, I'd suggest passing on the goat, at least the empanadas. At any other restaurant I'm sure they'd be one of the most popular dishes but here, I think it's better conserving the valuable stomach real estate for their main menu!

Reservations highly recommended, I've seen groups quoted at two plus hours for a table. If you come in a small enough party, the bar and lounge space is first come first serve, and offers the full menu.

I love the concept and the fact that the restaurant serves some of the most unique dishes related to goats. It's definitely not something you can find easily, but there were several components that left us wanting more.

The hostess was extremely rude to us. When she sat us down, we casually asked her how many dishes she would recommend for a table of two, she gave an extremely curt answer "your server can answer that" and left without a word. Come on, how much effort does it take to answer that question? Or with a "I'm not sure, but you can ask server". Needless to say that left us quite miffed for the remainder of the night.

The food was great, and we enjoyed the dishes. The goat mouse left more to be desired. Given the fattiness of mouse, I think they would have done better to serve the dish with crackers/crisps or anything that's not drenched in butter. Instead, the mouse were served with "bread" that was basically deep fried doughnuts, and so oily that we could not take with the mouse. I think we ate a third of the dish in total.

For dessert, we had chocolate cake with shiitake ice cream. It was an interesting taste, I would recommend that for anyone who is adventurous with ice cream flavors. Not something I'll order again, but definitely worth trying.

pics.caption: Orange and regular brioche. You can see the line where the two doughs separate

review.des: You have to go here if you have the chance. The menu is unique and it is an excellent dining experience. Book WAY ahead of time. It's not a place you go to last minute. If you are visiting Chicago and can't get in, check out The Little Goat right down the street...it is more of a cafe/diner experience, but you'll get top notch service and Stephanie Izard owns it (and the menu) as well.

Food: 5
Cleanliness: 4.5
Staff: 5

Thank you for an amazing experience. We made our reservations 2 months in advance. There was four of us and it was perfect especially because this place offers shareable dishes, which many had four pieces.

Everything was made perfectly balanced. Our favorites were the Perogies, Wild Shrimp, Blackened Cat Fish, Pig Face, And Chocolate Cake. Each dish had that fine finesse; you can tell how much the chef cared for each and every bite!

Our waiter, we forget his name, possibly Josh? Was great. The service kept us full and the order of dishes that came to the table was perfect. We left full and happy. The four of us ordered 8 plates, 1 dessert, 2 drinks, about $50 person.

(A - 0.5 for cleanliness because the bathrooms didn't smell too great.. )

Overall, I would come back again, so much more to try! Have to make that early reservation again.

pics.caption: The best way to end your meal, with Chocolate Cake and Shitake Gelato (from Black Dog Gelato)

review.des:
Very trendy, nice spot for a dinner date.

Nice selection of beers, both on tap and bottled.

Really enjoyed the goat empanadas and the pig face.

My girlfriend liked the warm olives and shishito peppers.

The roasted cauliflower was very underwhelming.

Star of the night was the blue cheese caramel covered "donettes" - which was a very interesting dessert!

I regret not getting the braised pork shank - it looked amazing!

My friend took me here saying, it is one of best restaurants here in Chicago.
1) Coming to the food, I would rate it OK. Seared Diver Scallops were way too salty, we couldn't even eat them. Grilled Cuttlefish was cooked irregularly, some of it was really chewy. Wood Fired Whole Branzino was good, Pig Face was good(according to my friends).
2) The waiter we got was very rude, she never smiled. If one can't work in a restaurant when it is busy, and cant hide their anger, then they shouldn't be working in service industry. We asked her, "could you smile". She replied, "why should I"? These are the people who go to social media when someone doesn't tip. Tip is earned, it is not something you are entitled.
I will give it another shot someday, and see if my experience changes. Overall ,it was a OK food, and below par service.

After a few days in Washington DC, we came to the magical Chicago! Everyone raved about this restaurant called Girl and the Goat. I am such a picky eater that when I saw the menu I was a little skeptical about actually going. I decided to just go with it and see why everyone raved about this place. You know what I wish? That I would've come before!!! Oh, my, god. This place. This place is everything. A MUST go to in you're in Chicago. Its all sharing plates so please order a lot to be able to try as much as you can! It's worth it!

I ordered the roasted cauliflower (which btw, I hate veggies) and I wish the portion was bigger lol...We also ordered the red fish. Which is a soup with fish and clams. (Bit spicy) also amazing. That taste was out of this world. My FAVORITE plate was the pork shank. So tender. The waiter literally took the bone with his finger and left no meat behind on that bone. Wow!! Delicious!!!!!! I wish it was bigger!! If it weren't because I wanted to make room for dessert, I definitely would've ordered another one. What a fatty! For dessert we ordered their version of a pineapple upside down cake with bourbon ice cream. Incredible.

In order words, MAKE RESERVATIONS! You must go! I went on a Wednesday night and it was full. That says a lot about the restaurant itself. One of the best meals I've ever had in Chiberia!

Our best meal in Chicago by far! My friend was able to get last minute reservations for dinner, but from what I have heard, that's rare. So make sure you have a reservation before stopping by.

We order a lot of plates and shared them family style- which I think is the way to go. My favorite dish was the calamari bruschetta. You get two pieces of bruschetta with calamari and I believe goat cheese on top. My friends favorite was the roasted cauliflower dish. My bf favorite was the pig face.

Regardless of what you order, you can't go wrong. They have really mastered creating flavorful unique dishes. I can't wait to go back!

Culinary genius!! The pairings of flavors are so inventive - unmatched!!! My favorite dish were the scallops and sausage and my fiancé drooling over the goat belly ! Can't wait to make it back to Chicago and go back. Make a rezzy like a month in advance - pro tip!! I ate in the lounge- called every day for weeks and nothing but I was really just happy to be there so didn't mind the lounge at all !

6 dishes for 2 people around $120 after tax and tip. My boyfriend and I were beyond stuffed! The recommendation from the server was around 2-3 dishes per person, but I think that that's a pretty generous estimate. Some honorable mentions from the night:

Pig face: Extremely delicious. The hype for this dish is well deserved. It is very savory and rich with a lot of flavors. I love the combination.

Goat Empanadas: I'm not usually a goat meat fan, but these empanadas tasted great.

Sweet Corn Pierogies: Filled with corn and potatoes. Great vegetarian dish.

Hamachi Crudo: very delicious!

Overall, I really love the dining experience that Girl and the Goat has. The atmosphere, service, food, decor, staff is all just very amazing. I would absolutely recommend checking this restaurant out as well as the rest of the "Girl and the Goat line" of restaurants in Chicago. The food is a must try. Kudos to Izard and her team.
Food was mediocre. Cool vibe and great servers. My fave were the oysters and duck confit tartare.

The #1 top restaurant of our Chicago vacation.  That's saying a lot considering all the nice places we went to.  I wasn't sure in the beginning because all I could think about was GOAT?!  But this restaurant is sooooo much more than that.  Served family style, our table of 6 had such a great time selecting our shareable dishes and passing them around and tasting and commenting on everything.  I think we picked really well, as everything we had was extremely yummy.  A sampling:

Pan Fried Shishito Peppers
Chickpea Fritters
Green Garlic Potato Pierogies
Goat Empanadas
Escargot Ravioli
Tempura Soft Shell Crab
Woodfire Glazed Lamb Ribs
Wood Oven Roasted Pig Face
Grilled Walter's Chicken
Crisp Braised Pork Shank

And I will say, if you're gonna try goat for the first time, get it in an empanada.  Also, the pig face doesn't come to the table as an actual pig face.  THANK FREAKING GOODNESS.

Each menu item is large enough to share, but small enough if you want to hoard it for yourself.  And if an item comes with less "pieces" than the amount of people at your table, you have the option of adding an extra so everyone gets a bite.  The desserts are less shareable as they are full serving size items, but we ordered one of everything and passed them around the table anyway.

Overall, a FANTASTIC meal.  Great experience.  Exceptional service.  I would recommend this place to anyone, over and over again.

Amazing meal! This restaurant lives up to all the hype and reviews. From beginning of the meal to the end the food, ambience and service were excellent. From the unctuous and umami of the duck tongues and delicious take on crab Rangoon, everything was delicious. Next time I am in town I hope to come back.

Worth the hype! The food here definitely impressed and made this a 5 star restaurant for me.
Our reservation was at 10pm on a Wednesday... which sounds absurd but honestly if you come that late on a weekday there's way more parking (and free!) and it's way less crowded/loud in the restaurant overall! Inside it is a bit crowded and dark.
We started with the focaccia bread with salmon spread. It was good, bread was warm, but nothing too special. (3/5)
Then we got the scallops. I love scallops in general, but the sauce on these were a little strong flavored for me. There were 2 large scallops. (4/5)
Then we got the pork shank. It's $26 but so so worth it. They give you lot of meat! We quickly ran out of naan but the pork by itself was more than enough. Nice and crispy on the outside, juicy on the inside. (5/5)
The goat belly was also very good. It had a buttery sauce with lobster and crab. Smaller portion, but still delicious and rich. (Not pictured; 4/5)
The last thing we got was the dessert. We got the tasty yummy toffee cake and it was SO good. The cake was soaked in the ice cream and toffee sauce, and there were little pieces of toffee that gave it some crunch. I'd never had orange gooseberry before but it was so good--a little tangy and sweet, perfect addition to the dish. (5/5)

Simply AMAZING!!

If you are an adventurous foodie and want a unique experience, then this place is IT! The combinations that Chef put together are truly a work of art.

At first, I wasn't sure how dish will be just looking at the ingredients of each dish, but once you take that first bike, it was phenomenal!

We ordered 8 dishes and didn't regret a single one!

This place has charm, excellent service. Worth it to wait for!

Full course meal (10/10)
Everything was really good! Even if it looked like the sauces don't match. The waiter also recommend a good 2 bottles of wine + 2 dessert wines that were also matched the food we were eating. definitely would recommend this place! Super satisfied after!
As you can see not much left to say..great food consistently and always great service!! Only bad thing is the wait can be long at times but worth it!! Food and Drinks YASSSS

This place lives up to the hype. Amazing inspired food and great service. They are run like a machine, so once you sit, get ready for a culinary rocket ship. Well known secret, make reservations, or if you didn't, try the bar. It turns over relatively fast and you can order the whole menu there. Either way you won't regret visiting one of the hottest places in town.

Limited food selection and they don't have a lot of options on the cocktails menu.

It gets pretty crowded and takes some time to get a table. I chose to sit at the bar, ordered a salad which was terrible then I ordered a chicken entree it was actually pretty good. I tried couple of drinks from the cocktails menu and try were all bad, I went with the safe option of asking for a margarita, those tasted great.

Awesome food, great experience.

Really enjoyed how unique the dishes were.  Favorites: duck tongues, roasted cauliflowers, escargot ravioli, and the goat empanadas.

Food was very good but I think they have "gone downhill" a little. It is a great place for a group gathering but in the beginning they had more attention to detail. We were served one drink here, two here. A cold appetizer (ummm....wasn't supposed to me cold) . I still can't resist the bass or the branzino. I know a lot of people don't like liver mousse but this is one of the best you'll have. It's very good food but my first experience was near perfection and the twice I have been back in the last year seem to indicate something is "slipping". I hope it hangs on! There are  so many places to choose from on Randolph!

We tried making reservations, but could not even get close. Next reservation was a month out. If you absolutely want to come here, plan far in advance.

Luckily, we walked in on a Sunday night and got seated immediately. Our server was great and the food delicious. I'm personally not a huge fan of small plates, but it was enjoyable and the portions were surprisingly large. That said, I do wish I was a bit more full for how much we spent.

One of those places that is popular because it is popular. The food was good, but not even close to the hype and even further from the price point.

Worth the experience if you are an aspiring instagram model and need something for your snap story... and if someone else is paying, but only then.

I think I was too excited to come here for what I actually got.

Ordered the Pimms cup to drink, it was good but nothing special.

Started with the cornbread on special, it was a blueberry cornbread with honey butter and pepper jam. Good, worth getting.

Next was chickpea fritters. Also good. Inside was a creamy almost hummus texture with a crispy outside. Sitting on top of plums, tomatoes, and feta cheese. Good flavor, just something wasn't completely here.

Then was the shishito peppers. Covered in a crispy cheesy aioli. Probably wouldn't try again.

Next was the duck tongue. Crispy little pieces covering tuna poke, black beans, and seaweed. Really really good. My favorite thing of the night.

Last were Kalbi beef ribs. Sad. Good flavor but really only got one bite of meat each, and a bite of corn on the cob.

So. For the difficulty of getting a reservation, and the amount of food you get it really is not deserving of the hype and rating here. Don't get me wrong, I fully enjoyed my meal, I just wouldn't come here again as I think there are much better places in Chicago to eat at.

I accepted a new job in Tampa and my new hire orientation was in Chicago. I rarely sit at the bar by myself for dinner, but after reading Yelp reviews and listening to suggestions from friends, I decided that I couldn't pass up the opportunity to eat here by myself, even if it meant walking 20 minutes to get here in the windy and freezing 17-degree weather.

This place starts to get packed quickly after rush hour. Luckily after getting there at 5:30, I did not have to wait for a spot at the bar. Definitely make a reservation in advance if you plan on coming here with a large party.

The bartender answered all of my questions about the menu and gave me some recommendations on what to order. I decided to order the Chickpea Fritters (harvest chat, masala yogurt, sheep's feta) and the Crisp Braised Pork Shank (buttermilk dressing, butternut squash, & roasted shiitake kimchi). The Shank also came with a side of naan bread. Also, the menu constantly changes with the seasons. Both items were awesome. My mouth still waters just thinking about the Shank, but I destroyed both items. I wish I was with more people so that we could have ordered a bunch of items and shared. I wanted to try everything on the menu, even the stuff that I couldn't pronounce.

If you come here with a large party, be sure to make a reservation in advance and come here! You will NOT be disappointed!

Service - A+
Atmosphere - A++
Food - A+++

pics.caption: Top - Chickpea Fritter Bottom - Crisp Braised Pork Shank

review.des:
As a chef who formerly lived in Chicago I have been dying to come here ever since it opened! I finally had my chance this past Sunday when I was back in the city for the first time in years and was treated the best meal of my life! Our server, Taylor, tremendously enhanced my experience as her enthusiasm for the menu mirrored my own and I was extremely impressed with her knowledge of both the ingredients and preparation of the dishes!

Each dish was carefully thought out and beautifully balanced, both in texture and flavor. I would never have come up with some of the delicious flavor combinations myself but left feeling very inspired! The antique industrial decor was upscale and modern while simultaneously warm and inviting. I don't know the next time I will get to be back in the city but one thing is for sure - I will plan my trip with plenty of time to make a reservation so that I can be wow'ed all over again!

Great food and fun experience! Service was also exceptional, we asked our waitress for recommendations and ordered almost everything she suggested without any regrets. Reservations need to be booked WAY in advance so plan ahead

Absolutely DELICIOUS and worth it for a great deal....but just be ready to pay for small portions.  For myself...I'll go anywhere for food and pay more than I probably should; but for those who appreciate good food, but are on a budget and aren't necessarily live-to-eat types, might be a bit pricey.

Drooled over the below:
- Goat empanadas
- Halibut
- Calamari bruschetta
- Kalbi beef ribs:  Good, but not stellar.  I'd pass on this the next time I come back...I prefer my OG Korean restaurant kalbi

I'd get the Calamari and Halibut for SURE again.  Can't wait to come back for more!

A one of a kind experience. Girl & the Goat was a three month preparation for my visit to chitown in the gorgeous fall season. The reservations are famous for being booked months in advance with a low chance of acceptable walk-ins, so do take heed. If you are unable to make advance reservations, there is a sister restaurant strategically placed across the street, Little Goat, with a more casual diner experience. But, since you've read this review, you'll definitely be prepared to lock in a seat for you and your friends on your first visit! :)

We made a reservation for 8pm on a Friday night.  This place with bustling and every table was filled. We arrived a little early and had to wait to be seated at our reservation time.

We ordered an item from each section (except Fish) because we wanted to try two goat dishes (Vegetable, Fish, Meat, Bread, Oysters, Goats, and Dessert).

We started our meal with Focaccia bread accompanied with warm butter and apple maple glaze, Pan fried Shishito peppers with delicious, fluffy parmesan. Wood Oven Roasted Pig Face was flavorful but not overpowering, highly recommend. The sunny side up egg was so satisfying to break open. Oysters arrived with four pieces with three flavor choices (Raw, fried, wood fired). We tried one of each with a second order of wood fired, which we loved the best. The anticipated goat dishes came last and were the highlight of the night. Goat Empanada was tender and tasty. Confit Goat Belly was definitely my favorite. This one had mixed reviews at our table with the goat, seafood and fennel mix (bourbon butter, lobster & crab, fennel). But it was delicious and one of the most unique dishes I've ever tried. For dessert, we finished with Caramel Corn & Malt balls, which was essentially chocolate/caramel popcorn with vanilla ice cream. It was good, but not mind blowing like the main entrees. Overall, it was a sweet necessity to end an amazing meal. This meal was exceptional and I would definitely see myself making advanced reservations again when I'm back in town. A great feature to the Chicago experience! Thanks Girl & Goat!

We really enjoyed this meal, and, for the quality, the prices were good.

The atmosphere has lots of energy and some noise.   Also, I consider this on the casual end of the spectrum for this level of quality.

I suggest about two dishes per person.  The standouts for me were the escargot ravioli    and surprisingly the wood-grilled broccoli.  Also, the goat shank was very solid and does not have that typical goat after-taste -- very tender and well prepared.  

I did not have room for dessert.

Also, as mentioned, in the title, the old fashioned was an awesome treat and was well balanced with BOTH bourbon and rye, which is typically one or the other.

I would definitely return if I could get a reservation at a time that worked.  The food is a cut above at this price point, and the atmosphere is fun.  I would not consider it intimate or appropriate if you are looking for a high-end, traditional dining experience.

The food here is really great. It's hard to get in here, but worth it! I loved the menu. The vegetarian options were abundant! Super cool west loop vibe on restaurant row (Randolph) great for a date or to bring out of town guests. Docked one star because they serve a pig's face... now that's just cruel AF.

The only thing I regret is not getting a third order of goat empanadas.

This was my very first experience with goat, and I was terrified! But if you can't do it here, then where? I sat outside at the communal table and started with a puttin' on the spritz cocktail, which is basically the most perfect and drinkable thing you can imagine (aperol, grapefruit tonic, lemon, sparkling wine).

The waitress pointed out some menu items that they could serve in half-size portions, which was perfect for me as a solo diner. I got the tempura soft shell crab, which was pretty good, and the goat empanadas, which were AMAZING. In fact... it was so amazing that I ordered a second round and only felt mildly embarrassed about it (it was half size, so 2x=1, right?). The goat was pulled and marinated in some delicious magic, served in a tiny pocket of joy and garnished with all the best things like queso fresco, avocado, and pineapple-blueberry salsa. Honestly, if it wasn't for my dignity, I would have gotten a third. They were that good.
Goat was good. Girl was also delicious. Big dog moves. Very big dog spot. Need more Gatorade

One of the best meals I've ever had. Even now, a month after the fact, I'm still thinking about the goat empanadas and the scallops. This place lives up to the considerable amount of hype surrounding it, from the food to the service. Great date night spot, and by West Loop standards, not terribly pricey.

Right off the chart excellent! My first visit and my waitress was very helpful and informative. She split the orders since I was one person and wanted to try a variety of items. They are very accomadating.  I had the sourdough bread, mini shrimp, mini scallop, halibut and mini green beans. Every bite was better than the last bite on every item. This was a fantastic foodie restaurant. Everything was excellent and even the simple green bean was turned into an artful dish with an outstanding flavor. I will return when I can get a reservation. Its worth the wait!

The Girl & The Goat was excellent! I was lucky enough to score a reservation here last minute on my birthday and it was a real treat. We split the goat liver mousse, goat empanadas, diver scallops, and the pig face. All of it was outstanding and my friend and I both agreed it was some of the best food we've ever tasted.

The whole experience here was wonderful; the dishes were impeccably timed...just as we were finishing up one dish, the next one came out. Our server was very helpful and recommended a perfect bottle of wine to compliment our menu choices. He even gave us roasted cauliflower on the house and even that was insanely delicious.

10/10 would recommend! Make sure to make a reservation otherwise you'll definitely be waiting awhile!

pics.caption: Pig Face. Just insanely good, order it
Caramel corn & malt balls. Ridiculously delicious
Goat liver mousse. The croquettes were out of this world and the perfect compliment to the tasty mousse

review.des: Our meal and experience was so great! We walked in on a Thursday night and were able to get bar seats after a short wait. Our bartender was amazing (older I think Asian guy?). He happily gave us his recs when we asked, for food and drinks. Loved all the items we had but the pierogies, green beans, and goat belly were stand outs. All amazing flavors. We declined desserts after debating and as we were finishing our drinks...the bartender sent us out his favorite dessert on the house anyway! It was the ice cream with carmel corn dish and it was really great. Overall loved this place and the outstanding service only made the whole thing so much better.
Amazing love this place!! The hole experience from start to finish was on point. I had the shank....fork tender as you see in the pic loved it! The Parmesan crusted peppers is must....100% recommend!

Exceptional food and service. I sat near the kitchen and was able to see the chefs working their magic. When we were hesitant to try a dish because of an ingredient, the server gave us that dish free of charge!

Ran off the Green Line and arrived at 4:27 to a line outside the door-- a line that lasted a precise minutes until a hostess led us to our neat outdoor table. Can you already tell this experience is going to be perfect? If not: this experience is going to be perfect.
My (cheap) boyfriend and I (also cheap) just got two dishes-- the vegan bucatini and the chickpea tart. Both were mind blowing, but the chickpea tart is what did me in. Seriously, that first bite of chickpea tart will live on as a golden memory. All was perfect; all was right; my mouth was full of this creamy tart garnished in olives and pomegranate and mint (I think?). Long shared tables let us spy on other dishes, all of which looked-- you guessed it-- perfect. Especially the ham bread.

Went w another couple and ordered enough for 2 more meals.
Food: olive bread 3, potato bread 4, chickpea fritter 5 ah-mazing!!!, green beans 1, pierogi's 1, crispy short rib 1 my piece was all fat, black bass 4, but was not a fan of the sticky rice, butter chicken 3, pork shank 4, sticky cake 2
Ambience: 4 place was packed on Super Bowl Sunday at 9:45pm
Service: 5
Cleanliness: 4, did not like that they put leftover bag on the floor
I will only be back for the chickpea fritter.
We had an amazing meal and loved everything we had!! Our waiter, Cesar, gave us great recommendations and was tremendously helpful and sweet! We loved everything about it!

Not bad - about 3.5 stars for food and 5 for service, so it lands around 4 stars. It's might be a little overhyped, but it was a great atmosphere and a fun place to try while visiting Chicago. The waiters and staff were very friendly!

The food seemed to be a little hit-or-miss, but it might just be what we ordered. We tried the shishito peppers based their recommendation and usually I enjoy spicy food, but I wouldn't get these unless you KNOW you like shishito peppers...I have never eaten peppers on their own before and did not particularly care for them. We found ourselves avoiding the actual peppers and eating the parmesan coating instead.

The roasted pig face was probably our favorite and the skirt steak was pretty good as well. If you enjoy fusion food, then you'll likely love this place.

I liked it. Didn't live up to all the hype.
To be honest I don't even remember what I ate.

I recently went here with thirteen women for a Bachelorette Party and it was nothing short of amazing! We were seated right in front of the open kitchen where we had a front row seat to all the action. We tried so many dishes, our server Shikira recommended sharing plates. My favorites were the pork shank, lamb ribs and beef tongue!

We finally scored a reservation to this place. Now I know why it took us a while to get a reservation. The food here is amazing. Elevated comfort food with a twist. We ordered a bunch of different items so we could try everything. My favorite dishes were the roasted beets, the blue cheese stuffed pierogis and lastly, the deconstructed peanut butter and jelly dessert was the bomb. And the craft cocktails were amazing. My 4 year old son even tried most of the dishes that we ordered which surprised me because he is so finicky.
The ambiance is trendy, really crowded and loud. Most of the interiors surfaces are hard so there isn't much sound absorption. You really have to speak really loud if you want to engage in any sort of conversation but I guess that's the sacrifice you have to make when he food is that good.

If in Chicago must eat place
Remind me trendy places in NY
Nice atmosphere good food at the casual set up

From eating the dishes, you can feel the spirit of the chefs. They are anything but boring! All the distinctive flavors and their harmonious combination keeps on refreshing your concept of deliciousness. Each dish obtains it's personality and gives you an unique mood when enjoying it.

Make a reservation! Awesome experience and awesome service.

My Faves:
Calamari bruschetta. Had goat ricotta was by far our favorite dish

Goat empanadas: amazing and the sauce that it comes with is delicious

Escargot ravioli: I happen to really like escargot and these did not disappoint

We also ordered the pig face which everyone raves about and we were not too crazy about it

I've been trying to get reservations for the last two weeks and last minute I was able to get one at 8:30. It's dark inside but the right amount of lighting

everything is family style! i love it because you can try many dishes.

What to get:

Sautéed green beans- WOW salty goodness! I could eat this every day!

Goat empanadas- I was scared to try goat. I've never tried it before and it was good! It reminded me a beef. It paired well with the sweet fruit and guac

Raw kusshi- I LOVE oysters and this had the right amount of vinegar. I wish it came with 6 insead of 4

Caramel ice cream with malt balls- so simple but so good. The caramel corn and ganache choco was SUPER good.

In the middle-

Pig face- The crispy flakes, the egg and the pork was ok. I know it's a popular item but I felt the green beans had more flavor. You should try it though

sweet and spicy brioche- the bread was awesome. I liked the honey samba butter better than the lamby jam. Im a big carb person but if you are not, then skip it.

That's going to be a no:

Escargot ravioli - I've never had escargot . But I did not enjoy this dish at all.

MAKE reservations 3-4 weeks before!

THE FLAVORRR!!! I can't stress this enough... is fantastic! They serve most of their food as a small dish to share, which is a little different than most restaurants you visit. I feel like it creates a social atmosphere to eating and gives you the opportunity to try a few things. My favorite were the Shishito Peppers and the Olive bowl (idk what they marinate those in but it's incredible) - The only reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5 is because of the lack of vegetarian/vegan options and the price. Especially when you're dealing with small plates I feel like it would be so easy to add another option or two that a vegan/vegetarian could opt for. In addition, these small plates were priceyyyy. Delicious... but pricey. Just know that you're going to have to be dropping more than a dime to take a trip to this flavor town.

Step 1: Book well in advance
Step 2: Fast for the day
Step 3: Order. the. pork. shank.

Overall: Restaurant is incredibly hyped up in the Chicago area, so on a work trip I made a point to come for dinner. I can definitely say that G&TG met my expectations, but they were pretty high to begin with after seeing all of the rave reviews surrounding this spot.

Service was stellar- our waiter was attentive and explained the dishes well while still maintaining the casual and personal ambiance this place has going.

Food- small portions on a few dishes, meat dishes on the large side.We ordered 4 plates for 2 people and could not come close to finishing them.
Bread- sounds silly to order the bacon bread as a starter here (read: we were starving) but it really was worth the $5 price tag.
Goat empenadas- 2 in the order, so flavorful and came with tasty dipping sauce. Could have eaten about 5 of these.
Broccoli- Good and came in a generous portion, the dish was a little too smoky for me
Pork Shank- for the love of god, order this dish. I could not believe how incredible this pork tasted and really is the reason for my 5 star review.

Price- 2 people, $112 with 1 cocktail each

Try it for a special occasion- you won't regret it!

pics.caption: Hamachi Crudo- tasty but very small portion for the price

review.des: I liked the place overall. I've only been the one time and found the service slow and even after making reservations well in advance there was a wait time. The atmosphere was what I didn't care for, it's jam packed.

Wonderful place - great food and fun atmosphere. We tried several dishes, and they all were unique and tasty. Loved the desserts! Wouldn't recommend to people who love big portions, it is small plates place. The restaurant conveniently located close to business and theater district.

Hands-down one of my favorite restaurant in Chicago. Whenever I have friends visiting from out of state, I always recommend this restaurant as well, and they always loved it!

I frequent this restaurant often, the only thing I hate is that the wait is always SO LONG. If you're not coming here right when it opens or with a reservation, expect hours of wait. Even with a reservation a month in advance, I almost always get the remaining 9:45 or 10:00pm slots, that's how popular the restaurant is. However, despite how busy it is, I never experience any delay in service. There is a couch area by the bar if you want to wait before your table is ready, which makes the waiting pleasant. The service is prompt and well-paced either.

Onto the menu and the food. Now, even though I've dined at this restaurant many times, I can always find something new on the menu, as they change often. The food here are small plates and designed to be shared. I definitely recommend the roasted cauliflower, lamb steak, and anything with goat (obviously). I have never been disappointed by the food, and the cocktails are amazing too.

I have to share the one experience where the service was truly outstanding, that prompted me to write this review. It was one of the rare nights that my friend and I decided to get some drinks at the restaurant spontaneously. My friend knew someone working at the restaurant, and asked the server if the guy he knows is working tonight, and our server told us no. No big deal, we still sat down and ordered our drinks. Soon, they served us an appetizer on the house. We were surprised, but happily accepts. After we finished our food and drinks, we were surprised to find out that the bill was $0. Our server didn't have to do that for us at all, yet he did it to make our night. We still tipped him the full amount of our meal, but we know that the next time we dine there, he will take good care of us, and we will give generous tips for him :)

I had a great time! My friend and I were able to walk in and get a seat within an hour. The server forgot our cocktails but the manager came over and apologized and covered them. It wasn't a big deal we were still on the second course. Worth it to stop by and see if they have a table

I don't give 5 stars often but, this place was a pleasant surprise and overall experience. The menu at first glance may seem very particular and maybe even odd to most. They put a unique twist on the culinary experience. You order dishes tapas style to share with the table. Our server Josh was very attentive, charming and knowledgeable about the most specific questions we had. The flavors from the cocktails, meal and desserts were perfection and a magnificent journey of flavor. Sensory overload in the best way. This is a must try in the Chicago land (Randolph st) area.

Must haves:
Scallops
Green beans
Pork shank
All the desserts!!!!!

Stef Izard is from my hometown of Stamford and went to support her top chef winning and little did I know what I was in for! Never in my wildest dreams would I think I I would eat Goat !! We had the goat empanadas - the tuna tartare - the Brussels sprouts - the strawberry dessert - and the short ribs. Amazing. Every single thing. You order a few small plates. The service was exceptional. The prices were great. The ambiance was perfect. Make a reservation. ASAP! This is to not be missed. Whether you are just hearing about it and live in Chicago or you're visiting. It's a must on the to do list. We want to go back just to eat there !!

We left before we could be seated, because the music was way too loud.  Too bad, because they have an interesting menu and decor.   I would have liked to have tried a goat dish.  I like to chat with my dinner companions, and that would have not been at all possible in this restaurant.

This is one of my favorite restaurants I've ever been to, because the food was so good!! So many places focus on presentation over taste, but this was a flavor-first menu. Everything was perfectly executed. Just WOW.

If you've tried goat, and especially if you didn't care for it, I urge you to try it again. The goat empanada was possibly the best thing I've eaten all year. I loved the corn flavor, the pineapple blueberry sauce, the avocado and perfect goat. The goat mousse was also amazing- not sweet at all; we all loved it.

We had the crab-stuffed squash blossoms (pure, amazing crab flavor), the crispy duck tongue with fresh, perfect ahi tuna and the pork shank, oh my! We licked the bone clean. Kudos on an outstanding meal.

The wine selection is also of note-- I am not familiar with a certain regions such as New Zealand, so I often avoid them on menus. The Sancerre I had was solid but the New Zealand Sav Blanc was off the charts! I found myself thinking about it the next day. For a limited by-the-glass menu, to put forward such memorable wine was a treat.

pics.caption: Licking the bone clean. Pork shank

review.des:
The food is really good.  It's not get a reservation two months in advance and still eat dinner at 9:30 good, but it is good.  Do you know why they get five stars in my book?  Allergies.  As soon as the waiter said hi, he asked if we had any allergies.  I do.  I've never had someone ask before ordering before.  I told him my allergies and he proceeded to take my menu and cross out everything I couldn't have.  And also noted what could be altered so I could eat it.

It was amazing.

Oh, and my husband said the old fashioned was really good, too.  He had two.
Meh. Typical yupster bar food in a gentrified neighborhood. jsjdndjdkdkdndndndndjdndkenn kd cjdnjdbjxndjdjdnc jnxndkckdnd

The wood fired oysters are deserving of a five star rating alone - tender, huge, juicy, and their saucy accompaniment a huge complement to umami.

Add the pork shank (ZOMG guys the tamarind sauce on this is savory deliciousness), the roasted califlower, the offered-year-round halibut and the chocolatey chocolate cake, and this meal was a definite (James Beard-award winning) positive experience. Plus, our server Taylor was great - informed, personable, accommodating, and friendly.  This was a fantastic meal, and I would easily return.

Not sure what the hype is. First time we went there, it was actually a very good experience cuz the service was so good. 2nd and 3rd time we went we sat at bar and the bartender was so rude - he gave me a pissed off look when I asked him to remake the old fashioned - it was so sugary and so disgusting. He remade it but it was still gross, tho less sweet. The food is ok - on the salty side. The desert was average. I would skip.

My husband and I came for his birthday. Despite living 2 blocks away, this is the first time he has been because it's so hard to get a reservation! Everything was amazing - the food, drinks, and service were all excellent - and they provided a bday dessert for him. Planning our next reservation for a few months from now. Thank you for a great evening!

Deeeelicious! Small platters to share . I had the wood fire oysters (amazing), the empanadas which were exquisitely coupled with pineapple, blueberries, and goat cheese (amazing), the halibut (which was just ok), and for dessert I had the vanilla ice cream with malt balls and caramel corn (I love to fall in love with desserts but I didn't love this one).

Great service, great food, great ambiance.

pics.caption: Empanadas with Ava sfo and pineapple and salsa purée

review.des:
I could not recommend a restaurant more than this one. Girl & the Goat might have ruined all other restaurants for me. Every time I am out somewhere else, I will wish I was there.

We went for our 7 year anniversary. Our server, Gary, greeted us with complimentary champagne. Best server ever. He was so knowledgeable and sweet. He made the night perfect for us.

We shared 4 dishes and a dessert. I wish I could remember the exact dishes- Challah bread, calamari, goat empanadas, goat mousse. It was one of those rare meals where each dish was the star of the show the moment we were eating it. I can't remember loving anything more than anything else. It was all perfect. Dessert was a malt ball popcorn dish.

We also tried two cocktails (coffee mezcal and gin earl grey) and they were outstanding.

Sometimes even places that are "worth the hype" are really still a one time experience. Girl & the Goat was so welcoming. We will be back ASAP.
I really enjoyed eating here. The food was tasty and the dishes were different. Cool atmosphere,  though it can be a bit loud. Only draw back was the small portions that leave you wanting a bit more!
The food was absolutely amazing, flavorful, unique and the sauces were out of this world! Looking forward to  the grand opening of this restaurant in LA!

High / over rated restaurant don't recommend. Well if you don't know where to go you can maybe try here. Everyone have own taste butt!!! But if your foodies looking after chefs own restaurant person. I Don't Recommend!!!! Good luck hope this review will help someone!

Yes, I did eat pig face.  Honest.  And it was delicious.

This is their famous dish and, I guess, they take meat from the cheek of the pig, and grill it up like carnitas with a crispy edge and fatty texture.  It was excellent, served like corned beef hash with a sunny side up egg on top and some veggies below.  Very flavorful and tasty.

The layout of the restaurant was beautiful and very rustic.  Tons of people around a gorgeous bar waiting for tables.  Exceptional service, too.  We also tried the beet salad which was awesome.  The grilled baby octopus was unique and just delicious.  These dishes, like tapas, are made for sharing.

One of the coolest places and best meals I have eaten in Chicago.
I love coming here with my family.  The food and service never disappoints. If you are looking for unique and delicious you must stop on at Girl & the Goat.

I have been here 4 or 5 times now and this is my third updated review.

The food is all fabulous. Some of the best flavors you can get. My cousin literally died and went to heaven with each course.

Recommendations: Pig face, goat empenadas, chickpea fritters, cauliflower, tongue.

All of the meat is beyond tender and perfect. Stephanie Izzard is a god!

You must make a reservation and  make it far in advance. I highly recommend you go with a party of 4 or more. The tables for 2 are very crammed together and it can be unpleasant. The food is also all made for sharing so if you go with a larger group, you can try more!

I am so disappointed that our experience at Girl & the Goat was not mind blowingly amazing! We may not have ordered the "must get" items, which influenced the experience for sure. By the time we got a 8:45 PM reservation on a Sunday night, there were some items on the menu that were sold out. The menu is super easy to follow and splits up items by vegetable, protein, and seafood type!

+ SQUASH BLOSSOM "crab rangoon" accompanied with chive yogurt and almonds was a great vegetable dish. The squash was fried to a crisp yet soft on the inside while it melted in your mouth!
+ JOHNNY APPLESEED bread accompanied with apple sauce and cheese & apple butter was a great starter to our entree.

~ GOAT BELLY // CRAB & LOBSTER: The dish is presented in a pool of butter that is accompanied with a small piece of goat belly, a couple pieces of shredded crab, and like two pieces of lobster. I was not impressed by this dish at all, since it seemed like a more significant amount of protein would be presented!
~ DUCK TONGUES with tuna and black bean poke along with crispy wontons was just confusing. The duck tongue was fried to a crisp, almost exactly like the crispy wontons, which made it confusing as to what you were actually eating in each bite. There was little to no difference between the duck, tuna, and wontons.
~ GOAT EMPANADAS were accompanied with miso & blue cheese aioli along with a squash-apple slaw, but I honestly could not tell the difference from normal empanadas!

Although I was not super impressed with the food, the staff including the waitress and waiters were flawless and impeccable. They are so well trained and are highly skilled in the field of hospitality!

We made a reservation weeks ago and visited this past Sunday. The service is excellent and the food even better! The open pig face was probably my favorite but I also liked the avocado short rib, the cocateli pasta and the empanada. This was our second visit and there will definitely be a third!!

Came her for dinner since Au Cheval had a 3 hour wait. Was so pleasently surprised. There Patty melt slayyyeedd me and their potato side dish (can't remember it's name) was even better. I would honestly just go back for the potato alone. It's expensive but if you do a little research you can figure out what's worth it for the bang of your buck.

Also try their chicken and waffles, so filling and so high quality!

Man, made reservations a month ago and last night we were finally able to see what this place is all about. Was it worth it? I'd say so! We were also very fortunate to be seated at one of the attached bar tables with a clear view of the kitchen. It was very fun to watch them all in action, preparing everyone's meals.

We ended up ordering 5 plates to share between two people. The first dish that I have to mention is their wood oven roasted pig face. Sounded intimidating at first, but the meat was so tender and flavorful. It also came with an egg on top. So they basically won me over on that as well.

Since the restaurant is called girl and the GOAT, I knew I had to get a dish with goat in it. It's usually one of my rules to order something if it's in the restaurant's name. My boyfriend and I decided on the goat carpaccio and goat empanadas. They were the best two dishes of the night.

We also got the escargot ravioli, which had a bacon tamarind sauce. It was delightful but nothing too memorable. Seriously, don't miss out on their vegetables. The roasted cauliflower were so good. The mint, pine nuts, and pickled peppers are a wonderful combination.

Girl and the Goat definitely lives up to the hype. I would love to dine here again if it wasn't so difficult to get a table. I can see why it's easily one of the best restaurants to eat at in Chicago. Be sure you make reservations ahead of time if you're planning to visit, you wouldn't want to miss out on this place!

Located just west of the core, Girl and the Goat was a top restaurant for me in Chicago. They were fully booked on a Sunday night but we managed to get reservations for 10:30pm. It was still a packed restaurant when we arrived. Service and atmosphere were all standard for me. The food is however very much a highlight.

Roasted Broccoli - 5/5: This was actually my favourite dish the entire night. Definitely the best broccoli I've ever had

Grilled Shrimp - 4.5/5: Kind of Thai inspired. Great flavorus

Goat Belly - 4.5/5: Sitting in melted butter with lobster and crab on the side. This was fantastic. It's a small portion

Pig Face - 4.5/5: Super fatty and with the egg, it's a unique dish

Pork Shank - 4/5: Comes with a pita and some sauces, braised well.

Overall, I'd recommend and come back!

Damn how did I even manage to snag a reservation within a week?

If I'm gonna go big during my trip to Chicago, it's gotta be here. How does this place have so many reviews let alone 4.5 stars??? Must be good! Thanks to my good friend for the recommendation, I came here with a couple friends for a later dinner at 10pm. Now don't be confused with the goat diner across the street. It's okay I made the same mistake, but the actual restaurant is right across the street. Walk on inside, and everything is dimly lit. It's like a warehouse feel, but don't let that confuse you about the quality of their dishes. Portions are small though.

As recommended by our amazing waitress, we had the roasted cauliflower, duck tongues, wood oven roasted pig face, goat belly with lobster, goat empanadas, and crisp braised pork shank. To accompany our food, we also ordered a bottle of Italian wine (I forget the name), and it tasted great.

1) Roasted cauliflower: (5/5)
As you eat this, be sure to grab all the ingredients together for a bite because the cauliflower just isn't as tasty without the pine nuts and pieces underneath.

2) Duck tongues: (3/5)
Hmm I've had fried pig ears taste just like this with the same texture so not amazing, but still tasty nonetheless.

3) Wood Oven Roasted Pig Face: (5/5)
Wow this is new. It's basically eating cheek, and it's great. Crispy on the outside, soft on the inside.

4) Goat Belly with Lobster: (2/5) - As much as I like belly and lobster, the sauce just didn't go well with the meat. The sauce was too sweet and contrasted too much with the savoriness.

5) Goat Empanadas: (3/5)
For some reason, these were on the house, which was very kind of the restaurant. But empanadas are empanadas; they tasted okay to me.

6) Crisp Braised Pork Shank: (4/5)
Meat literally slides off the bone, I was so amazed. Tasted great, but this dish made us all really full for some reason beside the fact that it was the 6th dish of the night.

Would I come back? Most definitely.

Oh where to begin. This place makes my heart so happy. I finally got to go here, as this place has been on the top of my Chicago Food Bucket List for ages now. It didn't disappoint.

The atmosphere is classy but welcoming. It's loud without being cacophonous, and it's crowded without being frustrating. The servers were very knowledgeable and kind, and our water or plates were changed in perfect timing. I was impressed.

We started off with cocktails. I ordered an "All Becomes One" - gin, violet, absinthe, aloe vera, earl grey crema, and lemon. It was floral and refreshing, and I really enjoyed it. My sister had a Putting on the Spritz- vodka, aperol, pamplemousse rose, lemon, grapefruit tonic, and sparkling wine. It was very grapefruity and went down smooth.

Girl and the Goat is a restaurant that has small plates. Wait staff recommended that we get 4 or 5 plates to share to start, so that's what we did. The first one to come out was the duck tongues, which were served with piri piri on top of an ahi blackbean poke with crispy wontons on top. This was easily my favorite plate of the night. The tongues are fried and crispy, with a nice salt. They're something that I could eat all day long (never thought I'd say that about tongues but here we are!). The poke underneath it was beautiful. Everything was clean and fresh, and the spice from the sauce balanced the ahi, and with the crisp of the wontons and tongues? Perfection.

After that, we moved on to escargot ravioli, served with a bacon tamarind sauce, escarole, celery, and topped with crispy onions. The plating was gorgeous. The sauce was pretty thin, and there was a lot of it, to the point it seemed more like a broth. It was good though, with thick cubes of bacon. The ravioli was perfectly cooked, but the escargot fell a bit flat. I wouldn't have been able to tell you that's what's in there, if I didn't already know. But, it was a tasty dish nonetheless, and I ate all of them.

Then we got the sautéed green beans, my sister's favorite dish. They're prepared in a fish sauce vinaigrette with onion and cashews. I thought my sister was weird for insisting we get these, because, all this food to pick from and you pick green beans? But, I get it. They were perfectly cooked, with the right amount of snap. They were salty and seasoned and the cashews gave nice crunch. Also, you get a LOT of them, it's a very generous portion for small plates. We took the rest home.

Moving on, we then received the one, the only famous Girl and the Goat wood oven roasted pig face. (Cue the Homer Simpson drooling). It was outstanding. It's served with a sunny side up egg, red wine-maple, and crispy potatoes strings. Oh man, it's like breakfast but grown up for foodies. The sauce had just the right amount of sweetness, the rich yolk from the egg covered everything in a dose of extra-deliciousness. The pig face itself was well seasoned and rich, something similar to pork belly but dare I say better.

Then we got to the actual goat, confit goat belly to be exact. It's served with a vanilla butter with lobster and crab (Note: menu online says bourbon, but we were told vanilla). I actually didn't care for this at all, and I'm disappointed that our last dish was the least enjoyed, and that the goat (for which the place is name) was the one to disappoint. The goat belly itself was nice, but the vanilla butter sauce that was covering it was not. Vanilla and pork is weird. Vanilla and goat is weird. Vanilla and goat and fish is a mistake. The sauce on its own was fine. The crab was really good. The lobster was overcooked, and on top of that I crunched down on a rather nasty piece of shell.

But, we ordered dessert, so that makes it better. We shared the caramel corn & malt balls, which consists of vanilla malt gelato, popcorn caramel,  chocolate magic shell, and caramel corn. I thought this was a pretty good way to nod to Chicago (Garrett's and all). The caramel corn was well coated and delicious. The gelato was creamy and rich, as it should be. The caramels were super soft and addicting, and my favorite part of the plate. And then the ice cream was topped with magic shell chocolate topping. I love Iron Chef Izard even more now for using shell (if it ain't broke....).

Our total was something to the tune of 130$, reasonable for the location and quality.
