I'd eat this meal every day if I could. Overall, great experience at Girl and the Goat. I'd also be interested in trying the diner across the street!
It lives up to the hype! I still dream about the green beans. Delicious food, great service, gorgeous atmosphere, and in such a fun spot in West Loop!

I've been dying to go here. Came all the way from CA to make sure I could eat at this restaurant and I guarantee you, ITS SO WORTH IT!!! Ordered the ring of fire, what a lovely cocktail. My boyfriend ordered the salt and ash which has a real kick to it so be aware! Hamachi crudo was really light and flavorful . Seared scallops were to die for. Why couldn't there be more than just two scallops! Roasted pork cheek was delicious and very rich. That green sauce on it was what made the entire dish really bright in flavor. And for dessert, malted vanilla ice cream with this salted caramel popcorn. All I can say is, I want an entire bag of that popcorn. Amazing meal, amazing service too! Staff is really
Friendly, super attentive and really fast. Couldn't have asked for a better experience. Decor and atmosphere of the restaurant is really cool too. Modern and rustic all together. Must visit!!!!!

It is no wonder this place has over 6000 reviews with a 4.5 star rating. First of all, we were super lucky because we were able to get a last minute reservation through open table. Likely a last minute cancellation because when i looked a couple days before our arrival in Chicago, the open table app was directing me to reservations months later!

Loved the atmosphere. Not at all pretentious for such a delicious and popular restaurant. The server we had was knowledgable, made great recommendations, and attentive without being annoying.

The food was amazing. We ordered 5 small plates for two of us, and actually even was brought out a bonus one by our server. We ended up having the green beans, duck tongue, squash blossum crab rangoon, big face, halibut, and goat empanadas. all delicious. the halibut was great, but of the 6 we had probably the least special. We are from Seattle so can get fresh halibut easily - don't get us wrong, it was still amazing and we didn't leave a bite.

Definitely include this restaurant on your must try while in Chicago. And apparently if you don't get a reservation - recommend showing up early and going to the bar. Full menu available there.

My meal at Girl and the Goat was the best meal of my life. There wasn't a dish I didn't enjoy. You must get the open pig face - it's one of the best things on the menu!! I was also brave and tried goat.  I was pleasantly surprised with the confit goat belly. I absolutely loved the meal and even hot to see chef Stephanie working with her great staff. Book well in advance as reservations are tough!
This is our go to spot when it's just my husband and I. Love the Bay Salmon and grilled Pork Belly. The only thing I wished they improved on was having a more robust dessert menu.

It's difficult to put in words how amazing the food was and the service was incredible as well. Our server made suggestions and we followed most of what she recommended. We had duck tongue, escargot ravioli, green beans, goat empanadas, garlic pierogies, and crispy pork shank. That was more than enough food, but we indulged in dessert as well. I cannot recommend this restaurant high enough. Thank you Devon for the amazing service and recommendations! Everything was unique and delicious!

I somehow managed to score a 5:00PM reservation one week prior (the next available was in late July). Thank you to whoever cancelled! My husband and I ate here once 5 years ago and felt the food was overhyped and mediocre. I decided I wanted to try this place one more time to see if it was just a fluke, especially since Stephanie Izard is the only Top Chef-Iron Chef in the world! And yes, GATG has definitely redeemed itself.

FOOD:
-- Sweet n' spicy brioche: 4/5. Loved the honey sambal butter and spring lamby jam spreads that came with the brioche. Perfect bread appetizer to start with!
-- Lamb tartare: 2.5/5. Unfortunately too salty for both me and my husband. Definitely needs to be eaten with the lavish that comes with it. Favorite parts of the dish were the gochujang mayo and cracklings.
-- Pan roasted halibut: 5/5. My favorite dish of the night... I could probably order 2 of these and just call it a night. Perfectly cooked and incredibly delicious! Who knew that blueberry mixed with nuoc cham would taste so good with halibut?!
-- Goat empanadas: 5/5. My husband's favorite. Everything worked SO well together... this dish was perfection. They aren't skimpy with the goat filling either! I could definitely eat these every week.
-- Lamb ribs: 3.5/5. I didn't really like them as much because they were just too fatty for me, but my carnivore fat-loving husband loved them. It was extremely flavorful and tender.

SERVICE:
Extremely friendly, very helpful and happy to make suggestions. You get your food quick, which we appreciated since we were starving!

AMBIANCE:
Definitely casual. Industrial looking, with a loft kind of style. Tables are a bit too close together and I'm pretty sure the couple next to us heard everything we said.

First the famous "Pig Face" wasn't that good for me, it's good but not as I expected(maybe I had similar things else where), but I really really loved other dishes, like the raw oyster, short ribs, goat cheese cake!  I would love to give 4.5 stars: for its long reservation on the waiting list(3 weeks ahead) and even when we arrived on time, we still waited another 20-30 minute  for our table.
Overall, it's a good dining experience and would definitely go back!

What can I say that hasn't been said other than, "eat the goat!"
I made one small mistake here. I went with Chicken...of all things, chicken. It was fantastic! They did a great job making chicken as special and you can. After I already had my food I thought to myself. "This place is called Girl & the Goat, I should be eating goat."
The place is busy, staff was pleasant, nothing to complain about. Highly recommended.

Great great great great place! The service is impeccable and the food is absolute delicious. I was in Chicago for business and found myself here..not far from my hotel. To be warned it's small plates. I would recommend ordering 2-3 plays to get full. They do have goat...I stayed clear of meats and ordered seafood and vegetables. All in all the music was good, the food was great and I was even "treated" to a dessert. Gooooooo!

How can I not give 5 stars? It really is worth the hype. Even as a vegetarian -- the food is phenomenal (chickpea fritters!!). Service is excellent. Reservations are hard to come by and have to be made in advance, but grabbing a seat at the bar and ordering there is a good move. Since the food is served tapas style, you can order as little or as much as you'd like and there is great flexibility for the number of people in your group and varying dietary needs.

We celebrated a special night with friends from out of town. Our hopes were high. We were not disappointed. Our server took such great care of us, as if we were regulars. She even delivered an extra plate of the AMAZING green beans that we missed ordering, so we wouldn't miss out. Spot on!  Among other items, we had calamari bruschetta, goat empanadas, braised lamb ribs, & braised pork shank.

The food is great.  The ambience is incredible.  The service is excellent, and the price is certainly reasonable.

Took two months to get in but it was worth it. Great food and service. The cocktails in the lounge were excellent. Casual, cool decor and high energy. It was a psychological hurdle to order the duck tongues, but would recommend them. Tasted sort of like tender crispy fried clams. Food is family style so its best if you go with people you feel comfortable with so you don't feel guilty about taking that last bite!

Made a reservation and was seated promptly. Service was excellent. My sister and I ordered five dishes total to share (including dessert) and were perfectly full after. Each dish was brought out one by one.

1. Ham frites - you can never go wrong with french fries! Wonderfully crisp and seasoned well. Comes with two dipping sauces, the creamy white one wasn't very good, but the yellow (cheesy?) one was great!

2. Roasted beets - tasted fine! Nothing too special, but I enjoyed it more as a side to accompany my protein. Which brings me to...

3. Goat empanadas - I had never eaten goat prior to this, i was worried about the texture being gamey, but it wasn't! Tasted pretty similar to beef and we enjoyed it!

4. Wood oven roasted pig face (or something like that?) - MUST TRY! This was extremely delicious. That's all you need to know.

5. I don't remember exactly what our dessert was called... some shiitake toffee gelato with chocolate cake? Sounded weird, but whatever it was, I fell in love with it after the first bite.

If I were to return, it would be for the pig face dish and the dessert I had.

I haven't been to Girl and The Goat in a while due to subpar experiences at Little Goat and Duck Duck Goat. I would not go back to those restaurants, but Girl and Goat does not disappoint. We had the chickpea fritters, seared diver scallops and grilled butter chicken. All items were very flavorful and the diver scallops were definitely the favorite. Our server was very friendly and helpful as well...a vast improvement to the awful service at Little Goat.  We finished up our meal with the Yay for Gjetost dessert. It was RIDICULOUSLY good! I would come back just for that.  The only thing that could make the experience better is lowering the noise level. It's very hard to hear any conversation. Overall though, this place is still great and I would come back!
Great food and great service. Just a little too noisy. Great options of dishes. Would love to come back.
Very tasty food, but kind of pricey for the portion of meals. I felt seats were too close to each other that you almost hear everything what other people at another table are saying.

So good. I literally cried when I tried the goat belly. Mike was our server he was great, made really good recommendations. Great menu with a lot to try and share between two people. Try something different you won't regret it!

This is one of those places that makes you like foods you don't typically enjoy because literally everything is incredible. From the atmosphere, to the service, to the food, my dining experience was flawless. I wish I remembered our server's name. He was attentive, friendly, and everything he recommended was great...although I suspect everything on the menu is.

We had the roasted cauliflower, seared diver scallops, crisp braised pork shank, goat empanadas, chocolate truffle cake, and two bottles of wine. I would recommend absolutely everything. The food is served family style, which I personally prefer.

The tab was fairly hefty, but no one comes in here for a quick bite. Anyway, I had a fabulous Tuesday evening. Will definitely return...perhaps after my next paycheck :)

Small plates for sharing. Amazing. We got the

Hamachi and pork GREAT
Cauliflower GREAT
Green beans GOOD
Shoulder YASSS AMAZING GET THIS (warning quite large)
Oysters (fresh, of course) GOOD
Belly GOOD
Ice cream thing with caramels ALRIGHT (I'm not really a dessert guy)

And some other stuff that I'll record when it comes back to me.
Came here for my friends birthday and i had a great time. My food was great and the vibe was awesome. They had really good music playing also. Definitely would return.

After hearing nearly everyone I know rave about Girl and the Goat, I came in for an early dinner on a weekday. I love Stephanie Izard's Little Goat Diner and had high hopes for this experience. The restaurant is gorgeous and has a farmhouse/industrial feel with the wood floors and ceiling accented by industrial lighting. There is a variety of seats, from bar stools to standard tables to a lounge space with couches and candles in hurricane vases that adds a bit of swank to the space. You can make reservations through the website (girlandthegoat.com), which is strongly encouraged. At 4:45pm, the restaurant was already filling up! My dad and I walked in and sat at the bar, which is first come first served, and had a glass of wine (although the creative cocktails and rotating craft beers were hard to pass up!). We ordered food based on the bartender's recommendations and were not disappointed! We indulged on the wood oven roasted pig face (don't let the name frighten you), ham frites, beef short ribs, and crisp braised pork shank. All were outstanding. The menu is expansive so I'm looking forward to returning to try some other dishes.

I went in expecting every dish to be amazing and 5-star worthy and was actually a little disappointed. Our dinner that night was extensive and a mix of 3-5 star dishes:

5 Stars:
Calamari bruschetta: This was perfection - really tender calamari that paired well with the goat milk ricotta and goat bacon. They serve it on two larges pieces of baguette that is easy enough to share.
Goat empanadas: Surprisingly, one of my favorites. The empanadas were full of flavor and the aioli and slaw really brightened them up. Sad though that it was only two tiny empanadas in one serving.

4 Stars:
Duck tongues: The tongue was crispy and had a good flavor; everything in the dish blended well together
Crispy Beef Short Ribs: Really good flavor and perfect cook on the short ribs
Crisp Braised Pork Shank: This was our big meat dish that was good, but not particularly memorable.
Bacon/Gouda Bread: Nice crispy outer edge and soft bacon and cheesy center. Good!

3 Stars:
Hamachi crudo: The hamachi had a good citrus flavor and the crispy pork belly addition was nice, but the fish itself was extremely thin cut. Really not worth the roughly $4 a bite.
Pig face: I don't think I understand the hype on this one. The pork was fine - tender, yes, but nothing special.
Confit goat belly: There was a lot of exciting things going on here with bourbon butter and lobster/crab...In the end though, i didn't feel like the goat was particularly tasty and the dish didn't seem to come together as it was meant to.

All in all, I thought the food was good, but certainly not the best I've had in Chicago. Since we're in Chicago so rarely, I probably wont be back but can definitely recommend the goat empanadas and calamari bruschetta!

We had a group for five for a Thursday night dinner. Everything was just super. Surprising to me (and for me) I may have loved the veggies the most. The beet salad with the anchovy was an unexpected taste treat. The green beens were exactly as they should be. Cauliflower was roasted just right    I had the bucatini and the pasta was correctly al Dente with a filling sauce. The beef tongue was not my favorite but it never is - still a guest wanted it and they loved it. A great dinner and a great time. I will book now for my next visit.

Came in on a Tuesday night when it wasn't too busy, and we were sat right away. I absolutely loved the atmosphere and the restaurant itself is just beautiful. Service was great and not too intrusive. Was a little upset about the beer menu, they didn't really have any good craft beers on tap (just my preference). Would totally recommend the sautéed green beans and also the grilled butter chicken. Cannot wait to come back for a second time!

Talk about flavor town!!! Really great food here. The service is exquisite as well as the atmosphere. What a treat it was to get in especially with no reservations, we were honestly lucky. Thank you kind hostess for letting us experience this.

Will definitely be back to the Goat .

pics.caption: One of the last people out the door. Lol

review.des:
I've come here a few times with a few different groups of people and the food is always solid, but I've found that the number of dishes I think are 5-star-worthy varies depending on the season.  That being said, they certainly do a good job keeping the menu in season with fresh local items making many appearances in their menu.  A few highlights:
- Goat empanadas: We've had these a couple of times.  Once with a blueberry sauce and once a few weeks ago with mushrooms.  both times, the empanadas were baked and full of tender goat meat.  Not at all oily or greasy.
- Pig face: If you like the pig ear/kale dish at Purple Pig, you'll be a fan of this dish too.  Don't worry- it doesn't look like a face.
- Pork Shank: Comes right off the bone and is served with a buttermilk dressing and grilled kimchee that you can put onto naan.  The servers always tell us this is more like 2 full dishes, and they're right!
- Calamari Bruschetta- off the winter menu- this was a favorite amongst my friends.  The clam baguette is topped with creamy ricotta, goat bacon, and apples for a tart, creamy, salty, crunchy, delicious bite!

Always super fast service, knowledgeable and friendly wait staff, and unique combinations of food!

I don't know how much more there is to say when a restaurant has over 6,000 reviews with almost five stars. I will touch on some things that are not the food first (then onto the food because I am a picky diner/eater).

AMBIANCE- when you walk in you will see a host stand and a very open space with tables to the right, bar and lounge seating to the left. There were three hosts standing behind the stand and were nice and said we could sit in the lounge and wait for our table. We arrived at 7PM and our reservation was 7:15PM. There were seats available in the lounge for the three in my party and we ordered a drink. Within the fifteen minutes our table was ready we closed out the drink tab and headed to our table. We sat at a table close to the front of the restaurant. It was very chilly and the waitress was accommodating to get us moved. We only moved one table over but it made a difference. I assume if they don't have the air blaring it gets warm. I did like our seat but maybe next time I would like to go to the back to be closer to the partly open kitchen.

I have a bit of an issue when I go to a restaurant and it is loud. I was shocked this was not the case with Girl and the Goat. It was easy to have nice conversation and could hear the waitress perfectly.

The bathrooms are in the basement. It was not super hard to get to, but I am recovering from a knee injury so I thought I would point this out. I went to the bathroom two times and never had to wait. They are individual unisex bathrooms- clean, good lighting, nice mirror.

SERVICE- on to the waitress, she was nice. very informative, filled drinks/water, etc. We often received new plates per dishes and everything was prompt.

FOOD- Goat Empanadas; Cauliflower; Halibut; Pig Face; Confit Goat Belly; Pork Shank.
If you like empanadas you will like them here. There are only two in an order. my only complaint :)
Cauliflower- I did not want to get because I hate pine nuts, and honestly I wanted to get more real food on the menu than a vegetable. If you like cauliflower a little bit, get it. It is cooked perfectly, the Parmesan (?) on top is great and if you don't like pine nuts. push them off to the side.
Halibut- I love fish- i love my fish plain. So if you like fish you will like this dish because it is so much more than fish.  This fish is not plain. It is crisp on the outside. Perfectly cooked. It comes with an almond butter sauce. so good.
Pig Face- I read the review, get the pig face, get the pig face....it was good...I mean I don't have dreams about this dish but it was tasty. I would eat it again
Confit Goat Belly- do not get if you don't like lemon. I did not love this dish because it had a hint of lemon it in.
Pork Shank- now this is an item to have dreams about. This is the item you would save all your calories during the day to eat at night. I am not a fan of pork, but this pork shank comes out looking like a turkey leg, you get it and your like wow fried pork, but no it is so much more than that. It falls right off the bone, it comes with naan (who doesn't like carbs with their meat) and the buttermilk dressing and buffalo like sauce (?) to dip your meat in. Pretty tasty.

I waited 3 months for my reservation and it was exciting to finally experience what everyone says is so amazing. I had a nice time. Now I have eaten at all of Chef Stephanie Izard restaurants. All different. All Amazing. Never change Chef Stephanie :)

This restaurant is fantastic! We had a group of 8 and they served us family style, which was perfect because we got to try everything. I have a severe peanut allergy, which they were very attentive to. Excellent food, and they are able to customize the dishes to your table's allergies and preferences.

Good service
Everything was salty
Cauliflower so salty we had to return it
Pirogis a tiny serving for a big price
Lamb ribs tasty and fatty
Calamari rubbery
Desserts not tempting enough to place an order

Bring back the halibut and empanadas!!!! I know it's not blueberry season but you can't deprive the people of the halibut.

Anyway, I made a reservation for 11 about a month in advance because literally that was the only time to make a reservation. My boyfriend and I showed up at 10:15 and ended up sitting at the bar until 11. Which, is fine we didn't expect them to seat us right away. It's nearly impossible to find a seat at the bar because people actually eat dinner there! But, when it comes to sitting in very determined to sit so I had one in 10 minutes. The cocktails and drinks were great. The bartenders aren't hard to flag down even though they're taking so many orders and making so many drinks it once. It literally looks like they have 10 hands with the amount of work they do! Major props to the bar staff!

When we were seated we noticed a change in menu. Alright, I get it change in season but still disheartening because I still dream of that halibut. We ordered there sautéed green beans, wood oven roasted pig face, escargot ravioli, and their calamari bruschetta. I was excited to try their green beens yet again! They were the same as I remember and it's a staple item to order. I didn't know green beans could taste so good!! Their calamari bruschetta was perfect. The toast they used perfectly soaked up all the sauces. The escargot ravioli sounded really interesting and it didn't taste weird as I thought it would. The bacon sauce and crispy onions made is really flavorful! Their pig face is a staple item for brunch. The pig face came when I went to the bathroom. I came back and my boyfriend only left me one bite... So that might answer if it was good or not. That one bite did make me think that it was more appropriate for brunch though but it was still very delicious. It made me interested in what they are like for brunch.

I can't wait to come back here! This place is a tradition of whenever I come to Chicago! Although, be sure to book a month or more in advance if you want a normal day or time.

Reservations required well in advance. This is a shared plate experience and every dish we tried was outstanding.

We made reservations over a month in advance and the only seating available was 11:30pm. Pretty crazy that they even have full dinner service that late.

We arrived on time and hit the bar for a few minutes while the table was prepped. The interior is impressive, dark lighting with dark wood and exposed rafters. It is one giant, high-ceilinged room but is broken up nicely into different partitions.

Once seated, the menu looked focused and inspired with everything worthy of ordering. The setup is sort of like tapas, or shared small plates. Our server suggested we shoot for about 4 items, 2 per person. The bread and butter were phenomenal - exceptional really [A+]. Wood- grilled broccoli was similarly outstanding [A+] - this was my wife's favorite. We did an octopus as well as a beef heart dish that were delicious. The confit goat belly with lobster and crab was an interesting mix that surprisingly worked very well. Decadent in every way.

Our service was very good throughout the evening. I think it was certainly worth the hype. I would return in a heartbeat.

Hands down - one of my favorite restaurants in the city!  The restaurant is beautifully decorated and the food shines!

Plan accordingly - if you want to eat during main dining hours, make sure you have a reservation.  Reservations go fast and often, only times after 9:30PM are available.  Try to plan your reservation several weeks, if not months, ahead.  I've been lucky to get in as a walk-in on several occasions though.  Also have been lucky to call the day off to see if there were any cancellations.

There is nothing bad on the menu.  Be adventurous and open minded - each dish has tons of flavor!  Menu is seasonal, but a constant mainstay is the Pig face:  You have to try it!  Everyone talks about it after they visit the restaurant.  It is memorable!

I'm sure the desserts are delicious, but I've always walked over to Little Goat for dessert instead.

A must-try for tourists (and TBH, there are always a ton of tourists when I go), but locals rave of this place - which is how you know it's the real deal!

By far, the most delicious dining experience in a verrrrrry long time.

Green beans were tastiest - an umami flavor that kept you chomping through the entire meal on these tasty veggies.

Grilled baby octopus-  The flavors that came from that dish were sooooooo incredible; briney and charred with a sweet smokey flavor...

The Goat ribs were "slap your mama" tasty  I mean, fall off the bone tender and the flavor was so rich and complex.

The pork shank was out of this world...

Could not finish all the dishes and ended up taking home a couple of items, so be warned; they say to order 4-5 dishes to share btwn two - I would recommend 3-4. We were hungry, and we still took two dishes home.

pics.caption: Sample of broccoli - they were very generous

review.des:
It is unlikely that I'll be able to add anything new to the million phenomenal reviews this place gets, but it deserves every. single. one.

The food and service here are unparalleled.  I've had the good fortune to eat here a handful of times, and, for me, it's consistently one of the best meals in Chicago.  

Stephanie Izard and her team have an understanding of flavor/texture that surprises, wows and satisfies in every single dish.  Although I love them all, there's a special place in my heart (stomach?) for the chickpea fritter and the braised pork shank.  I would eat the sauce that accompanies that pork shank anywhere, anytime, on any other food.  It is sooooo goooood.

The service is always helpful and top-notch.  These are servers who really know their stuff, not just people slinging out plates of food.

I love going here for an intimate date, I love going here with a group of 12.  It's just the best!!!

Hands down one of the best dining experiences both atmosphere and food-wise that I've ever had!

We accidentally thought we had made brunch reservations (they don't serve brunch) and showed up at 11:30am. The hostess kindly told us that those reservations were for 11:30pm, but to try to come back right as the restaurant was opening at 4:30pm to try to snag a seat. It was busy when we walked in, but we found a nook in the lounge area and were told we were able to dine there! It was a great decision.

The waitstaff was so friendly and accommodating even in the unconventional seating space. We were able to engage with others or keep to ourselves, but half the fun was talking amongst the other groups and see what everyone else was ordering. We started with the focaccia (warm and flavorful) and continued with the chickpea fritters. ORDER THE CHICKPEA FRITTERS. They are unexpectedly light and robust in flavor- a must have!

We continued with delicious cocktails- the ring of fire is like a spicy margarita and it did not disappoint. We continued with the cauliflower which is a staple there and perfectly seasoned and cooked. Our next dish was the shrimp which was light and delicious with a little kick. Our two meats were the short rib and bucatini (pasta)- both unbelievable and satisfying.

I would not miss out on dessert. The pavlova was the most interesting (looking and tasting) thing I've ever had. I've never eaten a dessert with that depth of flavor- I still have dreams about it!

Go to Girl and the Goat! You will not regret it.
Ate here yesterday with some friends. The food was really good although a little pricey in my opinion. Would definitely consider going back
Truly a amazing dining experience all around. Four stars for customer service. This place does not disappoint, with interesting and delicious dishes, combined with remarkable, very friendly service.
Sunday Funday Brunch here with friends - easy in and easy out - food was good - atmosphere was festive - can't wait to go again.

Popular but not delicious, spirit is better than dish. It only opens from evening till late night. The light is dark at night and the noise is moderate. Prepare to book two week in advance to make sure you have a comfortable dinner time.
So good. So worth it. Food is slap your mama good. The joint is classy so business casual or dressy work. Def make a reservation or you will be waiting for a long time.

My favorite spot in Chicago!  Drinks tend to be on the sweeter side, so I'd recommend sticking with the wine selection, but the food is delicious and the chef is so creative!  Another pointer I would make is to book the reservation a few weeks in advance. 5 stars, for certain!

I heard so many good things about Girl & the Goat. It is owned by the 1st female Top Chef Winner Stephanie Izard - so my expectations were raised right there. Reservations are really hard to get. I was lucky to land one on a Sunday night at 945pm - nothing earlier and I was looking about 2 months ahead! My GF and I were celebrating a special occasion, so I noted that on the OpenTable reservation.

We got there on time and got seated 10min after. We were told that we could either be seated immediately or wait 10min for the "best seat in the house". We waited and we were mind blown. We were seated right in front of the cooking line! We literally saw the chefs cut, cook, bake, fry, prep, plate, season and complete dishes which was a very unique experience! Definitely a great start to our meal. I also loved how every chef in the line greeted us and had a smile the entire time. One thing that will always stick with me is the girl yelling "NADAS!" whenever an Empanada order was ready.

Roasted Cauliflower - pickled peppers. pine nuts. mint: This was probably the best cauliflower dish I've had and I'm not a fan of cauliflower. Every bite was perfect and flavorful.

Chickpea Fritter - garam masala yogurt. heirloom tomato. stonefruit. sheep's feta: The best way to describe this dish is fried hummus blocks. The fritters were perfectly fried - very light and not oily - and the inside had a hummus like texture. The tomato gave it the acidic touch it needed to cut into the richness of the fritter. Feta cheese gave it a nice saltiness. I loved this dish.

Seared Diver Scallops - peaches. sweet onion. plums. pickled corn. mustard greens. uni cream: My least favorite dish of the night. It wasn't bad, but it wasn't as great as the rest. Scallops were cut into small pieces, mixed with some pasta and served to us. They say it was uni cream sauce, but I was not able to taste uni at all.

Ham Frites - smoked tomato aioli. cheddar beer sauce: Fancy fries. Lol.

Wood Oven Roasted Pig Face - sunny side egg. tamarind. cilantro. red wine-maple. potato stix: This is a MUST GET dish here. Pig face?! Yes. Pig Face. You don't get the actual pig face. My guess is that they use the pigs face meat to elaborate this complex and delicious dish. The meat was crispy, fatty and tender. It melted in my mouth. The runny egg yolk gave it a creaminess that went well with the dish. Ugh I WANT THIS RIGHT NOW.

Miso-Butterscotch budino - sesame gelato. sesame whip. glazed pineapple: Dessert on the house. I appreciate the gesture. Who doesn't like free ice cream?! Budino is more like pudding. It was sweet and salty and it went extremely well with the gelato.

I definitely recommend this place. If you cannot make reservations, try walking-in early when they open. Its worth it. Food is amazing and service is super friendly. Our waiter always check up on us and described every dish thoroughly.

Good food and service, a bit pricy for what you get though...
Parking is almost impossible so recommend Uber or Lyft.

One of the most delicious meals you will ever have! I have been here twice now, the first time it took 2 months to make a reservation, and the last time I got lucky and there was a 6:30 availability on a Tuesday!

The waitress recommends 4 to 5 dishes for 2 people to get full, but this is absolutely not true, 3 dishes for 2 people is plenty. So look into getting about 1.5 a person.

The pig cheek is the best dish! So delicate and flavorful meat.

Chickpeas fritter is absolutely delicious.

Goat belly is nothing compared to pork belly, no layers of fat, sooo goood.

Honestly no food recommendations are really necessary because everything you'll get is amazing.

Service is always spot on. They ask about food allergies, and even have a fully dairy free menu. The atmosphere is very cool and upbeat, get ready for a louder room.

The meal will always be pricier, expect to spend at least $50 a person after tax and tip if you plan on getting full and having a drink, but its worth every penny.

MUST try, this is a Chicago staple.

Tons of hype about this place and it is completely worthy of it. I've been twice and both times blew my mind. I came with 3 people the first time and a large group the second time. I think a good number would be 4 so you all can share a variety of dishes. Make sure to book a month or 2 in advance if you want a normal dinner time.

I was blown away by my experience at the Girl & the Goat. It's hard to get a reservation here, so I showed up at 4:25 and got on the walk in list. They seated me and my friend side by side at a communal table, which was a beautiful farm table. We shared a bunch of plates & each one was delicious. The roasted cauliflower was the best vegetable dish I've ever had. At the end of dinner we ordered mint tea, which came in huge mugs and was the perfect end to this epic meal. I would absolutely come back to this restaurant.

pics.caption: Roasted Cauliflower: best vegetable dish I've ever eaten, tasted like pasta
Octopus: mint and yogurt sauce was great

review.des: Just another celebrity joint serving standard American fare. Slightly overpriced, but gives you a descent experience.

Tonight I was able to dine at the #1 hottest restaurant in Chi.  Unfortunately, I went with a co-worker with very tame tastes, so was not able to try some of their more famous and best dishes like smoked goat ribs and wood oven roasted pig face.  However, what we did have was pretty good.

The place was much bigger than i expected, given that I heard it was always packed.  I made reservations 2 weeks in advance for 5:30 on a weds night to avoid the crowds.  Glad we did, as by 6 it jammed packed and lots of folks waiting.

We ordered:

Brown butter bread with nut and fruit tapenade = very good

Ham frites with smoked tomato aioli and cheese beer dip = fries were just fries with a tiny bit of ham salt.  Beer cheese was just ok.  The smoked aioli was amazing though

Grilled marinated pork belly = ugh - skip this.  Just soggy bacon with little baby green on top and a very odd tasting green sauce.  Was expecting a nice cube of crispy pork belly.

Sauted green beand with fish sauce and cashews = surprisngly good

Sweet potato blue cheese pierogi = very, very tasty, but they were deep fried, not steamed as periogi usually are

Milk stout pana cotta = It was very tasty, but not at all a panna cotta.  It was very much a mousse

pics.caption: Marinated and "grilled" pork belly.  (It was cooked, but totally soggy.  I recommend skipping this)

review.des: Perfect tapas style food! Delightful and light every dish leaves your tastebuds tingling for more! If you don't want to wait and forgot to get a reservation show up a little before dinner time! The service is amazing and the drinks are delectable! I love going to the girl and the !
Definitely worth the hype!! Can't wait to go back to try some other dishes. The cauliflower and beet salad were my favorite dishes of the night.

Super awesome food, went here for my birthday and boy it was worth the wait.. they have limited veg options but everything we tried from olive focaccia to roasted cauliflower, was delicious.. the desserts were like cherry on the cake ...we are still drooling.. we got a complimentary dessert as well since it was my birthday.. definitely going back..

If you can't get reservations, you can try to queue up at the door as soon as they open and they can seat you with others doing the same or you can sit at the bar. Probably got better service at the bar!

Goat empanadas were AMAZING. The pork belly and green beans were also very delicious, but the saltiness grows and can get overwhelming, so try to eat with other dishes if possible. The blueberry bourbon baba was great but the bourbon is STRONG. My husband loves bourbon and said it was overwhelming for a dessert taste.
Great food and great customer service all the time - never fails me! This place is always busy and hard to get in but when you do get in, you're never disappointed!

Basically my issue was our server with this restaurant, which I will explain here shortly.

My hubby and another couple came in around 7 to put our name in for a reservation and were told after 10 would be the first available, which we knew and were find with.  I do like how they take your phone number to text you when your table is available! So a bit after 10 we came in and our table wasn't ready so we sat at the bar, which the service was excellent!
Then...
We were seated at our table with our waitress who was less then peachy keen.  Her main concern was flirting with the wait staff and ignoring our table.  She was very annoyed that we decided to only order 5 dishes to start off with instead of entire meal.  We were informed the plates were medium sized, which medium to me is clearly different then medium to her.... I would say small or extra small  
A couple dishes were okay, some were excellent, but that is to be expected.

Honestly, our waitress was such a buzz kill and so rude that it completely turned me off of this place which is unfortunate.

Went here with my parents for a special occasion and it was fantastic! We shared a variety of dishes (I remember the duck tongue and roasted cauliflower and peppers were a few favorites of min) and got some drinks (I got one called the ring of fire- delicious!). My mom doesn't eat much meat and was unsure about whether the vegetarian dishes would be as good (they sound very simple) but I remember us all being so surprised and impressed by how good they all tasted! we booked our reservation months in advance, and it was a pricy night out, but worth every penny. The seating and decor of the restaurant is also unique and conducive to a relaxing yet stimulating night out, and it's open super late, so no worries for late diners who like to take their time!

When my girlfriend and I planned our trip to Chicago one of the first things we did was attempt to get a reservation at Top Chef winner Stephanie Izard's Girl & the Goat! Fortunately we booked the trip about 3 months in advance so we were able to get a Sunday night reservation for 6 people without out TOO much trouble.

Honestly, there isn't much I can say about the place that hasn't been said already. When we got to the restaurant we were shown to our table immediately and were seated. The table was in a great place for people watching I might add - right at the front close to the front door which I love. The entire restaurant was very well lit. It wasn't like in your face bright and there was no mood lighting, it just had big windows, was sunlit and just very end of summer-ish if I can say that. It was lovely.

Before getting into the food I'll also point out that the service was top notch. Our waiter was very good about replacing our plates with clean ones, keeping water and drinks filled, and explaining any questions we had about the menu.

The 6 of us shared probably 9 dishes in all + a dessert at the end and that was definitely enough for everyone as the portion sizes were actually pretty substantial for sharing plates.

Things we ordered that I'd rate 3 or 4 out of 5:
-Some sort of pork kabob - (3 out of 5) - Don't remember much about it, sort of mediocre dish for me.

-Sourdough flavored with gooseberry (3 out of 5) - Great texture for sourdough bread and a fun color but largely forgettable

-Goat Empanadas (3/5) - As someone who has eaten quite a few authentic empanadas I'd have to say these fell a little below the rest. Not as much flavor as I would have wanted and I think would have benefited from a sauce more than a pico de gallo.

-Sugo (3.5/5) - Basically a pork-based sauce smothering bucatini and baby carrots - Sort of a pork spaghetti. Gooseberries sweetened it up a little bit!

-Breadstick buns (4/5) - tasted like soft breadsticks and went great with the accompanying tomato jam

Things you HAVE to order:
-Wood oven roasted pig face - This is probably the most yelp'd photo for G&TG so chances are you've seen the picture, It's a great piece of pork topped with a sunny side up egg with some cilantro and potato stix. The pork has great flavor and an awesome crunch all the way around the outside skin. So good.

-Calamari Bruschetta - This was my dark horse for best dish of the night for me. I wasn't sure how much I'd enjoy it with the goat milk ricotta and green tomatoes but holy hell did these things go well together. The calamari mixed with everything in one bite was delicious. Each bite of calamari I had tasted like it had its own personal char on it which I loved.

-Crisp braised pork shank - Nothing too fancy going on here except a great cook on a pork shank. The skin was so crispy and once you got past that crunch, the meat of the pork was just fell apart. Mixed with the naan and the kimchee(nectarine kimchee while we were there), this was the second best bite I had during the meal.

-For the star of the night for myself and a couple others in our group... the chili shrimp with  sweet corn esquites. I've had some great corn this summer but this might be the best out of all of them. The shrimp were of course cooked perfectly with a good smokiness to them and then mixing that in a bite with the corn just stole the show. This was the best thing all night and i wish we had gotten more.

Overall, Girl & the Goat was a fantastic dining experience for our entire group. The service was good, atmosphere fun, and food was great so it's hard to find many flaws. Definitely a place to visit if you're in Chicago or a fan of Top Chef!

pics.caption: crisp braised pork shank - buttermilk dressing. grilled nectarine kimchee. naan
calamari bruschetta - clam baguette. goat milk ricotta. goat bacon. green tomato

review.des: Do not leave here without trying the pig face (taste better than it sounds), cauliflower, broccoli, and whatever bread and spreads they have. You will not be disappointed.
Food was awesome and service attentive to 101%.... a must visit. We loved the Skunala salmon and their sourdough.

Visiting Chicago for the first time this restaurant was a must on our list of places to visit.

Definitely make a reservation! Even with the reservation it did take a while for us to get seated but it was definitely worth the wait.

A group of five of us tried the following:

Escargot dumplings: definitely my least favorite item. It was too salty and the texture of the escargot with the undercooked wrapping was underwhelming. The sauce it came with was pretty great though.

Green beans: absolutely delicious! The cashews were a great touch and the portion is massive.

Sweet potato and bleu cheese pierogies: i was hesitant about trying them since I read mixed reviews about them but they were actually really good! They didn't feel like actual pierogies but more like mini empanadas or small hand pies/ turnovers but still absolutely delicious. The mushroom ragout on top made them even better.

Wood Oven Roasted Pig Face: as weird as it may sound you really can't go to this place without trying it. Absolutely spectacular!

Pork shank: phenomenal! So flavorful and tender you don't even need a knife! The kimchi and the ranch it came complimented it wonderfully. Everyone loved it!

Olive you bread: wonderful texture and the whipped feta was out of this world!  

Grilled Baby Octopus: I am not an octopus fan yet somehow this was my favorite dish of the night. The octopus was cooked perfectly. The flavors were amazing. I'm willing to fly back to Chicago just for a bowl or two of this deliciousness!

pics.caption: The most delicious pork shank in the world.
Sweet potato and blue cheese pierogies with the delicious mushrooms on top and some slices of the olive you bread.

review.des: THE BEST place in West Loop!  Great for date night and large group!  Foods are shareable yet filling!  Cocktails are on point!

We liked it. I think when a much-ballyhooed place really gets established and starts doing the kind of volume they do, it's hard to keep wowing visitors. Accordingly, we weren't wowed, merely satisfied. Our deep, dark secret is we actually prefer the Little Goat Diner down the street.
Great food! Friendly bartenders who are extremely knowledgeable. Went there right when it open and it didn't get packed until about 5ish. Highly recommended.

Perfection! My boyfriend and I love Little Goat and wanted to try the sister restaurant out. Our server, Gerden, was amazing. Service matters so much in an expensive restaurant, and he nailed it!

Food: 5
Service: 6
Ambiance: 6

Will be back this summer :)

I was not sure what to expect here. I went online and read the menu and raised my eyebrows. Dishes like pig face and ham frites are a little scary. I had my plan B meal already prepared. My husband and I made reservations here to celebrate our 5 year anniversary. Plus I was running the next day in the Hot Chocolate Race and did not want to eat too heavily. Now the review-

Waiting-

Make reservations! This place is quite popular. It will make your experience even better.

Atmosphere-

Casually posh. What that means is no sports tvs. No peanuts on the bar area. Waitstaff does not wear shorts or gym shoes....unless it's Halloween. :-) More about that.

Dress code-

I over dressed. Jeans are just fine. Ladies you can get away with ballet flats. Gentleman-you can leave the jacket and tie at home. I did not see anyone in any type of sports jersey so you may not want to get "THAT" casual. A golf shirt or office casual with jeans will work for you here. Just to let you know how flexible they are with the dress code-Since it was Halloween weekend one patron was dressed in a slip. Scary because 1) it was a slip and 2) it was pretty nippy so no idea what her costume was supposed to represent.

Wait staff-
It was Halloween. All were dressed pretty creatively. One of the bartenders was dressed as a one of the queens from Alice in Wonderland. No big deal but it was a guy. My favorite though was one of the attentive staff members who was in charge of water. He was dressed as a banana and had the best smile.

First menu item-
Ham Frites. I thought it would be deep fried Paula Deen style ham cut in slivers and breaded. NOPE! Way more creative and delicious. Ham frites are shoe string fries with crisp bits of ham and some amazing seasoning. I could not stop eating them! Beer sauce and tomato aioli also delish as dipping sauces.

Serving sizes-
Before I move on just a word about the serving sizes. Dishes are made to share so don't feel offended when the wait staff recommends ordering 4 items. Girl and Goat is pretty reasonable priced considering their creative menu. Let's move on.

2nd dish-Pig Face-It's not what you think!  
If it was, I would not allow it on the table. As other reviewers have noted, its 's a sunny side egg covering pork loin (?) elevated on a bed of hash brown like potatoes. This dish could almost pass as breakfast. I am not a sunny side egg person so I ate everything underneath. The pork was tender. It's grilled not fried and the potatoes underneath were also good but they will never beat the ham frites. In fact any frites or fries I have in the future will never beat the ham frites.

3rd dish-Roasted cauliflower-very good. I can't quite rave about it. It comes with pickled peppers. To me it was a smidge too spicy however the platter they were served on was sent back...empty!

4th dish and my fav-bleu cheese sweet potato Pierogies.
Pierogies are a second staple to pizza in Chicago. Remember Mrs. T pierogies anyone anyone? I would have never thought of this combo of food. You get a creamy salt taste of goodness. If you want something soft on the palate and not extra heavy, this dish fits that need. Off the charts delicious. If you need a carb fix but you don't want to do a typical pasta or bread, then get this.

Dessert-caramel corn and malt balls plus chocolate cake. We did not get two because of being piggish. One was given to us with a candle wishing us a happy anniversary. That was a surprise to us! I enjoyed the chocolate cake very much and definitely like the malt balls. They were accompanied by vanilla malt gelato which took things to a whole different level.

There is goat served here but we did not try it. Sorry.

You will not be disappointed at all unless you are one of those types that can only eat chicken fingers or a burger. If that is what you want, McDonalds is not too far away.

Go here for a unique and wonderful food experience. It' will give you something to talk about!

Also staff knows how to "do" Halloween! :-)

pics.caption: Our beverage guy for the evening. I promised him he would show up in Yelp..in that outfit.

review.des:
Really great restaurant. I personally had a horrible time at little goat. Little goat had good food but probably the worst service I've ever had. Here everything was great and the drinks were amazing. Overall the food was delicious but sometimes a little too heavy on the butter and it was a little much. The duck tongues were the best.

I say skip the fries, they were by no means incredible and I would not get them here. Stick to the dishes they're good at.

The food was awesome and I was so excited to eat here but there were some issue.

1) We were only able to get a very late reservtion which was not a big deal with how popular this place is. I would have still given 5 stars based on the food if nothing else had gone wrong.

2) The server forgot to put in 2 of our dishes (the pig's face and duck tongue which I was very excited to try) and we were unable to get them because "the kitchen had already broken down for the night." There were still many other people in the restaurant so I'm not sure why they would have shut down especially because they take reservations so late.

3) We were at a table right by the kitchen and could see all the line cooks working. I LOVE an open kitchen but this time I could see one of the cooks touching his facial hair and wiping the sweat off his neck with his hands then going back to cooking and touching the food without washing his hand first. Luckily, we didn't order anything from his station or i wouldn't have eaten it. I'm a chef and to me that kind of behavior is unacceptable! Food sanitation is so important.

Loved this place so much that I forgot to take photos of the food (which doesn't happen often!) This place has been on my long-time bucket list, but reservations are notoriously hard to get. My friend finally scored a reservation on a weekday at 9pm, and I came in with very high expectations that were exceeded.

The vibe of this place is pretty trendy, and the place was packed when we were there. We were seated outside at a long wooden table, which was perfect for a group dinner communal dining experience (and was also a little quieter so we could hear each other better!)

The restaurant is tapas-style, and they recommend ~2 plates per person. They also were able to adjust each dish slightly (e.g. add one more rib so that everyone in the party can each have one), which made sharing much easier. Everything we ordered but very good, but in my opinion the outstanding dishes were definitely the vegetable and pork dishes. Some of the things we ordered:

- Pan-fried shishito peppers: Very good, but maybe a little too salty for my taste
- Green beans: So very flavorful and cooked perfectly to a crisp!
- Pork shank: One of the bigger dishes portion-wise on the menu so it's a great one to share - one of the group's favorites!
- Diver scallops: Came with two scallops; bite was full of flavor
- Lamb ribs: ORDER THIS. Fall off the bone goodness.
- Confit goat belly: Super rich! Maybe even a tad so with the bourbon butter, but just a personal preference I think!
- Chocolate cake with shiitake gelato: It seems like it shouldn't work, but it is a perfect combination of flavors.

I would expect nothing but awesomeness from a Chef who won Top Chef as well as Iron Chef and Stephanie did not disappoint! I only wish we got to meet her! Started with a great cocktail which was like a Pimms a cup but with Vodka. My wife kept drinking mine and insisted she didn't want one. Then we had the Goat Empanadas which were amazing! My daughter tried goat for the first time in these and she loved them!! Then we had the green beans.. salty yes, but I love my veggies salty and these were amazing!! Also had the tuna which was good as well as the escargot ravioli. Good but not stellar. The pork shank was stellar!! Really really great as well as the Carmel corn malted desert. Would definitely come back. They stuff you in and I typically hate places that sit you so close to your neighbors but the meal made up for it and obviously this town appreciates this great chef! Place was packed and we made our res like 2 months out!!

This restaurant is fantastic. My boyfriend and I order and aggressive amount of food and we couldn't finish it. Portion sizes are pretty significant. The service was excellent, our waitress helped us select a really nice wine that paired well with our food.

Special occasion style and price but totally worth it!

Not sure if I can add anything new about this place - hands down one of the best restaurants in Chicago. And that's quite a feat with so many amazing restaurants opening up every week. Went there with a big enough group to be able to order the goat leg - my second time indulging in the delicacy - definitely one of the best meals I've ever had. Can't wait to go back!

They allow you to do half portion for some dishes for half price which is good for business travellers like me~~

Spice pear w/ cinnamon and honey cocktail I forgot the name 5/5 very strong and flavorful. I'm not a big fan of cinnamon but this one is goid

Escargot ravioli 5/5 I don't really taste the escargot but it's so good~~I would definitely get it again

Goat empanada 5/5 the mushroom on top of it is a perfect addition to the empanada. Would definitely get it again!!

Pig face 3/5 it didn't amaze me...just ok.  Maybe because I'm Asian and I have pig face more often then other people? I guess for non Asian people I would recommend to give it a try but if you are asian~ nothing special...

Carmel corn & Malt Balls 5/5 just the perfect ending for the meal. I can finish one all by myself~

Service 5/5 I sat by the bar and the waiters are outstanding..very informative and gave good recommendation

Excellent food and service. We tried all these dishes:

Olive You bread - olive goodness, great butter
Cauliflower - very tasty and flavorful and trendy veggie
Wood fired oysters - delicious and smoky and bacony! Would have loved more on the butcher block
Escargot dumplings - this was the only dish I did not care for. I love escargot but not how this was made - it tasted gritty and I took one bite and couldn't eat the rest. My guy however, enjoyed them and ate them all
Pig face - best meal of the night - with a fried egg on top and cilantro sauce - crispy potatoes were cooked to perfection

Our server was cool and entertaining and didn't mind our drunk asses. Cocktails were delish (I had a tasty cocktail their version of the French 75) and the quote from my BF was "Strongest cocktail I have ever had."

Thanks for the great experience, Girl and the Goat!

I can't feel my face - was it the cold or the cocktail?
Freaking pig face - I wanted more and more and more

review.des:
The pig face is amazing. Its really , really good...highly recommended.
Very unique dishes and place.

I understand the hype, the accolades, and the difficulty getting reservations. This was an incredible dining experience!

Visiting Chicago for the weekend, I was able to secure an early Sunday night dinner reservation at the last minute and we landed at two of the best seats in the house - right in front of the kitchen. From our stools, we watched all the prep and plating and Chef Izzard was just steps away presiding over the kitchen.

Our waiter - Calvin - was just fabulous! He was entertaining, comfortable in his position, and knowledgeable about the highlights of the menu. My sister had been there multiple times before. So between Calvin and her recs, we ordered the following:

Breadstick buns with tomato jam and ranch - These tasted like the best garlic breadsticks I've ever had and the tomato jam and ranch really added an extra layer of flavor!

Goat empanadas - The delicious, tender meat was stuffed inside a flaky crust with the plum pico de gallo and avocado on top.

Roasted cauliflower - The slight charring was so tasty!

Pan roasted halibut - The piece of fish flaked so easily and nearly melted in the almond butter.

Kalbi beef ribs with sweet corn coblettes and grilled okra relish - All of the components in this dish could've stood alone. The beef was perfectly seasoned.

Crisp braised pork shank with housemade naan and nectarine kimchi - There was no skimping on the meat here. The pork shank was meaty and incredibly tasty. The crispy skin and meat dipped in the chipotle sauce and eaten with the naan was a standout bite of the night.

Sweet corn kulfi with Concord grape, peanut butter brittle, peanut butter fluff, and caramel corn - There was a lot going on here but I cleaned the bowl. It was like a mature, dessert version of PB&J.

Chocolate truffle cake with coconut cream - This was excellent! The cake was so light and soft, with a scoop of ice cream on top, coconut cream underneath, and their version of chocolate magic shell and coconut flakes sprinkled on top.

Talk about an outstanding meal...this was it! Chef Izzard's inspiring and creative food creations, combinations, and presentations, along with the excellent service and wonderful ambiance really set this place apart from some of my other dining experiences in Chicago. Chef Izzard was also very lovely and non-pretentious, talking with diners and taking pictures throughout the evening. That's always great to see.

I hope to have another opportunity to dine here.
Excellent wait staff. Had 5 dishes and all were great! The calamari bruschetta was our favorites by far. Loved the ambiance. Drinks were cold and delivered fast. Couldn't recommend more.

Omg. The. Food. Is. Amazing. Love love love this place! The atmosphere is cute! But it's kind of expensive so i don't go back often,however, the food is delicious and priced accordingly for how delicious it is.

I came here with a reservation at 10:45 at night on a Sunday. I was surprised, though I suppose, not really surprised to walk in to a lively, packed restaurant.  The service was friendly and personable. Not at all stuffy.  They knew the menu well, and as a person dining alone, they knew when to interject, and when to give space. The food pacing was good, and I was a very happy camper. Then there was the food. Excellent!

Because I was there on my own, they cut down a couple of the dishes to half size (as they were normally meant to be shared), which I was immensely impressed with, and I was able to try a lot of flavors, without being overwhelmed by any one dish.

The pan-fried shishito peppers were full of umami, and very tasty. The duck tongues (also a menu staple) sounded crazy, but they were excellent. If you're not squemish about what you eat, try it.  Lots of bright flavor, but rich, but not to rich.  It was very well balanced.  

I got the grilled baby octopus as well.  It was grilled baby octopus, with fava beans, pistachios, guancialle, pea shoots, and lemon vinaigrette. Bright, rich, smoky, lots of textures, and really enjoyable.

At the end of the meal, I was fascinated by two desserts, but decided on one. I mentioned my struggle, and they actually brought me both.  She noted, we don't expect you to finish it all, but you looked so torn, I wanted to make sure you could try them. How completely magical!  I tried both the dark matter pot du creme, with sesame spuma, ginger caramel, and sesame brittle, and then the caramel corn and malt balls.  This one was so classic in flavor, and even had the magic shell chocolate on top!

The food was playful, tasty, and if I'm in Chicago, I'm making my reservations early to eat here again.

review.des: So much hype about this place. I get it, the food portion is tiny and the cost is high. I tasted almost everything on the menu, the only thing I truly enjoyed was the empanadas.. they were truly finger licking. Other than that, it's all visuals.
Love this place for brunches ! It's a huge line on the weekends but it worth it! Love coffee there and highly recommend this place!

I've heard people say this place is too hyped up. Wrong. It's amazing.
We ordered:

Wood grilled broccoli - delicious!
Crisp braised pork shank - Came highly recommended by our waiter and it was incredible! By far my favorite item. Everything from the warm naan, to the flavorful sauces, to the kimchi, to the perfect cooked meat had me raving.
Goat empanadas - Good, but wouldn't order again.
Blueberry cornbread - Another great option!

I know some people wait months to get a rezzie here, but we just rolled in on a Sunday night and sat at the bar.

My boyfriend and I were visiting from LA and this was one of the restaurants I wanted to try the most. However, it was difficult to find a res at a decent time, BUT we were able to get an 8:30pm dinner reservation last minute on open table!

We ordered:

1) Hamachi crudo
2) clams (i forgot the name)
3) pork belly
4) pork shank

The hamachi crudo was AMAZING. Like, hands down one of the most delicious pieces of food I have ever placed into my mouth. I think this was my favorite thing we ordered and I wish there had been more on the plate!  (It was a pretty small amount for $16)

The clams were in a sort of curry/broth that reminded me of Thai curry. It was very tasty and the clams were large and fresh.

The pork belly was my second favorite! Cripsy and very tasty. Yum yum. I wish I remembered more about what it came with but I forgot to take pictures :(

At this point in the meal, I was starting to get full and the pork shank took a while to come out. It was also HUGE. Even for two of us, it was a lot of meat. It was tasty and very moist. It came with ranch dressing and some type of hot sauce, which I thought was an interesting combination. However, I was also starting to get full and starting to wish we had ordered veggies instead of more meat. This was my least favorite of the four dishes though.

All in all, I thought the food was good though the service wasn't as great as I expected. At an establishment such as this one, I would expect to not have to try and flag down your waitress multiple times to get more water. That was my only qualm and the service was fine other than that.

I feel like you don't even need to review this place because everyone already knows it's the best. For those of you actually looking up the review now you know. Get the pig face don't be a loser. If you're in Chicago you HAVE to go here.

I've been to Chicago four times and in the previous three trips I could not lock down Girl and the Goat reservations.  After many long years of waiting I was finally able to try this long awaited restaurant when I most recently visited Chicago. I visited on a Saturday night and as expected, it was crowded and we had to wait a few minutes for our table. We grabbed some drinks at the bar which were good and strong. It is located in the West Loop neighborhood which is the quickly becoming the hip new area of Chicago. If you dine here, make some extra time to explore this neighborhood.
For dinner, we were told to order 2-3 dishes each as it is tapas style. We ordered eight dishes for our table of four. I think that was too much as we were all stuffed by the time dinner was over and there was food still left over. I'd recommended 1.5 dishes each as I think we would have been better off without 1-2 of the dishes we ordered. My favorite, favorite, favorite dish was the chickpea fritter. I could have eaten two plates of those. The Grilled Yellow Fin Tuna was also a big hit as well as the oyster. I would suggest skipping out on the Pan Fried Shishito Peppers because they were pretty dry and unappealing as well as the Ham Frites which were pretty much McDonald's fries. Overall, the dishes that were great were unanimously loved and a big hit for our entire table. They were unique and delicious. However, there were some dishes that no one really enjoyed. It was a hit or miss with the food.
The service is great- the waitress was friendly, accommodating, and quick. She suggested different items on the menu honestly and based on our preference. It did seem slightly understaffed as we had to flag her down a few times towards the end of our meal. The manager even came out at the end of our meal to thank us for visiting and wishing my cousin a happy birthday. It was on the more expensive side as expected but it is worth a try for the experience.

I really, REALLY wanted to try this place since forever. FINALLY got the chance last weekend. Unfortunately, I was a little disappointed. The restaurant itself was SUPER cute, and the menu was very simple, everything I want in a place I'm dining in... except that I didn't really have any options to eat. Everything on the menu contained some form of pig.. bacon on bacon on bacon fat.. ugh.

Ordered:
x Roasted Cauliflower - Yummy, but not cooked enough. Wish it was a little softer. The slices peppers were a unique twist which I thoroughly enjoyed.
x Grilled Octopus - Very good.
x Sweet potato pierogies - Ugh, I was so excited to eat pierogies after trying them for the first time earlier this year, but was super disappointed. These came deep fried and they were just not flavorful at all. Skip.
x Hamachi Crudo - We ordered this with the pork belly on the side because of me. While the fish was super fresh and soft, it was lacking major flavor.
x Mussels - I didn't care for the broth.... although I did end up eating the entire thing myself. Mostly because it was the only thing I could really eat.

I was still hungry after this meal. The reason I'm giving it 4 stars instead of 3 is because my friends ordered some meat dishes and LOVED IT. I guess if you're a vegetarian or pescetarian, this is not the place for you. Service was A+.

I wouldn't come here again.. only because there's nothing to eat for me :(

I love this place. A unique take on a restaurant, the atmosphere is great (makes me want to stay after I eat), and the food to die for. When I first looked at the menu it seemed a little weird but when we dug into the shared bowls as they came one by one, I was amazed at how great it was. I'm coming back soon again for more of that beef tongue!

Tips on getting a reservation: You should really book super early (at least a month in advance) because this place always has a wait. Otherwise, you will be stuck going to eat at a really weird time. If you want to try just coming here without a reservation, the wait is usually pretty long but you may be able to get a seat at the bar earlier. You can still order food at the bar area. If you really want to sit in the dining area, Fulton Market is full of places you can just go grab a drink to wait. I like Maude's for a cocktail while waiting. Or Green Street Smoked Meats for a beer...though you might just end up eating the bbq there.

Now to the food! I've been here a few times. A couple of times with a party of four and once with a big enough party to justify getting the goat leg. I think we had a party of eight for the goat leg. The goat leg is delicious, and if you have a big enough party - you should try it! It comes with pita bread, and a bunch of different sauces. When we had it, they also gave us sliced hard-boiled egg and I think crispy potato strings.

I think it's worth it to come here with at least a party of four so you can try many different things. I'll review the things I've tried here because everything looks super delicious - but there are a few really standout dishes. You have to pick and choose what you get because there's just not room to try everything!

- Crisp Braised Pork Shank
- Wood Oven Roasted Pig Face
- Goat Leg
- Wood Grilled Broccoli
- Roasted Cauliflower
- Seared Diver Scallops
- Escargot Dumplings
- Ham Frites
- the Bread

I'm a big fan of the bread. Everytime I've come, they change the spreads that come with the bread, but they're always really good. The bread is worth getting because it's that awesome freshly baked, soft on the inside, warm amazing type of bread. Definitely recommend.

I think if you come here and you're a meat eater, you should 100% get the pork shank and the pig face. I know pig face sounds weird, but I think it's the pig cheek meat that they put in there. It comes with pig face meat, sweet maple gastrique, viniagrette, crispy potato sticks and a runny egg. You mix everything up and man, this is seriously one of the best dishes I've ever had.

The pork shank is another must try. The meat is so tender, and it falls right off the bone. It comes with pita bread and a vegetable I think (squash?). It is so good. The other dishes I've had here are good, but not rave-worthy good. To me, the pig face and the pork shank are the real stand-outs. The broccoli and cauliflower are great options if you want a vegetable - very flavorful and yummy. The diver scallops and escargot dumplings are good too if you want a seafood option. For some reason, we always get the ham frites here because they're a pretty good side to much on. They usually are served early, so if you're hungry you can eat some of those fries before everything else comes. Save some room for the pig face and pork shank though!

pics.caption: This is the goat leg spread!

review.des:
I really don't want to go into each dish because there are so many people that have reviewed the dishes that I tried. I do have to say that if you're wanting to try this place, make those reservations! I enjoyed all the food my friend and I had, and the dessert was DELICIOUS. So save room.

Tried the Goat Empanadas, Wood Grilled Broccoli, Wood Oven Roasted Pig Face, and Caramel Corn and Malt Balls.

I have to say that the grilled broccoli is the best broccoli I have ever had in my whole life. The Caramel corn and malt balls was so YUMMY. Magic shell chocolate and salted caramel ice cream? AHH. I DIE.

I only wish the service was more attentive! As in from the server. The busboys were legit.

So yeah, it's as good as they say it is. Go try it.

I came with high expectations though with only 1 stomach so maybe the problem was I couldn't try enough things. I really liked that they can serve half portion of vegetables at half the price -- very single diner friendly, which if you come to a place like this, you must be a foodie to go out of your way to eat alone.

Beets (3/5) - it sounded very innovative but it was largely 1 note with the beets being the clear taste you get. I didn't pick up any anchovy except for in 2 bites out of a big bowl of anchovies. I was a little disappointed. I'm sure sharing it would make it seem less monotonous and it was fresh and tasty but I was more bummed by how little funk I got when I was expecting a lot more from the fish flavors promised.

Duck tongue (4/5) - it was tasty and was very well balanced as a dish. You got great texture, great flavor, and great variety in each bite. I think this was easily the best dish of the evening.

Goat belly (3/5) - the overall taste was too sweet and I thought I was eating candied food. It just didn't strike balance and was definitely less savory than I expected for the rich set of ingredients listed.

Overall service was fast and attentive. I just didn't think the value was there nor strong balance within the dishes for the most part. I left disappointed given the hype. I applaud the menu for being so different than what you'd find anywhere else though.

Outstanding food and service. Everyone need to try this place. It is very cheap compared to how great the food taste. We paid less than 300$ for 4 people including tips. We shared 8 dishes and 3 deserted and got wine and drinks as well. You can't beat that. The food is super tasty and different and the service is wonderful. Book a table in advance though - but its worth the wait.

Prior to our trip to Chicago, my daughter and I were not able to get a reservation. However, while in Chicago, we checked the website. Apparently, God had parted the waters, someone canceled their reservation, and we got in! With VIP seating at the chef line, to boot! With more than 5,500 reviews I don't know that I have a fresh perspective to add to the conversation. I will just chime in and encourage you to dine here.

We were placed directly in front of the pastry chef, which was so fun because my daughter is a pastry chef in training. Everything we ordered was first rate on presentation, flavor, and texture. Our favorites were the kohlrabi salad and the goat empanadas, and the peanut butter & jam dessert. Plus, they gave us a mini dessert on the house. Why? So nice.

What left the most lasting impression with me was the vibe. From the minute we walked in, everyone was friendly and inviting. Our server was exceptional - personable and professional. The chefs on the line were friendly and engaging. It is a great experience to enjoy a meal with happy food people.

I hope to dine at Girl & the Goat again.

So dang good. I would go here again in a heartbeat. My boyfriend and I went here for our 1 year anniversary. The meal was delicious and they even gave us a complementary dessert in celebration. We will definitely return!

So so glad I got to check this place out again. Same thing as last time, music was loud but this time, not as annoying as last time.

Onwards to the drinks, got the Jack Ryan and the Local 75. Both delicious--try these!!

Now the food. Got the serrano bread with corn cream cheese and some relish type thing. That was good but I feel I should have tried the rolls which looked delicious when they were bringing them by to other guests! Pass on the ham frites (just French fries with some dried ham on top--pass) but the aioli was delicious!

My friend and I got the confit goat belly, octopus, and broccoli. All of these were amazinggggggggggg! The broccoli though. Deng. lol. That was SO flavorful. How do I get to that level?! I will someday.

The octopus was my favorite. My friend hadn't tried octopus before and we both agreed that the texture and flavor were remarkable. Amazing!! Get this! You won't regret it (even for those who are skeptical in trying it).

Finally, dessert. We got half blackberry shortcake and half Kulfi which was a peanut butter dessert with popcorn. Both of these were SO good but I got to say, the blackberry shortcake topped the cake ;).

Loved our experience--we had an awesome waiter. Good times!

pics.caption: Peanut butter dessert on left and blackberry shortcake dessert on right. Both amazing!

review.des:
Ugh Girl & the Goat how I love you but hate how you're always crazy booked. Even when I had a late dinner at 9:30pm on a Tuesday night, you were still incredibly busy.

I've had the good fortune to dine at Girl & the Goat and the food is always delicious. Yes, you have to pay for the bread, but it 's so good that paying for something like bread seems justifiable. The one dish that I was hesitant to try was the chickpea fritter, but only because I'm not huge on vegetarian dishes and would rather order an additional meat or fish dish. Glad my friend really pushed for the chickpea fritter though because it was not a disappointment! No matter what you get, it's allllll good.

I will say that service is hit or miss. The first time I went, the host/hostess were a bit short with me. Our table wasn't ready yet so they said we could grab a cocktail and wait at the bar. After waiting for about 15 minutes, I walked over to the front and asked again about the table and received a cold response about how they would find me when it was ready. Our server that night was lovely enough to make up for the initial interaction. Another time, we were celebrating a birthday and the server seemed displeased with the birthday girl's indecisiveness. The bday girl asked the server which dish she liked best, and the server responded with "it doesn't matter what I like, it matters what you like." We also asked her opinion on which bread we should order, and she said "it's bread; it's warm and buttery." My friend dropped one of the three goat empanadas on floor that night and we were too off-put by our server's attitude to mention anything (read: we were now scared of her), but one of the table bussers saw what happened and got us a replacement empanada. Overall, there were good parts and not so good parts during each dining experience.

pics.caption: The Wood Oven Roasted Pig Face.

review.des: Came here with my boyfriend on my birthday on Saturday at 6:00 PM. For peak hours, you need a reservation about two months in advance. The food, ambiance, and service were all great. I had heard of the hype and had to experience it for myself. We had a Second City show at 8:00 and the server was incredibly accommodating and helped bring out the dishes quickly. We started with the cranberry bread that came with jam and some other spread. Would not recommend the other spread because it had an awful aftertaste. Next, I got the chickpea fritters, which had the texture of fried goat cheese. Not super memorable. I also opted for the pig's face because it was highly recommended. The egg on top perfectly complimented the rough texture of the pig's face. My favorite dish was the grilled cuttlefish, which came with pistachios. I loved the contrasting grilled taste and the lemon vinaigrette. Overall, the bill was over $80 with tax and tip. Since Girl and the Goat is the epitome of Chicago fine dining, I would recommend it for a special occasion!

Great service! And the food was delicious. It was hard getting an early reservation but we checked last minute and were able to get in. We went in and ordered 5 dishes and ranked from our most favorite to least favorite:

3-way tie-- duck tongues; wood oven roasted pig face; and crisp braised pork shank

-raw oysters

-goat loin (I think this is a seasonal dish)

They also have a good drink menu with wines, cocktails and beer
