-goat belly: disappointing. I paid almost $20 for a tiny slab of meat which was good, but not THAT good... and the sauces were overly buttery. Did come with a few pieces of lobster/crab but it wasn't enough to make up for the mediocre nature of the dish.

-green beans with fish sauce: sounds really plain, but my friend and the waitress ranted about it, so decided to give it a go. Definitely one of my favorite dishes of the night! The tangy sourness of the fish sauce was perfectly complemented by the more earthy flavors of the vegetables and cashews. A definite must get - portion was generous and it was only $9.

-pig's face. So.... what's the big deal about this? I really don't get the hype... sadness. Pretty much some tender meat with some cilantro sauce and "fancy" french fries with a sunny side up egg all mashed together. This is their most popular dish?

-diver scallops: I really liked this dish... only two scallops were given for the $17 I paid but they were decently big. I really enjoyed their twist on kimchi as well!

Overall, I would give it 3.5 stars... Food was good, but definitely did not live up entirely to its hype.

Soooooo good! Came here for my husband's birthday and loved it! Everything is VERY flavorful. I don't eat meat, but do eat fish and there were plenty of options. We shared 5 dishes and were stuffed. Probably only needed 4, but things looked too good to pass up. The string beans were the very best, followed by the cauliflower, then soft shell crab. The crab rangoons were good, but just to try, that one wasn't a do over. Also had the chickpea fritters which were good, but again, would try other things next time. We had ordered the calamari bruschetta, but saw it come to a different table and switched to the soft shell. Would eat here again in a heartbeat. Can't wait to try and replicate a few of these at home.
Just a slight warning: it is very noisy! Much easier to be with one other person than a group.

We arrived before they opened on the Sunday during Labor Day weekend in hopes of getting on the wait-list for which we expected to wait 1-2 hours. There was already a long line outside, but when the doors opened many went straight to the bar seating and most already had a reservation. Too our pleasant surprise our party of four was seated right away for an early dinner (about 4:45pm). This is a tapas style restaurant with family style seating. The food was very good. With each dish being brought one by one it allowed us to focus on each dish making the meal that much more enjoyable. My favorite was the halibut. Everyone else really liked the pig face. The string beans were also a hit. I withheld one star simply because I can't say it's the best restaurant in Chicago as the other posts say, although it was very good it wouldn't have been worth waiting two hours.

I will never forgot the dessert here. The precious Malt Corn ice cream is to die for. Service was great. Ordered the cauliflower, empanadas, pig face, and Sugos pasta.

Cauliflower// Regretted not ordering the grilled octopus instead of the cauliflower the whole time. For $13 for veggies versus paying $17 for grilled octopus you might as well get the seafood for a couple dollars more. The cauliflower was okay I think it was missing lemon or something to bring out a kick. Not worth the $13 price tag.

Empanadas// hubby loves these. His favorite dish of the night. I liked it too.

Pig face// Very unique and delicious. Never had anything like it. A must order. Taste like pork belly with thin baby hash brown crispy hairs.

Sugos// So flavorful! Not too heavy and with w sweetness to it. I've been to Italy and had a ton of pasta dishes but this was very memorable to my tastebuds.

Malt Corn dessert// MY LOVE!!! I could come back JUST for this alone. This was the star. Tastes like Zebra caramel chocolate popcorn but magically captured in ice cream form.

Very sophisticated tapas style restaurant. Make reservations or starve! Menu is on the price side.

Fabulous! When I lived in Chicago my boss and I enjoyed a fabulous dinner here.
I would recommend this restaurant!

It met my expectations! My fiancé and I ordered the pig face, pork shank, peas, scallop bruschetta and the goat empanas. My favorite were the goat empanas and the pig face! I couldn't believe how the meats were almost like butter of how soft they were. Loved the atmosphere, food and staff. Can't wait to go back

Made a trip out to Chicago over the weekend and we were advised by many people to stop by girl and the goat but we were all pretty disappointed. The green beans and octopus dishes were SO salty we pretty much left full from all the water we drank. We did order the pig face which was not bad but our fav dish was the grilled marinated pork belly.

The service was decent but price was pretty steep for the portion. Might be because we're all from LA (where we're spoiled with amazing food) but this place def did not live up to the hype.

Where does one begin about this place. Definitely the best place to eat goat dishes in North America, I'm guessing. It was a tough reservation, especially for a 5:30pm one made 3 months in advance. The Miso hungry bread board was awesome. Some brioche like stuff, very nice. Had a Kohlrabi salad - good, but not amazing. The Shishito peppers fried in a gratin like dish, were the bomb.com. Pan roasted halibut- probably the best dish of the night. Crisp braised pork shank instead of Pig Face, which featured a grilled spring onion "kimchi", well done, but again, not life-changing. Goat empanadas were really good, but guacamole? hmmm...dessert was tasty, but can't remember what it was. Don't get me wrong, I really liked it, and wanted to give it 5 stars, but felt a little processed on the service, and the food was high quality, but honestly I had more fun with the Little Goat than the Mothership G & G.

pics.caption: Pork shank, kimchee sauce, buttermilk ranch & naan

review.des:
This place is just phenomenal
We tried the Goat heart and Pig Face, both of which I thought I would never eat. They were so good, that I would consider coming back to Chicago to have them again.
Their salads are good and the service is great!
Highly recommended place, and a perfect date spot.

Probably one of the best meals I've ever had.

Get the pig face. The halibut is also amazing...and the manila clams with goat liver pate ngggggggh... Oh forget it, get everything on the menu. You can't lose.

P.S. always get dessert.

Had dinner here last weekend. I guess I'm glad we went just to see what all the hype is about. The food was tasty but pretty small portions. We had to order 4 entrees just to satisfy our appetites.  Having been there once, I don't really think I would go back, especially with all the other food choices around.

We had the most amazing meal tonight! I came from California to visit my friend, and Rodrigo was just the sweetest server--definitely made the night even better than it already was.

The goat mousse liver at the end of the meal was extremely decadent, and was almost a dessert in and out of itself.

The halibut was probably the highlight of the meal. The crispy skin and complex flavors and acidity really brought the fish to perfection. Highly recommended!

This review is mostly to say thanks to an amazing staff, and to highlight Rodrigo as just an overall wonderful person. The one month reservation was definitely worth it.

I just had one of the best meals all year. We started with a wonderful octopus dish, then a roasted cauliflower dish, a goat satay dish, the main course was a pork shank (still great but not in the same league as the others). We finished with Berries and Cream. We were scratching our heads when they served dessert; it was a bit out there. In the end we were literally scraping the plate. I can't recommend this place enough.

This restaurant is a machine for fine food.  My group enjoyed this eatery to no end.  Very eclectic menu.  The halibut and lamb ribs were amazing.  If you are visiting Chicago this is the place to eat.  Very cool atmosphere and great wines.

What an amazing dinner.

For 2 people, we ordered:
-1/2 order of green beans
-halibut
-pork belly
-pork face with egg
-black cod
-brioche with jams
-complimentary serving of dessert (butterscotch pudding, i believe?)

Our absolute favorite was the halibut, which is apparently the very dish the chef created to win Top Chef. The dish had a lot of asian influences--fish sauce, citrus notes--and was perfect. I was so sad when it was gone.

Green beans were okay, but were nice to have as we waited for our dishes to be served. *I have to say that service was great--dishes came out with perfect timing (as soon as we finished the prior dish) and were saved from lightest to heaviest. Waters were always refilled.*

Black cod was okay. Very intricate in its usage of various ingredients but compared to the halibut, it was a bit bland.

Pork belly was my least favorite. The pork seemed a bit burnt and charred in some areas which left bitter notes in my mouth.

We ordered the pork belly with egg based on reviews on Yelp. It was a good plate, but was much sweeter than we expected. If the sweetness level was reduced, it would have been a much better dish overall. I could only manage a few bites.

Lastly, the brioche was wonderful--light, buttery--and the free dessert was the perfect palate cleanser. We had also ordered a bottle of wine to accompany the meal, and it was a great recommendation from our waitress--Bravo!

Definitely a pricey meal--around $180 for 2 people but worth it, personally, due to the quality of food and service. The decor was nice but dark and the tables were very close together. The noise level was really high too; I could barely hear across the table.

Great dining experience--would come again to try the other offerings.

All around terrific experience here at G&G. Was visiting from Boston and I can not speak more highly of the quality of food, drinks, and service here!

Came with a friend and we tried tons of drinks on the menu as well as a collection of items from the menu. The service was brilliant--each item is brought out at an appropriate time (I think they are lightest to heaviest or vice versa).

The flavor of the plates is exceptional. Unique in every bite, and all around just an exquisite and fun experience. Highly recommend!

Wow, what a great place.  Service is definitely some of the BEST in town.  We had the grilled, shrimp, pierogi, goat empanadas and chargrilled cauliflower.  All comes out as share plates and perfectly timed.  The atmosphere is perfect for this space and not extremely noisy.  Nice date nite place or a monthly treat.  We will definitely be back, made resos on the way out.

I'd like to give it one star so that nobody would show up, but that just wouldn't be right. Great food, great service, great ambience. Stephanie really is the "Top Chef". Try to sit at the kitchen and watch her personally run this culinary eden.

To be clear, I want to give this place a 4.5.

The food is everything you read in all the reviews, quality over quantity. Please keep that in mind, if you are hungry, you will need to drop serious cash as the dishes are all share dishes. They really push that fact here and to be honest I happen to love that in any dining experience.

Cons: long wait. Called first, woman said no reservations. (This is untrue as we already saw it was possible on opentable but wanted to call to try and sneak a res. The hostess greeted us at 820 and said we can be put on the wait list but reservations would be taken first and recommend next time we make one (yeah....thanks)
The hostesses keep close watch of the quoted time. On her screen (yes I'm the annoying customer who sneaks a peek every chance I can to see what my progress is when there's a long wait) it showed that the checkin time was 820 and quoted time was for 9:50. There were a few times they could have sat us, but if you guessed it...yes, we got a table at 9:50. I will say, yes for those that have experienced it before 90 minutes is not the worst wait for this restaurant and for us was a must from all the recommendations.

We got 4 dishes, Shishito peppers were on point. Amazing combination w Parmesan cheese really complimented each other.

My gf favorite was the cavetelli pasta dish w carrots gooseberries and a mixed meat sauce combo beef pork and lamb.

Overall, get a reservation in advance. If you don't get a res expect a long wait, if your hungry expect to pay a pretty penny.

Plan to get a reservation exactly 90 days in advance (the max for when Opentable willl let you book for them).  The must-have on the menu was the roasted pork face, with flavors so delicious you will remember it weeks after dining.

My gf and I were visiting the city and this restaurant was by far the most memorable place we are at! Girl & The Goat is a distinctive upscale American restaurant in the heart of Chicago. The atmosphere was great and the place was ridiculously packed for a Wednesday night. We were lucky to even get a reservation due to a last minute cancelation. We ordered 6 entrees and all of them were unique and delicious. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone who's in town. This is a MUST TRY restaurant!

All I can really say is that Girl & the Goat is a must-visit place when you're in Chi-town for its great service, food, and atmosphere. It was one of my first stops in Chicago for some great cuisine and this place set the bar high. The bathrooms downstairs are all very clean and private.

My favorite eclectic restaurant!! Tried so many new things and all were amazing!
1. Chickpea fritters- crispy and hot outside and creamy inside. The yogurt cooled it off and the chutney made it sweeter!
2. Escargot ravioli- crispy onions on top of a nice ravioli. The miso sauce we spooned into our mouth after!
3. Wood oven roasted pig face- I was a bit scared of this one. I never was one for a sunny side up egg but opening it up over the pig face was amazing! It was like a bacon/ pulled pork taste. Glad I tried it!
4. Goat empanada- one of the specials of the night. Goat meat was meaty and a nice crispy outer layer.
5. Clam chowder bread. Tasted like it was dipped in clam chowder with a nice bacon taste.
6. Chocolate cake was warm with vanilla Ice icecream. Good until we tried the pineapple cake which was crazy good!
7. Pineapple cake with macadamia brittle and caramel was unbelievable!!
8. Ring of fire cocktail! Whew! Spicy! Ginger! Sooo good!

So a complete crazy dinner and dessert! So amazing!! Would come back next time visiting Chicago and will tell everyone how great this place is!

Great food, service and a great fun ambiance!

Girl & the Goat really is worth all the hype. From the moment you walk in it really is an awesome dining experience. The ambiance is one of my favorites...dimly lit with a sexy vibe. It's the perfect place for a spontaneous dinner or a planned romantic evening. Although their bar and lounge is all first come first served, if you are wanting a full dinner, reservations are a must here and pretty hard to get. Don't get me wrong, there are plenty of 4pm and 1030 pm weeknight reservations but if you are wanting a prime time weekend spot, you may have to do some Open Table stalking. Sometimes I will just look months ahead on OT and grab a prime time if it's available just in case I feel like splurging that night. Last night, on a Wednesday, I saw a 6pm res open up and thought, why not??

The cocktails are divine (my current favorites are the Local 75 and My Little Kumquat) and a great beer/wine list as well. Their food is served small plates style with a veggie, seafood, and meat section. For the two of us we ordered two veggie, one seafood, two meats, and our waitress was acting like we were ordering enough to eat at a hot dog competition. Facepalm. I don't like when the tapas style plate gets all eaten up by the other people do you??

We ordered fried cauliflower, blue cheese pierogis, scallops, ham frites, pork shank. Pork shank was definitely the star of the show (served with kimchi buffalo sauce, buttermilk ranch, and butternut squash) but we loved everything we got. And yes, we ate it. Gold medals for us.

I never feel like the bill sticker shocks me either. It's not cheap, but it's not crazy expensive by any means.

Great Chicago favorite.

Went here on my 30th birthday because they have wonderful gluten free options.

The waiter was very kind in answering my questions. Then, since it was my birthday, he brought out a shake for me to have. I took a bite (thinking after all of that it would be rude to question the complementary desert) and realized it was FREAKIN' CHOCOLATE CHIP COOKIE ice-cream in the shake.

GUESS WHAT COOKIES ARE MADE OF?!

Yeah, I'm not somebody on a trend diet. I have an autoimmune disorder.

I should really post photos of what happened to me for the next several days in the bathroom...

So excited to try this place as a recently transplanted NYC'er. The hype was unreal from everyone I met so I got a late night reservation and took my friend who was visiting from NYC. The waitress suggested 5 dishes for the two of us--way too much food! It was super loud for seemingly no real reason. The worst part was honestly the food. It was just so disappointing. Of all the dishes, I only loved one--the green beans! So simple and the sauce was out of the world. Everything else was too contrived and overdone. I am open to trying the other places that are affiliated with this restaurant but would never join the hype.
Go elsewhere--not worth it

Do not plan to show up on the weekend without a reservation like I did! I waited for a bar chair for 35 minutes, however it was all about the food. Ambiance was excellent, bartenders were knowledgable about the menu and the cocktails were fantastic. I don't give anything a 5 but I was debating on this one so it was a 4.5 for me!

pics.caption: Goat cheese on the dessert menu!

review.des:
Tried to make a reservation several times and finally we are here! I don't know it was because my expectations are too high or what, but I was not so impressed with the food. We got chickpea fritters, scallops, shrimps and goat empanadas and pig face. I like the combination of yogurt and veggies in the chickpea fritters. The shrimps were okay but the mushrooms and veggies in there was way too salty. I remember seeing reviews about dishes being too salty and I guess they were right!

We got the cake with passion fruit source in it and that was AMAZING.

I would give a 3.5 but since it's below my expectation, I give a 3...

pics.caption: Lamb empanadas. Ok. Taste like beef.....
Chickpea fritters. Like the yogurt and veggie
Shrimps. I like the mushrooms. But this dish is tooooo salty

review.des: Wow, I couldn't understand why you have to make reservations like a month in advance for this restaurant.  Until I had the food.  I know there is a God to create such wonderful food, do you hear me?!  Everything I had was to die for.  And our waiter?  He was one of the best waiters I have ever had.  I always request him because he goes over and beyond to make your dining experience a superb one.  Can't wait to go back.  And yes, the pictures speak for themselves.  Enjoy! (I know I did!)

pics.caption: Miso Butterscotch Budino - One of the BEST desserts that I have ever had! Melts in your mouth.  Mmmmm...
Halibut - the colors are Beautiful on this dish and the taste is even BETTER!  We liked this so much, we ordered 2 of these!  A must try!
Grilled Califlower with Pine Nuts - a recommendation from our waiter and I see why!  Scrumptious!

review.des:
I've been waiting FOREVER to try this restaurant. The key is to call to make a reservation in advance. You never know - they might have an opening when you're available.

I cannot describe how AMAZING the service here is. We made reservations for 6 PM on a Friday night, and we were afraid that we wouldn't make our reservation because our party was incomplete. The host was quite understanding and held our tables until 30 minutes after our reservation time. They were even willing to let us sit down and order ahead of time before the rest of our party arrived.

The concept of this restaurant is really cool. Once you sit down, you have to pick all of your dishes for the meal at one time. Plan to order about 2-3 dishes/person. Once you order, the restaurant will serve the dishes one at a time as they see fit.

You MUST order the Pig Face, Scallops and Halibut. Every dish is absolutely amazing, but those are definitely my top 3.

Stephanie Izard is a genius! Every dish is carefully constructed and cooked to perfection. I can't wait to come back and try the rest of the menu!
They give a small portion of scallops for a big price, but the flavor is amazing!!!!!!

Small dishes, done right, at the right price.  Definitely a fan of small dishes.  Hard to get a reservation, but we eventually made it happen.  

House Bread with Tarragon Butter and Pea Puree:  A+
The bread itself was to die for.  It was a buttery pastry.  Tarragon butter was incredibly flavorful and went well with the pea puree.  Would order again.

Kale, Beat, Frisee Salad with Avacado Creme Fraiche:  A
Lots of flavors going on in this dish, but not overwhelming.  Flavors worked very well.  Ingredients were extremely fresh.  Great stomach opener dish for dinner.

Goat Carpaccio with Capers, Trout Roe, Frisee, and Fried Fingerling Potatoes:  A+
Another great appetizer dish with alot going on.  Flavors were explosive, but meshed well together.  Really like the use of the trout roe and the gaminess of the carpaccio being neutralized by the capers.  Terrific use of strong flavors.

Escargot Ravioli:  A+
Handmade ravioli with fresh escargot.  The ravioli skin was cooked perfectly.  The butter sauce was amazing.  The escargot was tender.  Simple dish, a bit heavy on the sauce, but worked very well with the natural richness of the escargot.

Beef Tongue, Corn Chips, Frisee, and Pickled Onions:  A+
Beef tongue was divine.  Cooked to perfection, sliced incredibly thin, and almost melted in your mouth.  Great flavor offset by the crunchy texture of the corn chips.  Amazing.

Diver Scallops with Hazelnut, Guacamole, and Bok Choy:  B-
Scallops were overdone and rubbery.  Seared only on one side.  Too many flavors going on in one dish.  Dinner was a great culinary adventure until we hit this dish.  Both of us did not enjoy it.  There was way too much going on, with barely any flavor of the scallops coming to fruition.  

Pork Belly with Over Easy Egg and Caramel Pesto:  B
Pork Belly was deep fried.  Egg yolk added a nice consistency with the crunch of the pork belly.  Very rich and flavorful dish.  A little too much sweetness from the caramel.  Wish there had been some more pesto on this dish to combat the sweetness.  It was almost sickening.  

Overall a great dining experience.  Definitely lives up to the hype.  Really looking forward to come back again.  The only true letdown was the diver scallops, but thank you for a great dining experience.

Trendy place, interesting menu and flavors.  Good to experience a mixture of ingredients i.e meat. empanadas with strawberries. Beef and duck tongues were well mixed. Complete selections of drinks, please taste the chilli licor from puebla or the drink made by Memo (our bartender). The dessert (blak matter pod) was the best journey of flavors yum.

So glad I got to try out this restaurant when I visited Chicago! I made reservations a month in advance to get seated on a Friday night. We ordered the calamari bruschetta, roasted pig face, and duck tongue. My bf loved the calamari bruschetta. All of the flavors went together perfectly. My favorite was the duck tongue. Service was great, drinks were good, and food was delicious. Ambience of the restaurant was great for a date night. Would definitely recommend!

At this point, are any more reviews necessary?  This place is just plain excellent and one of the few that met the hype.  Time and time again, I go somewhere that is supposed to be awesome, and I walk out shaking my head, wondering what all the hyperbole and fuss was about.  But not G&G.  

Service:  Home run.  Attentive but not overbearing.  Friendly but not fake.  Timely but not rushing.  Great recommendations.

Atmosphere:  Solid.  Not too trendy or gimmicky.  Lots of wood, warmth.

Food:  Outstanding.  Pig face, hamachi, and on and on.  Each dish was what I'd hoped it would be.  And the cocktails kept pace.  Everything I consumed was delicious and prepared exactly as it should have been.  

My advice is to not wait for a particular occasion to go, just make a reservation and the dinner will be the occasion.

Just perfect!  Here is what you need to know:
1. Make reservations. Walk ins have a good hour or more wait time. We had an 1.5 hour wait on Monday night. You can sit at the bar or the lounge area.
2. What we ordered for the two of us and couldn't finish:
-Sautéed green beans. Amazing!!!
-Crisp Braised Pork Shank
Miso-butterscotch Budino. I can go back just for this!

Enjoy!

A great experience for a special occasion.  It's best if you are not a particularly picky eater.  I have noticed that people who have restrictions on what they are willing to eat don't seem to have as good of a time.  I have been to Girl & the Goat a few times and every time was great.  The menu is always changing, though there are several items that always seem to be present.  It's best to talk to your server about the specifics of dishes and make sure you'll enjoy them.  Highly recommend ordering bread.  You might think you shouldn't pay for something most restaurants give for free, but it's worth it.

Food was really good. Try the beef tongue and short ribs for sure. The taste of the food was very unique and great. The chocolate cake for dessert was very tasty. The service was great. The only complain was getting a reservation was really hard and if u wanna go there and wait is two hour wait. Other than that I strongly recommend it

It was just ok. I thought I would be blown away by the food and that just didn't happen. They do have some good bread and whipped feta though. However next time I'll just pick up a loaf at Little Goat Diner. It had olives baked into the bread. Amazing.
String beans were good but very salty. If you don't eat pork then it's really not worth going too.

PORK SHANK. If you don't order it, you'll hate yourself forever. Other favorites: the broccoli, goat empanadas, escargot ravioli, and the oysters. Two thumbs up for our server and the old fashioned. Can't say enough good things about this place! Yum-my!

Everything was great. We had the duck tongues, the halibut, the calamari, the pirogies and the goat belly. Everything was wonderful other than the pirogies... they were more like empanadas -- not really pirogies as I know them at all.

I'm afraid I was a little disappointed because of the hype - and to no fault of the restaurant at all. Coming from New Orleans it's hard for me to be blown away by a meal, and I was not blown away. But everything was excellent and the service was absolutely among the best I've ever experienced. Well done!

Visiting for the first time in Chicago and searched Yelp for a great culinary experience. Read the reviews and heard it was really hard to get a reservation.

Good news got into the Girl and the Goat restaurant... NOT such good news.. the food was not great and expensive to boot.

My hopes were very high about this place...don't mind paying more if the food was amazing...

The green garlic pierogies were okay. The wood oven roasted pig face was not tasty at all .. although the soft shell "chili crab" and  the two scallops were delicious. Not worth the hype.

The food was great.  The best food we had while visiting Chicago.  The taste of everything was amazing and definitley it notes id never tasted before.  We had the Duck Confit (must try).  It was so tender and tasty, Halibut (litlle overcooked but good), and the Pork Shank (must have).  We were thouroghly satisified with our meal and experince.  Tip: just pop into the bar side for opening seating. We came in on a Wednesday around 5 and found seating in the comfy chairs.  Will return for sure on our next trip to Chicago!

Came here to celebrate my bday dinner and it was an incredible experience, I'm not one to usually eat new food, I usually stick to chicken dishes only but it was time to step outside the box and let me tell you it was great to finally do that. I didn't know if I would like the food but I did try it all and it was great, definitely left satisfied! Food presentation/taste/service was great, I especially enjoyed the pig face dish! The restaurant is on the higher price range but definitely worth it. Definitely recommend making reservations in advance, months in advance.

This is as good as it gets.  Yeah we had to wait, it's a popular place!  Luckily, the bar staff were simply incredible and kept us properly imbibed while we waited (it was actually a comfortable wait).  We ended up grabbing a seat at the bar when one opened up because they were to awesome.  

The food is phenomenal.  No other way to put that.  I had the oysters (some of the best), shishito peppers (perfect), and  then.... the bread.  I don't know how anyone could make BREAD as good as they do.  Needless to say, we will be back (again and again and again)

This restaurant has great food and great service! My favorite food there are the goats. The goats have so many flavors in it! My other favorite food there is the cauliflower, Stephanie Izard, the founder of Girl and the Goat, has a video on how to make the cauliflower. Her food is so awesome and I'm looking forward to come back!

We had dinner here last night and my husband has been dying to give this place a try for years. I made a reservation about 3 months ago. (Good luck getting a table before 7pm without one.)

The atmosphere is very nice. Dark wood, lots of people, music, ect. It's all served family style so you order about 4-5 dishes for two people. We we really full from 4 dishes shared.

The waiter explained the whole process to us from menu to drinks. I had a deliciously tart lemonade.

My husband ordered the crispy pig face and the goat empanadas that he loved. I'm not a big goat fan but I had a bit and it was very good.  He loved the crispy pig face and said it melts in your mouth.

I'm a really picky eater so I figured it would be hard to find something to order. I chanced it with the chickpea fritters and the Walters grilled chicken. The fritters were delicious! The chicken itself was ok. It had an overwhelming hot dog flavor to it. The broth that it came in was delicious though. I dunked the fritters into it and it was delicious. The potatoes in the dish were delicious.

TLDR: Good atmosphere. Food is good. Don't come here if you are really picky.

After weeks of anticipation for this meal, pouring through reviews, and drooling over fellow yelper's pics, I am sad to say I left feeling a tad disappointed. There's no arguing that Girl and the Goat serves delicious and innovative food. It just wasn't mind-numbing, earth-shatteringly good as I was expecting. And I had very high expectations.

The three of us came to eat at 9pm on a Thursday night. Boy, was it packed and loud! The restaurant itself has a cool trendy ambiance. The open kitchen is impressive!

Booze: great selection of wines and cocktails. The Lux Goods (gin, chamomile-masala syrup, lemon) was freakin' delicious. The masala syrup tasted like the chaat masala my mom would sprinkle on potatoes for Sunday morning lunch, ah the memories.

Honey sambal brioche: WOW. just wow. I never would've thought the cheapest item of the night ($4) would be my favorite. But seriously, this brioche was the some of the best carbs I've ever sunk my greedy teeth into. The bread came with honey butter and a zesty pomelo relish - both went perfectly with the flavorful, soft, warm, bread.

Grilled pork belly: I love everything pork belly, and this dish was no exception. The portion was generous and the meat was cooked perfectly. The green chutney-like sauce was a great accompaniment.

Goat empanadas: Loved 'em! The empanada crusts were cooked perfectly and the goat was super tender and flavorful. My only complaint is that there were only two empanadas, and I could've eaten at least eight, hehe.

Grilled baby octopus: I think we made a mistake by ordering two grilled dishes. The octopus was cooked alright (a bit too chewy) and the pistachios were a sassy innovative addition. The lemon vinaigrette was delicate and simple. The dish overall just didn't have much flavor. This was probably my least favorite of the night.

The Pig Face: ah, the Pig Face. It might've been because I was already stuffed and this dish came out last, but, the elusive, famous Pig Face disappointed me. I feel like such a party pooper for saying that after a slew of praise in previous reviews, but it's true. No denying, it was good. Just not wow. The meat is definitely fatty, but I was okay with that. It just wasn't as exciting as I thought it would be.

Bittersweet chocolate: a satisfyingly bitter thin biscuit-like cake served with shiitake-caramel gelato and toffee crème frâiche. Another hit of the night. I couldn't taste the shiitake but the gelato was lovely.  

Service: good, but nothing worth raving about. Our server was friendly and helpful, but  was hard to get a hold of whenever we needed something.

The three of us ended up paying about $40 each, which is pretty reasonable considering it was a lot of food (plus two drinks). Overall, we left full and satisfied, but not blown away. Presentation however was lovely. Regardless, I could be convinced to return to try their other seafood and goat dishes (one of my dining partners isn't the most adventurous).

*Tip: ask to sit at the chef's table if you're a party of two - I hear it's a ton of fun!

As expected a very good experience. Table was ready at right time God was amazing especially the pork. Very loud as it is always jammed but a fun experience. Bol well in advance or try an off peak walk in as it does work and plenty of other options nearby if it doesn't.

Good restaurant but not as exalted as I thought it would be.  The dining room is large and noisy.  We had an amazing appetizer (clams) but everything else was so-so.  I just checked the menu today and it's very different than when I went - so be sure to see if you like what's being served before you go.
I have to say the goat belly was one the best dishes I have ever had. Everything was amazing one of the best restaurants I've ever been to.

I'm going to keep this short because there are enough reviews about this place already. Pretty much everything is amazingly good here! The worse we had was the roasted cauliflower and mushroom ragout, but it still was good. The best is hands down the pig face. Everything about this is so so so good. The pork is perfectly cooked and the egg is the icing on the cake.

Other things I recommend are sautéed green beans, diver scallops, steamed west coast mussels, and kona kampachi crudo. Definitely come here with at least 4 people so you can make the best out of it. The portions are small and they are meant to be this way. Pretty much, the wait for the reservation is worth it!

I was so excited to finally try one of the Top Chef winners restaurants; Stephanie Izard. The girl can cook. The restaurant is funky with the giant modern piece of a girl and goat which hangs over the corner wall. The gentle lighting creates a sense of wonder and the flavors excite the palate. We tried the crudo, fries, pork, bruschetta calamari, cauliflower, bass, the chickpea fritters and goat empanadas. The highlights were the cauliflower- the best I have ever had. It was perfectly charred and was served with pine nuts, fresh mint, and peppers. The textures and flavors were unique and truly something that surprised the palate. I can only hope I can make a version of this dish. The chickpea fritters were a wonderful texture- a perfect crunch and a nice soft center. The peas and tomatoes accented the dish perfect. The crudo was good, but I have to say the quality of the fish wasn't up to my standard, it could have something to do with me living in San Francisco... where fresh seafood is abundant. The fries were just fries. The bass had a killer green curry sauce with a lot of citrus elements to it which I enjoyed immensely. The pork dish was a bit dry, and the ranch dressing did not go with the dish at all. I understand the thought behind the ranch, giving the dish a cool element from the spicy sauce (which was also on the side) but for me it doesn't work- this isn't buffalo wings. The goat empanadas didn't do anything for me. All and all a wonderful place! Definitely should check it out- it is a unique experience, especially for your taste buds.

The girl and the goat has an amazing ambiance! The decor was rustic and warm. We had a little issue with the reservations the host stated we had the reservations for the following day. They corrected the issue quickly and we were seated. The girl and the goat states that the serve family style plates/tapas style in actuality one plate could be enough for one person. We had the an array of different meals, the pork shank, pig face, trout, pig belly and beef ribs. I was shocked that the pig face was not my favorite but overall the meal was filling and tasty. We spent $160 on 5 plates and two alcoholic drinks.
I will definitely go back to try the goat and more of the fish options.

I had high hopes for Girl & the Goat. Aside from the food, the presentation was poor. It lacked creativity. We tried the veal tartare, escargo ravioli and the scallops. The veal tartare was terrible. The heirloom tomatoes were delicious, but the flavors were all wrong. The scallops were drenched in a sauce that didn't flatter them at all: the escargo ravioli was great, but covered in crispy onions for no reason. If you go for a drink, try the ring of fire. It was really good. The salted caramel dessert was average. Another hip, trendy place in Chicago with average food.

-PIG FACE
-STRING BEANS
-ESCARGOT RAVIOLI

One of my close girlfriends and I planned a trip to Chicago and were told many times that we MUST try Girl and The Goat. Thank god they did because the food is to die for! The only reason I did not want to give 5 stars is because the hostess was not the friendliest of sorts, she was sort of snooty to say the least. So it was off putting...BUT our server was the nicest and the food.... omg i cannot rave enough about it!

For being two small girls, our server was shocked at the amount of food we ordered. haha we ordered the pig face, oysters, sautéed string beans, escargot ravioli, crisp braised pork shank, i believe it was goat belly?, and an amazing dessert which i cannot remember the name, but i do have a photo!!! Btw, we finished all of it... haha Although we only ordered the goat dish because we felt inclined to since its called Girl and The Goat. I am not a fan of gamey meats like lamb, so goat was not my favorite, but my friend enjoyed it.
It is too bad that this place isn't closer to us, since I am from Santa Monica because i would probably be here once a week.

MUST TRY!!!! be sure to make reservations in advanced

pics.caption: I can't remember the name of this dessert. But it was the best ever.
Crisp pork shank. They gave us two!

review.des: Hands down my favorite restaurant in Chicago. I have many food allergies, and this restaurant is so friendly and accommodating with them. Not to mention, EVERY dish that comes out is still so delicious. I have never ordered a sub-par item. Everything is excellent.

Impressions from entrance to exit: loud, crowded, I am a sardine, where is my drink?,  mmmmm, mmmmm, mmmmmm, these are delicious, oh boy here's some more!, mmmmmm, mmmmmm. Wow! That added up quick! And there were only two of us.

It must be difficult for a restaurant to live up to such a stratospheric reputation, but I believe they met and then surpassed my expectations.

If you want to properly survey the menu, be prepared to spend upwards of $100 per person.

did it live up to the hype? yes. make reservations. if there is one restaurant that i'd have to go back to if i'm ever in chicago, it would be this place. good service. great flavors and texture. ordered the hamachi crudo, seared diver scallops, pan fried shishito peppers, grilled marinated pork belly, wood oven roasted pig face, and crisp braised pork shank. my favorite was the crisp braised pork shank! i still think about that dish. i was just talking to my co-worker about this dish a couple of days ago. she had it as well and enjoyed it.

will definitely come back again and try other things on the menu! check out the pictures i posted.

pics.caption: part deux - hamachi crudo, seared diver scallops, pan fried shishito peppers, grilled marinated pork belly, & wood oven roasted pig face!
crisp braised pork shank - buttermilk dressing, butternut squash shiitake kimchi, & naan!

review.des: About nine months ago my partner and I ate at Girl & The Goat and it took me until now to write this review.  While G&TG offers some decent vegan options, I didn't feel the options were very flavorful or inventive. But what kept me from returning was our service experience. My partner (not a vegan) asked the waiter what entrees were most popular, the waiter responded with (with an attitude) "I have thousands of people walk into this restaurant every day and they all prefer different things, how am I supposed to know what people like?"  As if!!!!!  We have not returned since...what an awful attitude.

What's not to love? It's one of my favorites in Chicago for a reason. Consistently well executed and original dishes with reliable service and prompt (if not eager) busboys. I always order the escargot dumplings and grilled octopus. This time we tried the grilled shrimp and it was dynamite!

pics.caption: Dark matter pot de creme 5/5. I love non-chocolate desserts!

review.des: Too oily....same as most American restaurants..The environment is super noisy and it seems they want you to leave immediately. The food is kind of 'novel' but still unhealthy fried American food which I do not like a lot. Need to try the pig face. At least, that is new to me.

My wife and I just had the most amazing experience at Girl and the Goat. We were told we had the most fun seat in the house as we were seated. Our seats were along the counter near the wood fired grill. The hostess wasn't joking, it was so much fun. Our waitress, Leigh, was awesome, so friendly, and made the best recommendations! The kitchen staff were amazing and put on one heck of a show! The staff here is top notch!

We order the kohlrabi salad, which features kohlrabi, olives, mushroom, fennel, evalon, and apples. It started out oniony but finished savory and earthy with the mushrooms and olives. I like it.

Next, we had the beef short ribs with avocado and grapefruit chermoula. Wow!!! The beef cut like butter, and mixed with the citrus of the grapefruit along with the avocado and radish was INCREDIBLE!

After watching the guys in the kitchen churn out an untold number of the Pan Fried Shishito Peppers, I had to have them. Pan roasted, slightly spicy, covered in Parmesan cheese, miso aioli, and sesame seeds. Smoky, savory, spicy goodness left me so happy!

Wood Grilled Broccoli followed. It was smoky, savory, and delicious with blue cheese and spiced crispies. Loved how the broccoli was totally infused with wood fired, smoky flavor!

As a surprise the kitchen presented us with grilled marinated pork belly. Wow! First, the cutting board presentation was phenomenal. The pork belly paired with green sauce and blood orange was amazing! I couldn't stop eating it!

For desert we had the plantain cake and miso-butterscotch budino. The plantain cake was great, but I would consider selling a kidney for another bite of the miso-butterscotch budino. It was like tasting the freedom of the beach for the first time as an adult. It was a good experience that brought you back to a place you never thought food would take you. And we're so happy for it!!!

I'll definitely be back and I can't wait for the next time! An amazing experience! Chef Izard and her culinary companions will take you on a epic culinary journey that is unlike anything you've ever experienced, and I can't wait for the next course!

I've never had a bad experience here, and while I'd like to list every dish to try, I know you don't have time to read that. But I'd be remiss if I didn't recommend the pig face (don't share this one, it's too good!), the green beans, goat empanadas, and the scallops. Service is always excellent here, which I'm sure is no easy task in such a popular restaurant. If you're a foodie or a wannabe foodie, or just enjoy a quality dining experience, you must make a trip here!

Don't get me wrong, this is a terrific restaurant and i had a wonderful time there. The atmosphere is great as well as the selection in music which never included Selena Gomez talking about her filthy hands. Even the bathrooms downstairs were way above average. They were classy enough to have sex in. Finally, the staff was great. They were really attentive and, dare I say, almost passed as  genuine.

But what is truly the main event for going out and spending hard earned money? This is the place my wife and I chose to impress my niece into thinking we were living the high life. Actually, my wife chose because she's addicted to the Top Chef nonsense shows and the chef won something or was a personality. I forget really. Anyways, we order the Ham frites, the pierogi, the pig face, the calamari bruschetta, and the scallops. Of course all the food was good but nothing was special besides the Calamari Bruschetta, which if it were a woman, which I would have taken to the bathrooms downstairs. The food was good but nothing that made me think I need to come back for this in a couple of months especially after looking at the bill.

Again, it's good. But this is the second time I've been here and it'll probably be my last especially with Au Cheval right across the street screaming, no, begging for me to eat a burger. If you go here for the first time, that's cool. But in Chicago, go find yourself a new restaurant instead of coming back.

I went to Girl & the Goat over the summer. The place is always packed and hard to get reservations. The restaurant was more causal then i expected and I quite enjoyed that. We had the green beans, pretzel bread and crisp braised pork shank. The green beans were so good. I do not like fish sauce but thought i would give it a go anyways. I didn't mind it at all on the green beans. It complimented the dish quite well. The pork shank was great as well. It was falling apart and very moist. Over all the staff was very attentive and i would return here again.

I was pleasantly surprised with my experience here!

We had reservations here at 10:45. Their system was down and we ended up having to wait around half an hour for our table, but the staff went over and above to make up for it. We were not charged for our drinks and then were given a free appetizer and a free dessert (vegan and WONDERFUL).

My boyfriend ate off of the regular menu and I ate off the vegan. We each picked two plates, which was PLENTY. He was full at the end and I brought home quite a bit of leftovers. The vegan menu originally sounded very boring to me, but the flavors were wonderful. Drinks were good, meal was good, dessert was incredible. Our waiter was polite and friendly. We will definitely be coming back.

Surprisingly hip & a scene for such a well-regarded foodie restaurant.  Reservations were a bit hard to get but if you check late the night before on Opentable, you may be able to snag a last-minute reservation.

We loved the confit goat belly, the Vietnamese-inspired green beans, and the miso-butterscotch budino.  The the pig face, wood fired oysters, and crudo were just okay. Several dishes were overly salty -- we wish we ordered bread. Service was surprisingly good for a restaurant with such a boozy young vibe; we'd definitely revisit to try more items, especially on the goat menu as we rarely get goat outside of specific ethnic restaurants.

More details on my blog:  pekoepeony.blogspot.com/…

pics.caption: Miso-Butterscotch Budino.  With bacon toffee, glazed pineapple, and candied cashews.  Delish!!
Wood oven roasted pig face.  With sunny side egg, tamarind-cilantro-red wine-maple sauce, and potato sticks.
Sauteed Green Beans.  With fish sauce vinaigrette, shallots and cashews.  Salty but tasty!

review.des: Great ambiance and shareables! The staff were really nice - we were a bit late for our reservation due to a flight delay but they accommodated us and were very understanding. The food options are nicely separated between veggie, fish and meat for easy menu navigation. Portions were very generous - We ordered 5 dishes for 4 people and had leftovers. The chick pea and beet dishes were AH-MAZING! Service was super fast, food was delicious and the restaurant is in a really cool area. Would definitely come back to try more dishes!
Everything on the menu is great. We had 9 different plates and all were amazing.

Great unique food. The neighbourhood around the area seems to have quite a few good restaurants.

The pig face was pretty good.

Deep fried duck tongue with tuna was intestine too.

They had halibut on the menu as well which is seasonal I believe, but that was unique too.

The food was incredible the time I went here.  My friend and I ordered almost every single dish, and each one was just as incredible as the other.  That night, the two dishes that stood out the most were the octopus and the pig face.  These two were definitely my favorite out of the bunch we ordered.

For the octopus, it was a LOT of octopus, nothing was skimped out, and each bite I took, the flavors and the texture all came together.  It was a salad, so I was really impressed with how it turned out.

The pig face was also incredible, the egg adding the egg flavor and the softness of the meat was incredible.  Overall, the flavor and the texture here was great, and I loved it.

The service was great, the ambiance was great; I would definitely recommend anyone who is in Chicago to check this place out.
We've heard about the spot since we got to Chicago. We never thought it could live up to the tale. It did.

If you've read my other reviews you'll know it's extremely rare for me to give a 5-star rating, but in this case it could not be more warranted. I've been wanting to come here for several years and finally had an opportunity to cross it off my bucket list during a business trip in June 2015. I brought along two employees, one of which is extremely hard to please, and neither were disappointed (actually got some huge thank yous for introducing them).

We had called to make reservations over a month in advance for a Sunday evening, but they were booked solid. They still told us we could try and slide in, or opt to sit at the bar. Upon arrival it was pretty cozy with a sectioned off patio on the street out front. Nothing pretentious or overdone with regard to the decor - just a warm inviting place.

They have a solid beer and spirit selection, and while I went with a couple of bourbons and an IPA with the main meal I was pretty enticed by their signature drinks. The bartender brought us a complimentary order of the green beans which were served with a very savory sauce - good stuff.

We opted to go tapas style and started with the goat empanadas and the calamari over goat ricotta bruschetta, both of which were excellent. The empanadas were crisp with very tender goat inside. Not a huge fan of the blueberries served with this (also included crumbled goat cheese and crushed pecans over guacamole I believe), but it actually worked. The calamari bruschetta was truly great and highly recommended (menu description:  clam baguette. goat milk ricotta. goat bacon. green tomato). Wish I could have two more plates of it right now, but sadly I'm back in Atlanta.

We then shared two orders of the pork belly and the pork shank (they had sold out of the goat shank. WOW.  Both were phenomenal and a must-try if you only have one night in town.  Menu descriptions below, but sadly didn;t catch a shot of the pork belly dishes in my attachments.

grilled marinated pork belly
castelfranco. sauce green. blackberries

crisp braised pork shank
buttermilk dressing. grilled spring onion kimchee. naan

pics.caption: Calamari Bruschetta with Goat Cheese Ricotta

review.des:
So I was finally able to experience dining at Girl & the Goat. This place is so HARD TO GET A RESERVATION. Anyway when the boyfriend knew what weekend I was flying out to Chicago, he made a reservation...and the only one that was available was at 10:45PM! WHO EATS DINNER THAT LATE? hahahah i joke. Anyway, we got to the restaurant at around 10:15 and went to the bar and had I ordered a vodka tonic while the boyfriend ordered a beer. The ambiance was great!

Let's just say the night didn't go as planned...the boyfriend had a slight reaction to the beer...and we couldn't funny enjoy the food or the ambiance. So I can't really go in depth about the food experience because it was hampered by the BF's reaction to the beer. We didn't order to many dishes because 1. it was late and 2. the BF wasn't hungry. But here's our order:

1. Wood grilled broccoli - This dish was pretty tasty...just i'm not the hugest fan of bleu cheese other than that a pretty interesting dish

2. grilled cuttlefish - this was a pretty great dish i love me some cuttlefish! The ice lettuce that it came with balanced out the seafood-y flavor of the cuttlefish. YUM

3.grilled marinated pork belly - i think out of all the dishes this must have been my favorite. it was super great and all the dressings on the side (castelfranco - "sauce green" - and blood orange) really complete this dish.

I'd love to go back to Girl & the Goat and be able to get the full enjoyable experience.

Amazing! I went here the other night with 5 friends. We were a big party and they told us when we got there that there was a very small chance to get a table for the size of our party (they only have one table available for that big a party). However, they told us if we get spots in the lounge area that it is full service there as well. About 30 mins later all 6 of us were able to get a spot in the lounge area; mind you it was only about 6:30 at this point, super early for the normal West Loop dinner hour.

Between the six of us we got 12 different plates and each were AMAZING. We got the pan fried shishito peppers, kohlrabi salad, sweet potato pierogis, grilled octopus, calamari bruschetta, seared diver scallops, crispy beef short ribs, fried oysters, goat liver mousse, and goat empanadas.

Musts:
-shishito peppers were a great starter. There were also a lot of them on the plate so we were able to have some in between the other plates.
-fried oysters! Oh my goodness. One of the best bites of my life, and definitely the best bite of the night.
- fried octopus was fantastic!

Pros of the night:
- Each plate we ordered each of the six of us were able to have a taste.
- The service was great. They did a great job pacing our plates and explaining what each was when it was brought out.
- Service also recommended 2 plates per person in the party. We stuck to that suggestion and it worked out perfectly.
- The lounge was comfortable and set a great vibe for our night.

I will definitely be coming back!

I haven't been to the Girl and the Goat in a while but I look back on my visit as one of the most positive restaurant experiences I have had in my life. You have to be willing to experiment with unlikely flavor pairings in order to really appreciate the restaurant. I also highly recommend dining family style so that you can try multiple dishes. Go online right now and book a reservation for next month. You are sure to enjoy!

Ugh the Goat! I've been here 4 times and I'm just now writing a review for it? Forgive me fellow Yelpies. A couple months ago was my most recent and terrific goat experience. A handful of buddies and I went to celebrate my 24th birthday! It was such a gorgeous night!

We chose to sit in the little loungey couch area directly to the left of the entrance and behind the bar. It was sooooo dope. You get the same exact menu and service as the rest of the restaurant except you get to sit on really comfortable coaches. YES. Totally recommend that for anyone who wants to walk-in with no reservations and get seated right away!

The goat is really an amazing operation. I'm blown away with how well staffed and managed it is. Each and every server is fully capable of breaking down the dishes and all of its components at the drop of a dime. You would think that a couple of employees would slip through the cracks w a staff and space this large, but no - they literally all exemplify good attention to detail and offer great suggestions.

For my birthday dinner my friends and I actually ordered close to the whole menu. Haha but some of my favorite was the wood oven pig face, duck tongues, hamachi crudo and escargot dumplings! Much much much love to the goat family for making all of my visits here feel like my birthday! I'm looking very much forward to the new Duck Duck Goat coming to Chicago soon!

As if my review will ever get read among the 4,600 others, but it's worth leaving anyway.

I just went here (12/2015) after a few year absence, and this place is still so good and consistent.

The food is very, very rich so be prepared for that. But really, I've yet to be served a bad dish here; it typically ranges from good to great. Once in a while something will get overseasoned, but it's still good.

Some of my favorites are:

* Shisito peppers
* Fried oysters
* Goat empanadas
* Pig face
* Scallops

Those always seem to be on the menu over the past, what, 4-5 years now?

Came here for appetizers before dinner elsewhere. Reservations are definitely recommended, but if you get there right when it opens, they'll take walk-ins (around 4:30p-5p). We sat at the communal table next to the kitchen. Great seat to people watch.

1. Raw Kumamoto- I love raw oysters. I would have ordered 5 more just for myself if we were eating dinner here. The mignonette sauce that comes already dressed on it...mmmmmm. perfect.

2. Duck tongues, are fried and delicious! Perfect pairing with the poke and beans!  

3. Green beans- I didn't take a picture of this and my friend says, "you're totally going to regret not taking a picture." Uh...it's green beans. All good. And....as soon as I take a bite. Green beans with the sauce that it comes with, holy crap. Best green beans I've had! And...yeah, as we devoured all of it, I wish I would have taken a photo. lol

4. Marinated shrimp with snap peas. Kind of a disappointment compared to all the other plates. Pretty average. Nothing that sticks out.

Simply put, if you appreciate great quality food, well prepared then you shouldn't miss this place.

Reservations might be tricky, but take that as a sign of the great quality of the meal you can expect.

They hype is not misplaced, our server was friendly and knew the menu well.

The cocktails were great (I had the Local 75, others in the group tried different ones, but they were all happy).

The ham frittes were hit or miss for us.

Pig face and the pork shank were huge hits, it you are a carnivore and enjoy digging in, then these dishes are sure to please.

The cauliflower was surprisingly delicious.

The escargot dumplings were phenomenal, and the only thing better on the entire menu for us, were the beef short ribs. They will ruin every other meal for you for weeks to come, that's how soft and tender they are. Be prepared, and consider ordering two... You'll be glad you did!

We don't typically spend this much on meals, but that's more because there's nowhere of this quality where we live, so when we vacation we like to find the nicer places, and we were not disappointed at all.
My Bf took me here for my bday- amazing food- highly recommend sitting at the chef's table and watching the masters at work... oh and the green beans.

Tips - book about 2 months ahead to get a table. Check last minute - reservations may open up. We were lucky and got 11:30pm reservations on a Saturday night by booking same day.  

The restaurant is beautiful and food was delicious. Our table of four ordered Kolrabi Salad, chickpea fritter, duck tongues, wood oven roasted pig face, goat empanadas, and a clam dish with basil pesto, watercress, and toast with liver mousse.  For dessert, we shared the miso butterscotch budino. My favorite of these were the clams, duck tongue, pig face, and the miso butterscotch budino.  The other dishes were good but wouldn't be considered must orders for me considering that there are so many other good options on the menu. We were not super hungry because the 11:30 pm dinner was the fourth meal for the day. Since we were not as hungry, 6 dishes plus dessert were enough for us. The total cost without drinks and alcohol was $110.00.

pics.caption: Duck empanadas - smoked blueberry tapenade, avocado. It was good but I wish I had the opportunity to try the other goat dishes.
Duck Tongues - tuna and black bean poke, crispy wontons, piri piri. One of my favorite dishes of the night.

review.des: Just not as big of portions as I expected. But to be fair it was pretty good.

Visited Chicago for the first time from Miami and was told plenty of times to visit Girl and a goat! I was excited to score some reservations even if it was a Monday night!

We arrived and immediately loved the vibe of the place. We got there a little early so we took a seat in their "sitting" area that felt more like comfy loungy sofas where you can order drinks and food while you wait.

They sat us and we began to ORDER!

Goat empanadas- I have never had goat, but I couldn't go to this place without having some. They were yummy! They had a Mexican twist to them with queso fresco and corn arepa. The goat meat was shredded and full of flavor. Ok. I like goat. Lol

Octopus- my favorite dish of the night. I always order octopus if it's on a menu. So I am familiar with different tastes and textures. This octopus has got to be on my top 3. It was chopped up and sautéed with veggies and pistachios in a perfectly seasoned lemon sauce. It was perfection honestly.

Escargot Ravioli- was intrigued and excited to order this dish. It's original and never been done. We all know how to eat the garlic drenched escargot we have come to love but have you ever had it like this? Probably not...but you should! It was exactly what I envisioned...but I would call them dumplings rather than ravioli. The escargot were tender not chewy and had that earthy taste you either love or hate about them. I happen to love it. The miso based sauce was a perfect accompaniment!

Sagu- I appreciated this dish though it was not my favorite! I actually loved the pappardelle cut and the fact that you can taste its "homemade" pasta feel. It came with a mixture of goat and beef in a red sauce....that's all.

Pig face- I'm not a HUGE fan of pig. But I knew this was one of their signature dishes. Plus it came with a fried egg ;) I understood why it was one of their signature dishes as soon as I tasted it. The pork face was tender and not too pungent. It was cooked perfectly! The egg made my heart happy and so did this sweet sauce it came with!

So thank you Girl and a Goat for living up to the hype.

After getting engaged, my fiancé surprised me with reservations here only a week away. He had booked it months before. It was nice to only have to wait a week!

We came in during the start of a 24 hour snow storm and the place was packed and bustling. Rustic and a lot louder than I had imagined with a young crowd. We had 9:45 reservations, but had to wait about 15 minutes.

I was debating between 4 or 5 stars. Since it's a place with such a great reputation I thought about it a little while and decided on 4. They can afford it! 5 is just perfection in terms of what I expected.

The food was excellent and items aren't outrageously priced. We split everything and indulged a bit since we had a gift card here from my sister and her fiancé - thank you!

1. Roasted cauliflower: yum and large portion - packed some to-go
2. Chickpea fritters: also delicious
3. Scallops: new dish that day - perfectly cooked!
4. Pig face: I was hesitant but it's a patty and the meat is quite tasty - just get it
5. Monkfish: very tasty
6. Goat: also very nice
7. Dark chocolate / salted caramel ice cream: BOMB

We had really nice service from the bartenders, our host who seated us, and our waitress.

A couple things would've been nice: coat check upon getting in and waiting, holding them. They took them once we were seated though. I refilled my wine the whole night.

Other than that, it's an experience and I definitely recommend it for people who like trying new things - there were picky eaters next to us and they seemed to be missing out.

Make reservations early ... but you knew that already.

Good food. Nice atmosphere. Chill yet happening. Dark wood paneling. Servers wearing t-shirts w/ funny pork puns, but they really know their sh*t.

Also seems to be a happening post-work dinner spot for a the finance crowd - I came w/ my parents but were surrounded by guys in suits. Our server, who was pretty cute I'll admit, did spend a good amount of time flirting w/ them. I understand though - gotta make rent!

MUST-HAVES: Diver Scallops, Pig Face, Pumpkin Pie Gelato!!

* double barrel - 2.5 stars
(cocktail: old forester bourbon, pierre ferrand 1840 cognac, blenheim gin, lemon, angostura bitters. $13)
I told our server what I like (light, refreshing, tart cocktails, maybe w/ ginger) & she recommended this bourbon based drink. However, it was just WAY too strong for me (I am a lightweight, but I can normally at least handle a heavier drink!). She was kind enough to replace this w/ my second choice below.

* best of three - 4 stars
(russian standard vodka. pimm's #1. cucumber. lime. $13)
Much lighter, more refreshing, tart than the double barrel - I liked it!

* chickpea fritters - 3.5 stars

(stewed apple-tomatillo . prairie fruits chevre)
Nicely done, great flavors, the fritters are incredibly soft & moist. Just wish there was more texture/crisp to the fritters - it ends up being more of a 'mushy' dish, as delicious as it is. I just usually associate a good crunch w/ fritters.

* diver scallops  - 5 stars
yelp.com/biz_photos/girl…
(pumpkin brandade . fried brussels sprouts . spiced pecans . pomegranate)
WOW. Every bite was an orgasm in my mouth. Not only were the scallops themselves seared perfectly, but EVERY SINGLE ingredient added a unique twist the melded together to form this multiple-orgasm of a dish.

* escargot ravioli - 3 stars

A little disappointing. The crunchy pieces were good for texture, but the ravioli itself had very little filling (you wouldn't even be able to tell it's escargot - tasted like mushroom). The broth is very thin & simple, w/ a strong savory flavor. Just not much to brag about.

A unique mix of flavors. There were only 2 ribs, which made it hard to share between the three of us, but the meat that was on the plate was pretty good - tender, great flavor.

For how much people rave about this, I really don't think it was that great. Yes the green beans themselves were nice & crispy, but they were also very oily, & the fish sauce added a kind of sour tang that I really don't think is the best for complementing this vegetable.

Once again.. I was disappointed. Maybe the bar was just set really high for these two veggie dishes w/ everyone recommending it in their reviews. The cauliflower I found to be a little on the soggy side (I'm Chinese &  prefer my vegetables crispy) & the flavor not particularly memorable.

My husband and I finally experienced Girl and the Goat on a Tuesday in January. We made reservations 2 months in advance! I was extremely excited yet my husband seemed underwhelmed. He read all of the reviews about this being "the best restaurant ever" and was not convinced he would be able to say one restaurant was "the best restaurant ever"! Fast-forward two hours and we were both extremely pleased! While we do not want to say this is "the best restaurant ever", we could not think of a better food experience!

Service - our service was very good! We asked a lot of questions and our server answered all of them spending quite a good bit of time with us (pre-food).

Food - Amazing!! We ordered 4 items (all made to share) and a dessert. We did not get a bread. I was on the fence as some reviews said you must try a bread. They look delicious, but we opted to save space for other items! We ordered the goat empanadas, crispy short ribs, the green beans and the pork shank. delicious!! the goat empanadas were my least favorite - however, they were very, very good! This speaks to the level of everything else in my opinion. The crispy shortribs were cubed, crispy and fell apart perfectly. This was a lighter dish, which you would not usually expect paired with avocado and grapefruit - excellent! The green beans (large portion) and the pork shank were my favorite!! I would get both again!! The sauce that comes with the pork shank I would buy by the bottle! The pork shank was extremely tender. We pulled the meat right off of the bone. We ended the evening with GATG's version of pineapple upside down cake. I'll admit I am a huge fan of pineapple upside down cake and not a huge fan of chocolate cake. I was not disappointed! The dessert was amazing!!!

I highly encourage everyone to book reservations today! Tip: we were told there are often seats at the bar and lounge (first come first serve) earlier and later in the evening.

This was quite possibly the best meal I have ever had!!

I have been here several times since this place opened. I really enjoyed the first time I went but now I am wondering whether it was because I had followed Stephanie Izzard on Top Chef and was being a fan boy or I believed the hype. All I know is that the food is good but overpriced and you have to wait every time you come here. They also change the menu and took off my favorite garbanzo hushpuppies!! Seating is also variable...you can get your own table if you wait or have to share if you don't want to be here all night. Definitely a nice place for a special occasion but not my choice for my weekly dinner night out.

Amazing and innovative menu, delicious and unique flavors, great service, classy and relaxed atmosphere. Girl & the Goat is one of the best restaurants in Chicago. Top Chef winner Stephanie Izard does not dissapoint!

We had reservations for a group of four on a weeknight, and were glad we did because it was a full house.

Braised beef tongue - an amazing dish, the beef was cooked well and enjoyed the texture and flavors with masa, beef vinaigrette, salsa verda.

Wood oven roasted pig face - so delicious and a must try. served with sunny side up egg, cilantro, and blended with flavors of red wine-maple, potato stix.

Escargot ravioli with bacon - snail and bacon together equals heaven in my mouth! loved the tamarind-miso sauce.

Bittersweet chocolate - loved the creamy and rich flavors of this dessert.

Miso butterscotch budino - I really enjoyed this dessert with it's sweet and caramel flavors with the custard pudding goodness.

Service was friendly, professional and prompt. Definitely make sure you make reservations as this place is popular and gets busy for dinnertime, especially with a bigger group. Prices are a bit steeper but is worth the quality and innovation of the food.

They even have the most adorable little logo of a little cartoon Goat, which I love. What is there not to love about Girl & the Goat?

Overall I really enjoyed my experience at this restaurant. The food is amazing, service is flawless and we all had a great time.
